archive.cjoker: /// XHALT macro will send the event 0x4a17 to the debug host and /// will stall the XCPU. The XCPU can be released from Coolwatcher /// by issuing a xrbp command. #define XHALT { \ asm("nop "); \ asm("nop "); \ asm("nop "); \ asm("nop "); \ while (hwp_debugHost->event != DEBUG_HOST_EVENT0_SEMA); \ hwp_debugHost->event = 0x4a17; \ hwp_sysCtrl->XCpu_Dbg_BKP |= SYS_CTRL_STALLED; \ asm("nop "); \ asm("nop "); \ asm("nop "); \ asm("nop "); \ }

bits.name: Enable
bits.comment: Enable (start) the Monitor.

option.name: Single_Shot
option.comment: Monitor disable itself after the time window expires.

option.name: Mean
option.comment: get use counter value in the read register, sum the latency and count the number of access

option.name: Max
option.comment: get maximum of use counter and read register per time window, get maximum of latency per access.

bits.name: Target
bits.comment: Define the element to monitor, it can be the BUS, a master, a slave or a special signal from Debug_Port: Signal_Select1.

option.name: BB_IFC
option.comment: Masters

option.name: BB_Mem_Ext
option.comment: Slaves

option.name: Signal_Select1
option.comment: Signal (counted as Slaves, the signal is used as a select signal)

bits.name: Time_Window
bits.comment: Define the duration af a Time Window

option.name: TW_1kC
option.comment: 1024 System clock cycle

option.name: TW_32kC
option.comment: 32768 System clock cycle

option.name: TW_1MC
option.comment: 1048576 System clock cycle

option.name: TW_16MC
option.comment: 16777216 System clock cycle

option.name: TW_1F
option.comment: 1 Frame (TCU must be running)

option.name: TW_26F
option.comment: 26 Frames (TCU must be running)

option.name: TW_52F

option.name: TW_104F

bits.name: Access_Count
bits.comment:
Access counter reader (full 24bits view, 8 lower bit are also readable in latency register).
For masters: count the number of access
For slaves: count the number of access by checking the falling edge of select signal.

bits.name: Use
bits.comment:
Bus usage counter reader.
For the bus: Count the cycles when the bus is used (by any master)
For masters: Count cycles when selected master is granted
For slaves: Count cycles when select signal is high.

bits.name: Latency
bits.comment:
Latency counter reader (0xffffff means overflow)
In Max mode, it's updated after each access, else it's adding the latency from all access in the time window
For slaves it counts the duration of each access (in mean mode, it will give the same value as Use)
For masters: count cycles between rise of request and first access.
For slaves: count the duration of access by counting the high cycles. In that case it is equivalent to the use counter except in max mode where it counts the max by access not by time window.

bits.name: Access_Cnt
bits.comment:
Number of access (0xff means overflow)
In max mode: 0 if no access, 1 if at least 1 access.
In mean mode: it counts the number of access during the time window.
For masters: count the number of access
For slaves: count the number of access by checking the falling edge of select signal.
It is the same as the Access_Count register except that the value is saturated on 8 bits. It's repeated here to garanty coherence with Latency to enable calculs of Mean Latency by doing the following operation:
Mean_Latency = Latency/Access_Cnt .

bits.name: First Poly
bits.comment:
This field is used for setting the first polynomial to encode or the CRC computation
First polynomial to encode :
000 = G0
001 = G1
010 = G2
011 = G3
100 = G4
101 = G5
110 = G6
111 = No polynomial code used (input connected to output)
Cyclic code :
000 = D8 + D4 + D3 + D2 + 1
001 = D3 + D + 1
010 = D14 + D13 + D5 + D3 + D2 +1
011 = D6 + D5 + D3 + D2 + D1 + 1
100 = D10 + D8 + D6 + D5 + D4 + D2 + 1
101 = D16 + D12 + D5 + 1
110 = (D23 + 1)*(D17 + D3 + 1)
111 = reserved

bits.name: Second Poly
bits.comment:
Second polynomial to encode :
000 = G0
001 = G1
010 = G2
011 = G3
100 = G4
101 = G5
110 = G6
111 = No polynomial code used (input connected to output)

bits.name: Third Poly
bits.comment:
Third polynomial to encode:
000 = G0
001 = G1
010 = G2
011 = G3
100 = G4
101 = G5
110 = G6
111 = No polynomial code used (input connected to output)

bits.name: Fourth Poly
bits.comment:
Fourth polynomial to encode:
000 = G0
001 = G1
010 = G2
011 = G3
100 = G4
101 = G5
110 = G6
111 = No polynomial code used (input connected to output)

bits.name: Fith Poly
bits.comment:
Fith polynomial to encode:
000 = G0
001 = G1
010 = G2
011 = G3
100 = G4
101 = G5
110 = G6
111 = No polynomial code used (input connected to output)

bits.name: Sixth Poly
bits.comment:
Sixth polynomial to encode:
000 = G0
001 = G1
010 = G2
011 = G3
100 = G4
101 = G5
110 = G6
111 = No polynomial code used (input connected to output)

bits.name: RSC Poly
bits.comment:
RSC (Recursive Systematic Convolutional) polynomial code:
000 = G0
001 = G1
010 = G2
011 = G3
100 = G4
101 = G5
110 = G6
111 = No RSC

bits.name: NB Poly
bits.comment:
Number of polynomial code to process:
0x0 = 0
0x1 = 1 (First Poly)
0x2 = 2 (First poly and second Poly)
0x3 = 3 (First poly, second poly, third Poly)
0x6 = 6 (first Poly to sixth Poly)
0x7 = reserved

bits.name: Enable Puncturing
bits.comment:
Enable Puncturing
0 = No puncturing (puncturing disabled)
1 = Enable puncturing

bits.name: Bit number
bits.comment:
Number of inputs bits to process
0x01 = 1
0x02 = 2
0x03 = 3
...
0xFD = 253
0xFE = 254
0xFF = 255
0x100 = 256
...
0x1BF = 447
0x1C0 = 448

bits.name: Enable
bits.comment: When 1 the bb_cp2 is running

bits.name: LRAM Address
bits.comment:
LRAM address for the next access
Automatically incremented after each access

bits.name: LRAM Select
bits.comment:
Select LRAM for the next access
0 = Puncturing LRAM
1 = Data LRAM

bits.name: CRC code
bits.comment: CRC code LSB bits

bits.name: CRC code
bits.comment: CRC code MSB bits

bits.name: CP2 Select
bits.comment:
CP2 register access selection bit
0= All registers are only accessible through the APB bus
1= All registers are only accessible by the BCPU through the CP2 bus

bits.name: LRAM Data
bits.comment:
LRAM Data. This register is used for access to the puncturing LRAM or to the Data LRAM.
All access into this register, increment the LRAM_ADDR register.

struct.name: ch
struct.comment:
The Channel 0 conveys data from the AIF to the memory.
The Channel 1 conveys data from the memory to the AIF.
These Channels only exist with Voice Option.

bits.name: enable
bits.comment:
Channel Enable, write one in this bit enable the channel.
When the channel is enabled, for a peripheral to memory transfer the DMA wait request from peripheral to start transfer.

bits.name: disable
bits.comment:
Channel Disable, write one in this bit disable the channel.
When writing one in this bit, the current AHB transfer and current APB transfer (if one in progress) is completed and the channel is then disabled.

bits.name: auto_disable
bits.comment: Automatic channel Disable. When this bit is set, the channel is automatically disabled at the next interrupt.

bits.name: enable
bits.comment: When 1 the channel is enabled

bits.name: fifo_empty
bits.comment: When 1 the fifo is empty

bits.name: cause_ief
bits.comment: Cause interrupt End of FIFO.

bits.name: cause_ihf
bits.comment: Cause interrupt Half of FIFO.

bits.name: cause_i4f
bits.comment: Cause interrupt Quarter of FIFO.

bits.name: cause_i3_4f
bits.comment: Cause interrupt Three Quarter of FIFO.

bits.name: ief
bits.comment: End of FIFO interrupt status bit.

bits.name: ihf
bits.comment: Half of FIFO interrupt status bit.

bits.name: i4f
bits.comment: Quarter of FIFO interrupt status bit.

bits.name: i3_4f
bits.comment: Three Quarter of FIFO interrupt status bit.

bits.name: start_addr
bits.comment: AHB Start Address. This field represent the start address of the FIFO located in RAM.

bits.name: Fifo_Size
bits.comment:
Fifo size in bytes, max 32kBytes.
The size of the fifo must be a multiple of 16 (The four LSB are always zero).

bits.name: end_fifo
bits.comment: END FIFO Mask interrupt. When one this interrupt is enabled.

bits.name: half_fifo
bits.comment: HALF FIFO Mask interrupt. When one this interrupt is enabled.

bits.name: quarter_fifo
bits.comment: QUARTER FIFO Mask interrupt. When one this interrupt is enabled.

bits.name: three_quarter_fifo
bits.comment: THREE QUARTER FIFO Mask interrupt. When one this interrupt is enabled.

bits.name: end_fifo
bits.comment: Write one to clear end of fifo interrupt.

bits.name: half_fifo
bits.comment: Write one to clear half of fifo interrupt.

bits.name: quarter_fifo
bits.comment: Write one to clear Quarter fifo interrupt.

bits.name: three_quarter_fifo
bits.comment: Write one to clear Three Quarter fifo interrupt.

bits.name: cur_ahb_addr
bits.comment: Current AHB address value. The nine MSB bit is constant and equal to the PAGE_ADDR field in the IFC_CH_AHB_START_ADDR register.

bits.name: enable
bits.comment:
Channel Enable, write one in this bit enable the channel.
When the channel is enabled, for a peripheral to memory transfer the DMA wait request from peripheral to start transfer.

bits.name: disable
bits.comment:
Channel Disable, write one in this bit disable the channel.
When writing one in this bit, the current AHB transfer and current APB transfer (if one in progress) is completed and the channel is then disabled.

bits.name: burst_size
bits.comment:
Burst size on AHB bus
0 = Single access
1 = burst Access (4 words).

bits.name: fifo_mode
bits.comment:
Set FIFO mode .
0 = no fifo mode, transfer stop when the current transfer counter reaches zero. Channel must be re-enabled for future transfer.
1 = Fifo mode, when the current AHB address counter reaches the end address of the FIFO. AHB address counter is reloaded with the initial value. In FIFO mode channel is not disabled at the end of the transfer.

bits.name: enable
bits.comment: In no fifo mode the channel is automatically disabled at the end of the transfer. In fifo mode the channel is disabled only when disabled write is performed in the control register.

bits.name: fifo_empty
bits.comment: When 1 the fifo is empty

bits.name: cause_itc
bits.comment: Cause interrupt End of TC.

bits.name: cause_ief
bits.comment: Cause interrupt End of FIFO.

bits.name: cause_ihtc
bits.comment: Cause interrupt Half Transfer Count (This interruption is generated when the IFC has transferred 96 word).

bits.name: itc
bits.comment: End of TC interrupt status bit.

bits.name: ief
bits.comment: End of FIFO interrupt status bit.

bits.name: ihtc
bits.comment: Half TC interrupt status bit.

bits.name: cur_tc
bits.comment: Current value of transfer counter.

bits.name: start_addr
bits.comment: AHB Start Address. This field represent the start address in the page. The AHB FIFO start address is the concatenation of of Page_ADDR and Start_Addr field.

bits.name: page_addr
bits.comment: AHB PAGE Address. These nine bits is the MSB bit of the start AHB FIFO address. These bits are not incremented during the transfer.

bits.name: end_addr
bits.comment: The last page address of the FIFO, it is the first address not used for the FIFO. The start address of the FIFO is specified by the register AHB_ADDR and the last page address of the FIFO is specified by this field. The size of the fifo (END_ADDR - START_ADDR) must be a multiple of burst of 4x32-bits.

bits.name: page_addr
bits.comment: AHB PAGE Address. Read only equal to the page_addr field in ch2_start_addr register.

bits.name: tc
bits.comment:
Transfer Count
In no FIFO mode, this bit indicated the transfer size in 32-bits word to perform. Up to 255 32-bits word per transfer.
In FIFO mode this field define, after how many transfer an interrupt in generated.

bits.name: end_tc
bits.comment: End TC Mask interrupt. When one this interrupt is enabled.

bits.name: end_fifo
bits.comment: END FIFO Mask interrupt. When one this interrupt is enabled.

bits.name: half_tc
bits.comment: Half TC Mask interrupt. When one this interrupt is enabled

bits.name: end_tc
bits.comment: Write one to clear end of TC interrupt.

bits.name: end_fifo
bits.comment: Write one to clear end of FIFO interrupt.

bits.name: half_fifo
bits.comment: Write one to clear end of Half TC interrupt.

bits.name: cur_ahb_addr
bits.comment: Current AHB address value. The nine MSB bit is constant and equal to the PAGE_ADDR field in the IFC_CH_AHB_START_ADDR register.

bits.name: enable
bits.comment:
Channel Enable, write one in this bit enable the channel.
When the channel is enabled, for a peripheral to memory transfer the DMA wait request from peripheral to start transfer.

bits.name: disable
bits.comment:
Channel Disable, write one in this bit disable the channel.
When writing one in this bit, the current AHB transfer and current APB transfer (if one in progress) is completed and the channel is then disabled.

bits.name: enable
bits.comment: In no fifo mode the channel is automatically disabled at the end of the transfer. In fifo mode the channel is disabled only when disabled write is performed in the control register.

bits.name: fifo_empty
bits.comment: When 1 the fifo is empty

bits.name: cause_itc
bits.comment: Cause interrupt End of TC.

bits.name: itc
bits.comment: End of TC interrupt status bit.

bits.name: cur_tc
bits.comment: Current value of transfer counter.

bits.name: start_addr
bits.comment: AHB Start Address.

bits.name: tc
bits.comment:
Transfer Count
this bit indicated the transfer size in 32-bits word to perform. Up to 255 32-bits word per transfer.

bits.name: end_tc
bits.comment: End TC Mask interrupt. When one this interrupt is enabled.

bits.name: end_tc
bits.comment: Write one to clear end of TC interrupt.

bits.name: cur_ahb_addr
bits.comment: Current AHB address value.

reg.name: Cause
reg.comment:
If cause is not null and interrupt are enabled then the interrupt line 0 is driven on the system CPU.
The cause for the Irq sources, one bit for each module's irq source.
The cause is the actual Irq source masked by the mask register.

reg.name: Status
reg.comment:
The status for the level Irq sources, one bit for each module's irq source.
The status reflect the actual Irq source.

reg.name: Mask_Set
reg.comment:
Writing '1' sets the corresponding bit in the mask register to '1'.
Reading gives the value of the mask register.

reg.name: Mask_Clear
reg.comment:
Writing '1' clears the corresponding bit in the mask register to '0'.
Reading gives the value of the mask register.

bits.name: Main_IRQ
bits.comment:
This is the Main Irq source it drive the system CPU interrupt line 0.
This bit comes from the modules irq and is masked by the Mask and SC registers.

bits.name: Debug_IRQ
bits.comment: This is the debug Irq source, the value written here drives the system CPU interrupt line 4.

bits.name: Host_IRQ
bits.comment:
This is the Host Irq source it drive the system CPU interrupt line 5.
This bit is controlled by the host internal register.

bits.name: IntEnable_Status
bits.comment: Status of the Interrupt enable semaphore bit.

bits.name: IntEnable
bits.comment:
Interrupt enable semaphore, used for critical section.
Read returns its value and then clears it to '0' disabling interrupts.
Write the read value to restore the previous state, this will exit the critical section.

reg.name: WakeUp_Mask
reg.comment: Each bit to '1' in that registers allows the correcponding interrupt to wake up the System CPU (i.e.: Reenable it's clock, see CLOCK_BB_ENABLE and CLOCK_BB_DISABLE registers in general registers section)

bits.name: Sleep
bits.comment: Writing '1' to this bit will put the BCPU to sleep (i.e.: Disable it's clock, see CLOCK_BB_ENABLE and CLOCK_BB_DISABLE registers in general registers section)

reg.name: Pulse_Mask_Set
reg.comment:
Writing '1' sets the corresponding bit in the mask register to '1'.
Reading gives the value of the mask register.

reg.name: Pulse_Mask_Clr
reg.comment:
Writing '1' clears the corresponding bit in the mask register to '0'.
Reading gives the value of the mask register.

reg.name: Pulse_Clear
reg.comment:
Writing '1' clears the corresponding Pulse IRQ.
Pulse IRQ are set by the modules and cleared here.

reg.name: Pulse_Status
reg.comment:
The status for the Pulse Irq sources, one bit for each module's irq source.
The status reflect the actual Irq source.

memory.name: ram_array
memory.comment: Baseband side internal memory, also used by accelerators.

bits.name: Snapshot
bits.comment: Value of snapshots, snapshot value is automatically incremented at frame interrupt. This snapshot counter wrap at the value given by Snapshot_Cfg.

bits.name: Snapshot_Cfg
bits.comment: Number of snapshot.

option.name: Wrap_2
option.comment: The snapshot counter as Two values : 0,1.

option.name: Wrap_3
option.comment: The snapshot counter as Three values : 0,1,2.

bits.name: X_Irq0_Cause
bits.comment:
When read from the Xcpu, this return the cause of interruption, basically the set/clear register X_Irq0 part masked with X_Irq0_Mask.
When read from the Bcpu, returns 0.

bits.name: X_Irq0_Mask_Set
bits.comment:
When read: returns the value of the X_Irq0_Mask register.
When written: value is used as a bit field, each bit at '1' sets the corresponding bit in the X_Irq0_Mask register, bits at '0' leave the corresponding bit unchanged.
The X_Irq0_Mask masks the set/clear register to trigger interrupts on the XCPU using line 0.

The X_Irq1_Mask masks the set/clear register to trigger interrupts on the XCPU using line 1.

When written, value is used as a bit field, each bit at '1' clears the corresponding bit in the set/clear register, bits at '0' leave the corresponding bit unchanged.

reg.name: AckReg_Clr
reg.comment: If accesses to AckReg_Set and AckReg_Clr registers are done simultaneously from both CPUs and affecting the same bits, the priority is given to set a bit.

bits.name: Acknowledge_Clr
bits.comment:
When read, returns the value of the set/clear register.
When written, value is used as a bit field, each bit at '1' clears the corresponding bit in the set/clear register, bits at '0' leave the corresponding bit unchanged.

reg.name: Data
reg.comment:
The BCpu cache is accessible only when it is disabled or the cpu is stalled.
The bits "9:4" of the address select the line.
If the Tag at the corresponding line is valid, the bits "24:10" of the tag are the corresponding address bits.
The bits "3:0" of the address select the Data in the line.

reg.name: Line
reg.comment:
The BCpu tags are accessible only when the corresponding cache is disabled or the cpu is stalled.
The bits "9:4" of the address select the line

bits.name: Tag
bits.comment: The Tag represents the bits "24:10" of the address present in the corresponding cache Line.

bits.name: Valid
bits.comment: When 1 the Tag is valid

bits.name: start
bits.comment: Control the Bist: Write 1 to start Bist test.

bits.name: enable
bits.comment: Status of the Bist: 1 if bist module enabled, 0 if disabled.

bits.name: fail
bits.comment: Status of the Bist: 1 if bist module failed, 0 if bist success.

bits.name: mem_addr
bits.comment: Memory base address to test.

bits.name: mem_size
bits.comment: Memory size to test.

bits.name: mem_width
bits.comment: Memory width to test.

option.name: MEM_WIDTH_DEFAULT
option.comment: When "00", Select Memory width: Word (addr increment +1).

option.name: MEM_WIDTH_8
option.comment: When "01", select Memory width: Byte (addr increment +1).

option.name: MEM_WIDTH_16
option.comment: When "10", Select Memory width: Half-Word (addr increment +2).

option.name: MEM_WIDTH_32
option.comment: When "11", Select Memory width: Word (addr increment +4).

bits.name: data_mask
bits.comment: Mask memory data for bist comparison.

bits.name: Enable
bits.comment: Writing a '1' in this register triggers an A5 process. Ignored if the module is already processing. Auto-reset bit

bits.name: Algorithm
bits.comment: Selects the appropriate algorithm

bits.name: Running
bits.comment: 1 when running, 0 in other case.

bits.name: Data_Blk_Rdy
bits.comment: 1 when data block ready (Ciphering processed), reseted when the data register is read.

bits.name: Kc_Lsb
bits.comment: Cipher key Kc, LSB bit [31:0].

bits.name: Kc_Msb
bits.comment: Cipher key Kc, MSB bit [31:0].

bits.name: Count
bits.comment: Count register, this field represent the TDMA frame number.

bits.name: Data_blk2
bits.comment: Data block2 bit[31:0]

bits.name: Data_blk2
bits.comment: Data block2 bit[63:32]

bits.name: Data_blk2
bits.comment: Data block2 bit[95:64]

bits.name: Data_blk2
bits.comment: Data block2 bit[113:96]

bits.name: Addr
bits.comment: Address of data to be read or written.

bits.name: Size
bits.comment:
These two bits indicates element data size.
when "00" = "byte".
when "01" = "half word".
when "10" = "word".

bits.name: Write_H
bits.comment:
This bit indicates command is read or write.
when "0" = "Read".
when "1" = "Write".

bits.name: data
bits.comment: Those bits are data to be read or written by IFC.

bits.name: event0_sema
bits.comment:
When read, this bit is used for event semaphore.
'0' = no new event should be programed.
'1' = no pending event, new event is authorised.
If host is not enabled, this bit is always '1'. However in this case, any event written will be ignored.
When Write, this bit is the least significant bit for a 32-bit event.

bits.name: event31_1
bits.comment: These bits combined with bit0 consists a 32-bit event number. If a new event is written before the previous event has been sent, it will be ignored.

bits.name: force_on
bits.comment: When '1', force the debug host on, use clock UART if clock host is not detected.

bits.name: Clk_Host_On
bits.comment:
This bit indicates if clock host is detected to be on or not.
'0' = no clock host.
'1' = clock host detected.

bits.name: h2p_status
bits.comment: Status which can be written through debug uart interface into a debug host internal register and read by APB.

bits.name: h2p_status_rst
bits.comment: write in this bit will reset h2p status register.

bits.name: p2h_status
bits.comment: Status which can be written by APB and read through debug uart interface as a debug host internal register.

bits.name: xcpu_irq
bits.comment:
when write '1', clear the xcpu irq level which is programmed in a debug host internal register, this bit is automatic cleared.
when read, get the xcpu irq status.

bits.name: bcpu_irq
bits.comment:
when write '1', clear the bcpu irq level which is programmed in a debug host internal register, this bit is automatic cleared.
when read, get the bcpu irq status.

bits.name: Debug_Reset
bits.comment:
Debug host generated reset. Signal to system control. Active high.
Write '1' to this bit will set it to '1'.
Reseted by signal sys_rst_others (host).

bits.name: XCPU_Force_Reset
bits.comment:
Force XCPU Reset signal. Active high. Hold XCPU in reset state until this bit is cleared.
Write '1' to this bit will set it to '1'.
Reseted by signal rst_host_reg.

bits.name: Force_Wakeup
bits.comment:
Force wakeup. Active high.
Write '1' to this bit will set it to '1'.
Reseted by signal rst_host_reg.

bits.name: Force_BP_XCPU
bits.comment:
Force XCPU breakpoint. Active high. Hold its value until this bit is cleared. When Read, Get the status of Force breakpoint sent back by XCPU.
Write '1' to this bit will set it to '1'.
Reseted by signal sys_rst_others (host).

bits.name: Force_BP_BCPU
bits.comment:
Force BCPU breakpoint. Active high. Hold its value until this bit is cleared. When Read, Get the status of Force breakpoint sent back by BCPU.
Write '1' to this bit will set it to '1'.
Reseted by signal sys_rst_others (host).

bits.name: IT_XCPU
bits.comment:
When write '1, generate a level IRQ to XCPU. Write '0 is ignored. This IRQ can be cleared by written APB register. When Read, Get the IRQ status.
Write '1' to this bit will set it to '1'.
Reseted by signal sys_rst_others (host).

bits.name: IT_BCPU
bits.comment:
When write '1', generate a level IRQ to BCPU. Write '0' is ignored. This IRQ can be cleared by written APB register. When Read, Get the IRQ status.
Write '1' to this bit will set it to '1'.
Reseted by signal sys_rst_others (host).

bits.name: Debug_Port_Lock
bits.comment:
Lock Debug port set.
Write '1' to this bit will set it to '1'.
Reseted by signal rst_host_reg.

bits.name: XCPU_Force_Reset
bits.comment:
Force XCPU Reset signal. Active high. Hold XCPU in reset state until this bit is cleared.
Write '1' to this bit will clear it to '0'.
Reseted by signal rst_host_reg.

bits.name: Force_Wakeup
bits.comment:
Force wakeup. Active high.
Write '1' to this bit will clear it to '0'.
Reseted by signal rst_host_reg.

bits.name: Force_BP_XCPU
bits.comment:
Force XCPU breakpoint. Active high. Hold its value until this bit is cleared. When Read, Get the status of Force breakpoint sent back by XCPU.
Write '1' to this bit will clear it to '0'.
Reseted by signal sys_rst_others (host).

bits.name: Force_BP_BCPU
bits.comment:
Force BCPU breakpoint. Active high. Hold its value until this bit is cleared. When Read, Get the status of Force breakpoint sent back by BCPU.
Write '1' to this bit will clear it to '0'.
Reseted by signal sys_rst_others (host).

bits.name: Debug_Port_Lock
bits.comment:
Lock Debug port clear.
Write '1' to this bit will clear it to '0'.
Reseted by signal sys_rst_others (host).

bits.name: CFG_CLK
bits.comment:
Debug host clock divider. The serial clock is generated by dividing 14,7456MHz Host Clock by (CFG_CLK+2). So By default, the serial clock is 14,7456MHz / (2+2) = 3,6864 MHz which corresponds to the 921,6K Baud-rate.
Reseted by signal rst_host_reg.

bits.name: Disable_Uart_H
bits.comment:
When '1', Disable Normal Uart functional group.
This bit is set to '1' when break.
Reseted by signal rst_host_reg.

bits.name: Disable_IFC_H
bits.comment:
When '1', Ignore IFC write and read access so only debug host internal is accessible.
This bit is set to '1' when break.
Reseted by signal rst_host_reg.

bits.name: Debug_Host_Sel
bits.comment:
The usage of this bit is deternimed by the specific chip.
Can be used as Debug_Port_Lock register to protect some register change by the regular software while debug hosr is used to set thoses registers to specific values.
Reseted by signal rst_host_reg.

bits.name: Force_Prio_H
bits.comment:
When '1', force the Debug Uart to have priority on TX.
Reseted by signal rst_host_reg.

bits.name: CRC
bits.comment:
This bit represents that an CRC error has occured in commands received by Debug Host. Once set to '1', it will keep the value until this register is clearred by write '1'.
'0' = no CRC error.
'1' = CRC error.
Reseted by signal sys_rst_others (host).

bits.name: FC_Fifo_Ovf
bits.comment:
This bit represents if the 16-byte Flow Control FIFO has an overflow error. This status will be kept until a RX break is received.
'0' = no Flow Control Overflow Error.
'1' = Flow Control Overflow Error.
Reseted by signal sys_rst_others (host).

bits.name: STATUS
bits.comment:
These bits can be read by APB and write by host. Corresponds to APB register STATUS. They can also be reseted to zeros by APB command. (see details in debug host APB register mapping)
Reseted by signal sys_rst_others (host).

bits.name: STATUS
bits.comment:
These bits can be written by APB and read by host. Corresponds to APB register STATUS.
Write to Bit 0 can reset the P2H status.
Reseted by signal sys_rst_others (host).

ireg.name: AHB_SYS_HMBURSREQ
ireg.comment: Debug information of system side AHB bus status.

bits.name: SYS_IFC_HMBURSREQ
bits.comment: The bit represent Sys Ifc HMBURSREQ.

bits.name: SYS_DMA_HMBURSREQ
bits.comment: The bit represent Dma HMBURSREQ.

bits.name: SYS_AHB2AHB_HMBURSREQ

bits.name: USBC_HMBURSREQ
bits.comment: The bit represent USBC HMBURSREQ.

bits.name: GOUDA_HMBURSREQ
bits.comment: The bit represent GOUDA HMBURSREQ.

bits.name: SYS_IFC_HMGRANT
bits.comment: The bit represent Sys Ifc HMGRANT.

bits.name: SYS_DMA_HMGRANT
bits.comment: The bit represent Dma HMGRANT.

bits.name: SYS_AHB2AHB_HMGRANT
bits.comment: The bit represent Sys Ahb2ahb HMGRANT.

bits.name: XCPU_HMGRANT

bits.name: USBC_HMGRANT
bits.comment: The bit represent USBC HMGRANT.

bits.name: GOUDA_HMGRANT
bits.comment: The bit represent GOUDA HMGRANT.

ireg.name: AHB_SYS_HSEL
ireg.comment: Debug information of AHB bus status HSEL.

bits.name: SYS_MEM_EXT_HSEL
bits.comment: The bit represent Sys MEM_EXT HSEL.

bits.name: SYS_MEM_INT_HSEL
bits.comment: The bit represent Sys MEM_INT HSEL.

bits.name: SYS_IFC_HSEL
bits.comment: The bit represent Sys Ifc HSEL.

bits.name: SYS_AHB2AHB_HSEL
bits.comment: The bit represent Sys Ahb2ahb HSEL.

bits.name: SYS_USBC_HSEL
bits.comment: The bit represent USBC HSEL.

bits.name: SYS_GOUDA_HSEL
bits.comment: The bit represent GOUDA HSEL.

bits.name: SYS_XCPU_RAM_HSEL
bits.comment: The bit represent XCPU RAM HSEL.

bits.name: SYS_IFC_HSREADY
bits.comment: The bit represent Sys Ifc HSREADY.

bits.name: SYS_MEM_HSREADY
bits.comment: The bit represent Sys EBC HSREADY.

bits.name: SYS_AHB2AHB_HSREADY
bits.comment: The bit represent Sys Ahb2ahb HSREADY.

bits.name: SYS_USBC_HSREADY
bits.comment: The bit represent USBC HSREADY.

bits.name: SYS_GOUDA_HSREADY
bits.comment: The bit represent GOUDA HSREADY.

bits.name: SYS_XCPU_RAM_HSREADY
bits.comment: The bit represent XCPU RAM HSREADY.

bits.name: SYS_HREADY
bits.comment: The bit represent Sys HSREADY which is sent to all sys AHB slaves.

ireg.name: AHB_BB_MASTER
ireg.comment: Debug information of baseband side AHB bus status.

bits.name: BB_IFC_HMBURSREQ

bits.name: BB_VOC_HMBURSREQ
bits.comment: The bit represent Voc HMBURSREQ.

bits.name: BB_AHB2AHB_HMBURSREQ
bits.comment: The bit represent BB Ahb2ahb HMBURSREQ.

bits.name: BCPU_HMBRSREQ
bits.comment: The bit represent Bcpu HMBURSREQ.

bits.name: BB_IFC_HMGRANT
bits.comment: The bit represent BB Ifc HMGRANT.

bits.name: BB_VOC_HMGRANT
bits.comment: The bit represent Voc HMGRANT.

bits.name: BB_AHB2AHB_HMGRANT
bits.comment: The bit represent BB Ahb2ahb HMGRANT.

bits.name: BCPU_HMGRANT
bits.comment: The bit represent Bcpu HMGRANT.

ireg.name: AHB_BB_HSREADY
ireg.comment: Debug information of AHB bus status HSEL.

bits.name: BB_MEM_HSREADY
bits.comment: The bit represent BB MEM HSREADY.

bits.name: BB_VOC_HSREADY
bits.comment: The bit represent BB VoC HSREADY.

bits.name: BB_SRAM_HSREADY
bits.comment: The bit represent BB Sram HSREADY.

bits.name: BB_IFC_HSREADY
bits.comment: The bit represent BB Ifc HSREADY.

bits.name: BB_AHB2AHB_HSREADY
bits.comment: The bit represent BB Ahb2ahb HSREADY.

bits.name: BB_HREADY
bits.comment: The bit represent BB HREADY which is sent to all BB AHB slaves.

ireg.name: AHB_BB_HSEL
ireg.comment: Debug information of AHB bus status HSEL.

bits.name: BB_MEM_EXT_HSEL
bits.comment: The bit represent BB MEM_EXT HSEL.

bits.name: BB_MEM_INT_HSEL
bits.comment: The bit represent BB MEM_INT HSEL.

bits.name: BB_VOC_HSEL
bits.comment: The bit represent BB VOC HSEL.

bits.name: BB_SRAM_HSEL
bits.comment: The bit represent BB Sram HSEL.

bits.name: BB_IFC_HSEL
bits.comment: The bit represent BB Ifc HSEL.

bits.name: BB_AHB2AHB_HSEL
bits.comment: The bit represent BB Ahb2ahb HSEL.

ireg.name: AHB_SYS_MASK_SPLIT
ireg.comment: Represents the split status register of the SYS_AHBC.

ireg.name: AHB_BB_MASK_SPLIT
ireg.comment: Represents the split status register of the BB_AHBC.

bits.name: Enable
bits.comment:
Allows to turn off the UART:
0 = Disable
1 = Enable

bits.name: Data Bits
bits.comment:
Number of data bits per character (least significant bit first):
0 = 7 bits
1 = 8 bits
This bit will be masked to '1' if debug host is enabled.

bits.name: Tx Stop Bits
bits.comment:
Stop bits controls the number of stop bits transmitted. Can receive with one stop bit (more inaccuracy can be compensated with two stop bits when divisor mode is set to 0).
0 = one stop bit is transmitted in the serial data.
1 = two stop bits are generated and transmitted in the serial data out.
This bit will be masked to '0' if debug host is enabled.

bits.name: Parity Enable
bits.comment:
Parity is enabled when this bit is set.
This bit will be masked to '0' if debug host is enabled.

bits.name: Parity Select
bits.comment:
Controls the parity format when parity is enabled:
00 = an odd number of received 1 bits is checked, or transmitted (the parity bit is included).
01 = an even number of received 1 bits is checked or transmitted (the parity bit is included).
10 = a space is generated and received as parity bit.
11 = a mark is generated and received as parity bit.
These bit will be ignored if debug host is enabled.

bits.name: Tx Break Control
bits.comment:
Sends a break signal by holding the Uart_Tx line low until this bit is cleared.
This bit will be masked to '0' if debug host is enabled.

bits.name: Rx Fifo Reset
bits.comment: Writing a 1 to this bit resets and flushes the Receive Fifo. This bit does not need to be cleared.

bits.name: Tx Fifo Reset
bits.comment: Writing a 1 to this bit resets and flushes the Transmit Fifo. This bit does not need to be cleared.

bits.name: DMA Mode
bits.comment: Enables the DMA signaling for the Uart_Dma_Tx_Req_H and Uart_Dma_Rx_Req_H to the IFC.

bits.name: SWRX flow ctrl
bits.comment:
When this field is "00" and SWTX_flow_Ctrl is also "00", hardwre flow ctrl is used. Otherwise, software flow control is used:
00 = no transmit flow control.
01 = transmit XON1/XOFF1 as flow control bytes
10 = transmit XON2/XOFF2 as flow control bytes
11 = transmit XON1 and XON2/XOFF1 and XOFF2 as flow control bytes

bits.name: SWTX flow ctrl
bits.comment:
When this field is "00" and SWRX_flow_Ctrl is also "00", hardwre flow ctrl is used. Otherwise, software flow control is used:
00 = no receive flow control
01 = receive XON1/XOFF1 as flow control bytes
10 = receive XON2/XOFF2 as flow control bytes
11 = receive XON1 and XON2/XOFF1 and XOFF2 as flow control bytes
Note: If single XON/XOFF character is used for flow contol, the received XON/XOFF character will not be put into Rx FIFO. This is also the case if XON is received when XOFF is expected.
If double XON/XOFF characters are expected, the XON1/XOFF1 must followed sequently by XON2/XOFF2 to be considered as patterns, which will not be put into Rx FIFO. Otherwise they will be considered as data. This is also the case if XOFF1 is followed by character other than XOFF2.

bits.name: BackSlash En
bits.comment: When soft flow control characters or backslash are encountered in the data file, they will be inverted and a backslash will be added before them. for example, if tx data is XON(0x11) with BackSlash_En = '1', then uart will send 5Ch(Backslash) + EEh (~XON).

bits.name: Send XON
bits.comment: Write in this bit will send an XON. This command should be used only for debug. It can be used in case when UART has not received any byte for long time after previous XON is sent. This bit does not need to be cleared.

bits.name: Tx Finish n Wait
bits.comment: When this bit is set the Tx engine terminates to send the current byte and then it stops to send data.

bits.name: Divisor Mode
bits.comment:
Selects the divisor value used to generate the baud rate frequency (BCLK) from the SCLK (see UART Operation for details). If IrDA is enable, this bit is ignored and the divisor used will be 16.
0 = (BCLK = SCLK / 4)
1 = (BCLK = SCLK / 16)
This bit will be masked to '0' if debug host is enabled.

bits.name: IrDA Enable
bits.comment:
When set, the UART is in IrDA mode and the baud rate divisor used is 16 (see UART Operation for details).
This bit will be masked to '0' if debug host is enabled.

bits.name: Rx RTS
bits.comment:
Controls the Uart_RTS output (not directly in auto flow control mode).
0 = the Uart_RTS will be inactive high
1 = the Uart_RTS will be active low
This bit will be masked to '1' if debug host is enabled.

bits.name: Auto Flow Control
bits.comment:
Enables the auto flow control.
In case HW flow control (both swTx_Flow_ctrl=0 and swRx_Flow_Ctrl=0), If Auto_Flow_Control is enabled, Uart_RTS is controlled by the Rx RTS bit in CMD_Set register and the UART Auto Control Flow System(flow controlled by Rx Fifo Level and AFC_Level in Triggers register). Tx data flow is stopped If Uart_CTS become inactive high.
If Auto_Flow_Control is disabled, Uart_RTS is controlled only by the Rx RTS bit in CMD_Set register. Uart_CTS will not take effect.
In case SW flow control(either swTx_Flow_ctrl/=0 or swRx_Flow_Ctrl/=0), If Auto_Flow_Control is enabled, XON/XOFF will be controlled by the Rx RTS bit in CMD_Set register and the UART Auto Control Flow System(flow controlled by Rx Fifo Level and AFC_Level in Triggers register).
If Auto_Flow_Control is disabled, XON/XOFF will be controlled only by Rx RTS bit in CMD_Set register. Tx data flow will be stoped when XOFF is received either this bit is enable or disabled.
This bit will be masked to '1' if debug host is enabled.

bits.name: Loop Back Mode
bits.comment: When set, data on the Uart_Tx line is held high, while the serial output is looped back to the serial input line, internally. In this mode all the interrupts are fully functional. This feature is used for diagnostic purposes. Also, in loop back mode, the modem control input Uart_CTS is disconnected and the modem control output Uart_RTS are looped back to the inputs, internally. In IrDA mode, Uart_Tx signal is inverted (see IrDA SIR Mode Support).

bits.name: Rx Lock Err
bits.comment:
Allow to stop the data receiving when an error is detected (framing, parity or break). The data in the fifo are kept.
This bit will be masked to '0' if debug host is enabled.

bits.name: Rx Break Length
bits.comment:
Length of a break, in number of bits.
This bit will be masked to "1011" if debug host is enabled.

bits.name: Rx Fifo Level
bits.comment: Those bits indicate the number of data available in the Rx Fifo. Those data can be read.

bits.name: Tx Fifo Level
bits.comment: Those bits indicate the number of data available in the Tx Fifo. Those data will be sent.

bits.name: Tx Active
bits.comment: This bit indicates that the UART is sending data. If no data is in the fifo, the UART is currently sending the last one through the serial interface.

bits.name: Rx Active
bits.comment: This bit indicates that the UART is receiving a byte.

bits.name: Rx Overflow Err
bits.comment: This bit indicates that the receiver received a new character when the fifo was already full. The new character is discarded. This bit is cleared when the UART_STATUS register is written with any value.

bits.name: Tx Overflow Err
bits.comment: This bit indicates that the user tried to write a character when fifo was already full. The written data will not be kept. This bit is cleared when the UART_STATUS register is written with any value.

bits.name: Rx Parity Err
bits.comment: This bit is set if the parity is enabled and a parity error occurred in the received data. This bit is cleared when the UART_STATUS register is written with any value.

bits.name: Rx Framing Err
bits.comment: This bit is set whenever there is a framing error occured. A framing error occurs when the receiver does not detect a valid STOP bit in the received data. This bit is cleared when the UART_STATUS register is written with any value.

bits.name: Rx Break Int
bits.comment: This bit is set whenever the serial input is held in a logic 0 state for longer than the length of x bits, where x is the value programmed Rx Break Length. A null word will be written in the Rx Fifo. This bit is cleared when the UART_STATUS register is written with any value.

bits.name: Tx DCTS
bits.comment:
In case HW flow ctrl(both swRx_Flow_Ctrl=0 and swTx_Flow_Ctrl=0), This bit is set when the Uart_CTS line changed since the last time this register has been written.
In case SW flow ctrl(either swRx_Flow_Ctrl/=0 or swTx_Flow_Ctrl/=0), This bit is set when received XON/XOFF status changed since the last time this register has been writtern.
This bit is cleared when the UART_STATUS register is written with any value.

bits.name: Tx CTS
bits.comment:
In case HW flow ctrl(both swRx_Flow_Ctrl=0 and swTx_Flow_Ctrl=0), current value of the Uart_CTS line.
'1' = Tx not allowed.
'0' = Tx allowed.
In case SW flow ctrl(either swRx_Flow_Ctrl/=0 or swTx_Flow_Ctrl/=0), current state of software flow control.
'1' = when XOFF received.
'0' = when XON received.

bits.name: Tx Fifo Rsted L
bits.comment: This bit is set when Tx Fifo Reset command is received by CTRL register and is cleared when Tx fifo reset process has finished.

bits.name: Rx Fifo Rsted L
bits.comment: This bit is set when Rx Fifo Reset command is received by CTRL register and is cleared when Rx fifo reset process has finished.

bits.name: Enable n finished
bits.comment: This bit is set when bit enable is changed from '0' to '1' or from '1' to '0', it is cleared when the enable process has finished.

bits.name: Clk Enabled
bits.comment: This bit is set when Uart Clk has been enabled and received by UART after Need Uart Clock becomes active. It serves to avoid enabling Rx RTS too early.

bits.name: Rx Data
bits.comment: The UART_RECEIVE_BUFFER register is a read-only register that contains the data byte received on the serial input port. This register accesses the head of the receive FIFO. If the receive FIFO is full and this register is not read before the next data character arrives, then the data already in the FIFO will be preserved but any incoming data will be lost. An overflow error will also occur.

bits.name: Tx Data
bits.comment: The UART_TRANSMIT_HOLDING register is a write-only register that contains data to be transmitted on the serial output port. 16 characters of data may be written to the UART_TRANSMIT_HOLDING register before the FIFO is full. Any attempt to write data when the FIFO is full results in the write data being lost.

bits.name: Tx Modem Status
bits.comment: Clear to send signal change or XON/XOFF detected.

bits.name: Rx Data Available
bits.comment: Rx Fifo at or upper threshold level (current level >= Rx Fifo trigger level).

bits.name: Tx Data Needed
bits.comment: Tx Fifo at or below threshold level (current level <= Tx Fifo trigger level).

bits.name: Rx Timeout
bits.comment: No characters in or out of the Rx Fifo during the last 4 character times and there is at least 1 character in it during this time.

bits.name: Rx Line Err
bits.comment: Tx Overflow, Rx Overflow, Parity Error, Framing Error or Break Interrupt.

bits.name: Tx Dma Done
bits.comment: Pulse detected on Uart_Dma_Tx_Done_H signal.

bits.name: Rx Dma Done
bits.comment: Pulse detected on Uart_Dma_Rx_Done_H signal.

bits.name: Rx Dma Timeout
bits.comment: In DMA mode, there is at least 1 character that has been read in or out the Rx Fifo. Then before received Rx DMA Done, No characters in or out of the Rx Fifo during the last 4 character times.

bits.name: XOFF detected
bits.comment: received XOFF character.

bits.name: Tx Modem Status
bits.comment: Clear to send signal detected. Reset control: This bit is cleared when the UART_STATUS register is written with any value.

bits.name: Rx Data Available
bits.comment: Rx Fifo at or upper threshold level (current level >= Rx Fifo trigger level). Reset control: Reading the UART_RECEIVE_BUFFER until the Fifo drops below the trigger level.

bits.name: Tx Data Needed
bits.comment: Tx Fifo at or below threshold level (current level <= Tx Fifo trigger level). Reset control: Writing into UART_TRANSMIT_HOLDING register above threshold level.

bits.name: Rx Timeout
bits.comment: No characters in or out of the Rx Fifo during the last 4 character times and there is at least 1 character in it during this time. Reset control: Reading from the UART_RECEIVE_BUFFER register.

bits.name: Rx Line Err
bits.comment: Tx Overflow, Rx Overflow, Parity Error, Framing Error or Break Interrupt. Reset control: This bit is cleared when the UART_STATUS register is written with any value.

bits.name: Tx Dma Done
bits.comment: This interrupt is generated when a pulse is detected on the Uart_Dma_Tx_Done_H signal. Reset control: Write one in this register.

bits.name: Rx Dma Done
bits.comment: This interrupt is generated when a pulse is detected on the Uart_Dma_Rx_Done_H signal. Reset control: Write one in this register.

bits.name: Rx Dma Timeout
bits.comment: In DMA mode, there is at least 1 character that has been read in or out the Rx Fifo. Then before received Rx DMA Done, No characters in or out of the Rx Fifo during the last 4 character times.

bits.name: XOFF detected
bits.comment: received XOFF character. Reset contorl: Write one in the register.

bits.name: Tx Modem Status U
bits.comment: Same as previous, not masked.

bits.name: Rx Data Available U
bits.comment: Same as previous, not masked.

bits.name: Tx Data Needed U
bits.comment: Same as previous, not masked.

bits.name: Rx Timeout U
bits.comment: Same as previous, not masked.

bits.name: Rx Line Err U
bits.comment: Same as previous, not masked.

bits.name: Tx Dma Done U
bits.comment: Same as previous, not masked.

bits.name: Rx Dma Done U
bits.comment: Same as previous, not masked.

bits.name: Rx Dma Timeout U
bits.comment: Same as previous, not masked.

bits.name: XOFF detected U
bits.comment: Same as previous, not masked.

bits.name: Rx Trigger
bits.comment:
Defines the threshold level at which the Data Available Interrupt will be generated.
The Data Available interrupt is generated when quantity of data in Rx Fifo > Rx Trigger.

bits.name: Tx Trigger
bits.comment:
Defines the threshold level at which the Data Needed Interrupt will be generated.
The Data Needed Interrupt is generated when quantity of data in Tx Fifo <= Tx Trigger.

bits.name: AFC Level
bits.comment:
Controls the Rx Fifo level at which the Uart_RTS Auto Flow Control will be set inactive high (see UART Operation for more details on AFC).
The Uart_RTS Auto Flow Control will be set inactive high when quantity of data in Rx Fifo > AFC Level.

reg.name: XChar

bits.name: XON1
bits.comment: XON1 character value. Reset Value is CTRL-Q 0x11.

bits.name: XOFF1
bits.comment: XOFF1 character value. Reset Value is CTRL-S 0x13

bits.name: XON2
bits.comment: XON2 character value.

bits.name: XOFF2
bits.comment: XOFF2 character value.

reg.comment: These characters must respect following constraints: They must be different if used in software control, if BackSlash_En='1', they cannot be '\' and they cannot be complementary to each other, for example neither XON1 = ~XOFF1 nor XON1 = ~'\' is permitted.

bits.name: Get Channel
bits.comment:
Returns 1 and locks the DMA channel for a transaction if it is available. Else returns 0.
Clear the transfer done interrupt status.

bits.name: Enable
bits.comment: Status of the DMA: 1 if enabled, 0 if disabled.

bits.name: Int Done Cause
bits.comment:
Cause of the interrupt. This bit is set when the transfer is done and the interrupt mask bit is set.
Write one in the Int Clear or write 0 in Enable control bits to clear Int Done Cause bit.

bits.name: Int Done Status
bits.comment:
Status of the interrupt. Status of the transfer: 1 if the transfer is finished, 0 if it is not finished.
Write one in the Int Clear or write 0 in Enable control bits to clear Int Done Status bit.

bits.name: Channel Lock
bits.comment: Actual status of channel lock. Channel is unlocked at the end of transaction or when the DMA is disabled.

bits.name: Enable
bits.comment: Controls the DMA. Write 1 to enable the DMA, write 0 to disable it. When 0 is written in this register, the Int Done Status and Cause bits are reset.

bits.name: Int Done Mask
bits.comment: End of transfer interrupt generation. When 1, the DMA will send an interrupt at transaction completion.

bits.name: Int Done Clear
bits.comment:
Clear the transfer done interruption (this will clear Int Done Status and Int Done Cause).
This bit is auto-clear. You will always read 0 here.

bits.name: Use Pattern
bits.comment: If this bit is set, the source address will be ignored and the memory will be fill with the value of the pattern register.

bits.name: Stop Transfer
bits.comment: The DMA stop the current transfer and flush his FIFO (write only bit). When the FIFO is empty and last write performed, the DMA is disabled and available for a next transfer. The number of bytes copied is readable on DMA_XFER_SIZE register.

bits.name: GEA Enable
bits.comment: Enable Gea process when 1.

bits.name: GEA Algorithm
bits.comment: This field sets the type of GEA algorithm to process.

bits.name: GEA Direction
bits.comment: This field selects the Direction in the GEA algorithm.

bits.name: FCS Enable
bits.comment: Enable FCS process when 1.

bits.name: Dst Addr Mgt
bits.comment:
Destination address management.
00 : Normal DMA operation, DMA_DST_ADDR register define the destination address.
01 : DMA write address is constant (no incremented) and defined by the DMA_DST_ADDR register. All data write are in 16-bit.
10 : DMA write address is alternatively defined by DMA_DST_ADDR and DMA_SD_DST_ADDR registers. All data write are in 16-bit.
In this configuration, DMA write operation is alternatively:
DMA_DST_ADDR <= DMA_PATTERN register
DMA_SD_DST_ADDR <= Data[DMA_SRC_ADDR]
11 : reserved

bits.name: Src Address
bits.comment: Source start read byte address. When a transfer is stalled by the Stop_Transfer bit, this register give the next current source address, which is directly the value to re-program to complete the transfer stopped.

bits.name: Dst Address
bits.comment: Destination start read byte address. When a transfer is stalled by the Stop_Transfer bit, this register give the next current destination address, which is directly the value to re-program to complete the transfer stopped.

bits.name: Sd Dst Address
bits.comment: Second destination address. This register is only used when Dst_Address_Mgt=10.

bits.name: Transfer Size
bits.comment: Transfer size in bytes. Maximum: 262144 bytes. When a transfer is stopped by the Stop_Transfer bit, this register give the number of remainder bytes to transfer.

bits.name: Pattern
bits.comment: Value taken to fill the memory when the configuration bit Use Pattern is set. When the pattern mode is used the destination address must be 32-bit aligned and the transfer size multiple of 4. when Dst_Address_Mgt=10 Pattern is the data written at the address given by the Dst_Address register.

bits.name: KC_LSB
bits.comment: GEA key Kc, LSB bit [31:0].

bits.name: KC_MSB
bits.comment: GEA key Kc, MSB bit [31:0].

bits.name: MessKey
bits.comment: MessKey (Input) register.

bits.name: FCS
bits.comment: Frame Check Sequence.

bits.name: FCS Correct
bits.comment: The FCS is correct in reception when the final remainder is equal to C(x)= x^22 + x^21 + x^19 + x^18 + x^16 + x^15 + x^11 + x^8 + x^5 + x^4

module.name: gouda
module.comment: Number of bits coding position in virtual screen
Number of bits of fractional part of internal fixed point values
Number of bits of internal fixed point values
Number of bits for stride storage

bits.name: start
bits.comment: Starts the image transfer. Autoreset

bits.name: ia_busy
bits.comment: High while image accelerator is busy

bits.name: lcd_busy
bits.comment: High while LCD controller is busy

bits.name: eof_cause
bits.comment:
High when End Of Frame IRQ has been generated.
To clear it, write 1 in this bit or in eof_status.

bits.name: eof_status
bits.comment:
Unmasked version of eof_cause.
To clear it, write 1 in this bit or in eof_status.

bits.name: eof_mask
bits.comment:
EOF interrupt generation mask:
0: EOF IRQ disabled
1: EOF IRQ enabled

bits.name: x0
bits.comment: LCD Region Of Interest Top-Left pixel x-axis

bits.name: y0
bits.comment: LCD Region Of Interest Top-Left pixel y-axis

bits.name: x1
bits.comment: LCD Region Of Interest Bottom-Right pixel x-axis

bits.name: y1
bits.comment: LCD Region Of Interest Bottom-Right pixel y-axis

bits.name: b
bits.comment: Blue component of the ROI background color

bits.name: g
bits.comment: Green component of the ROI background color

bits.name: r
bits.comment: Red component of the ROI background color

bits.name: format
bits.comment:
Input image format
00b: RGB565 pixel packed
01b: YUV4:2:2 pixel packed (UYVY)
10b: YUV4:2:2 pixel packed (YUYV)
11b: YUV4:2:0 planar (IYUV)

bits.name: stride
bits.comment:
Image stride in bytes (of Y component for planar formats).
This is the length from the beginning of a line to the beginning of the next line (can be different from image width * pixel size).

bits.name: active
bits.comment:
Defines Layer's activity:
0: Layer disabled
1: Layer active

bits.name: x0
bits.comment: Video Layer (layer 0) Top-Left pixel x-axis position

bits.name: y0
bits.comment: Video Layer (layer 0) Top-Left pixel y-axis position

bits.name: x1
bits.comment: Video Layer (layer 0) Bottom-Right pixel x-axis position

bits.name: y1
bits.comment: Video Layer (layer 0) Bottom-Right pixel y-axis position

bits.name: max_line
bits.comment: Number of lines of source image (idem gd_vl_br_ppos.y1 when vertical scaling factor is one).

bits.name: max_col
bits.comment: Number of columns of source image (idem gd_vl_br_ppos.x1 when vertical scaling factor is one).

bits.name: chroma key b
bits.comment: Blue component of the Chroma Key

bits.name: chroma key g
bits.comment: Green component of the Chroma Key

bits.name: chroma key r
bits.comment: Red component of the Chroma Key

bits.name: chroma key enable
bits.comment: Enables the Chroma Keying

bits.name: chroma key mask
bits.comment:
Allows a range of color for the Chroma Keying:
000b: exact color match
001b: disregard 1 LSBit of each color component for matching
011b: disregard 2 LSBit of each color component for matching
111b: disregard 3 LSBit of each color component for matching

bits.name: alpha
bits.comment: Layer Alpha blending coefficient

bits.name: rotation
bits.comment:
Layer rotation selection
00b: No rotation
01b: 90 degrees rotation (clockwise)
10b: reserved
11b: reserved

bits.name: depth
bits.comment:
Layer depth
00b: Video layer behind all Overlay layers
01b: Video layer between Overlay layers 1 and 0
10b: Video layer between Overlay layers 2 and 1
11b: Video layer on top of all Overlay layers

bits.name: addr
bits.comment: Dword-aligned address of the Y component (or RGB) of the source image

bits.name: addr
bits.comment: Dword-aligned address of the U component of the source image

bits.name: addr
bits.comment: Dword-aligned address of the V component of the source image

bits.name: xPitch
bits.comment: Video layer rescaling ratio upon x-axis. This is a 2.8 fixed point number representing the input/output width ratio.

bits.name: yPitch
bits.comment: Video layer rescaling ratio upon y-axis. This is a 2.8 fixed point number representing the input/output height ratio.

struct.name: Overlay_Layer
struct.comment: The Overlay layers have a fixed depth relative to their index. Overlay layer 0 is the first to be drawn (thus the deepest), overlay layer 2 is the last to be drawn.

bits.name: format
bits.comment:
Input image format
0: RGB565 pixel packed
1: ARGB8888 pixel packed
others: reserved

bits.name: stride
bits.comment:
Image stride in 16-bits word.
This is the length from the beginning of a line to the beginning of the next line (can be different from image width * pixel size).

bits.name: active
bits.comment:
Defines Layer's activity:
0: Layer disabled
1: Layer active

bits.name: x0
bits.comment: Overlay Layer (layer X+1) Top-Left pixel x-axis position

bits.name: y0
bits.comment: Overlay Layer (layer X+1) Top-Left pixel y-axis position

bits.name: x1
bits.comment: Overlay Layer (layer X+1) Bottom-Right pixel x-axis position

bits.name: y1
bits.comment: Overlay Layer (layer X+1) Bottom-Right pixel y-axis position

bits.name: chroma key b
bits.comment: Blue component of the Chroma Key

bits.name: chroma key g
bits.comment: Green component of the Chroma Key

bits.name: chroma key r
bits.comment: Red component of the Chroma Key

bits.name: chroma key enable
bits.comment: Enables the Chroma Keying

bits.name: chroma key mask
bits.comment:
Allows a range of color for the Chroma Keying:
000b: exact color match
001b: disregard 1 LSBit of each color component for matching
011b: disregard 2 LSBit of each color component for matching
111b: disregard 3 LSBit of each color component for matching

bits.name: alpha
bits.comment: Layer Alpha blending coefficient

bits.name: addr
bits.comment: Dword-aligned address of the source image

bits.name: Destination
bits.comment: Destination Selection

bits.name: Output Format
bits.comment:
Output format
000b: 8-bit - RGB3:3:2 - 1cycle/1pixel - RRRGGGBB
001b: 8-bit - RGB4:4:4 - 3cycle/2pixel - RRRRGGGG/BBBBRRRR/GGGGBBBB
010b: 8-bit - RGB5:6:5 - 2cycle/1pixel - RRRRRGGG/GGGBBBBB
011b: reserved
100b: 16-bit - RGB3:3:2 - 1cycle/2pixel - RRRGGGBBRRRGGGBB
101b: 16-bit - RGB4:4:4 - 1cycle/1pixel - XXXXRRRRGGGGBBBB
110b: 16-bit - RGB5:6:5 - 1cycle/1pixel - RRRRRGGGGGGBBBBB
111b: reserved
The MSB select also the AHB access size (8-bit or 16-bit) when Memory destination is selected.
Must set to RGB565 when RAM type destination selected

bits.name: CS0 Polarity
bits.comment:
Change Polarity of CS0 signal
0: no change
1: Inverted

bits.name: CS1 Polarity
bits.comment:
Change Polarity of CS1 signal
0: no change
1: Inverted

bits.name: RS Polarity
bits.comment:
Change Polarity of RS signal
0: no change
1: Inverted

bits.name: WR Polarity
bits.comment:
Change Polarity of WR signal
0: no change
1: Inverted

bits.name: RD Polarity
bits.comment:
Change Polarity of RD signal
0: no change
1: Inverted

bits.name: Nb Command
bits.comment: Number of command to be send to the LCD command (up to 31)

bits.name: Start command
bits.comment: Start command transfer only. Autoreset

reg.name: gd_lcd_timing
reg.comment: All value are in cycle number of system clock

bits.name: TAS
bits.comment: Address setup time (RS to WR, RS to RD)

bits.name: TAH
bits.comment: Adress hold time

bits.name: PWL
bits.comment: Pulse Width Low level, between 2 and 63.

bits.name: PWH
bits.comment: Pulse Width High level, between 2 and 63 (must be > (TAH+TAS) ).

bits.name: addr_dst
bits.comment:
Address destination pointer when memory destination is selected.
The addr_dst[1] which correspond to the M_A[0] on the memory interface is used to select between command/data.

bits.name: stride_offset
bits.comment:
Address offset (in Bytes) skipped at the end of each line when memory destination is selected.
This 2D feature allows for in-memory image compositing.

bits.name: lcd_data
bits.comment: data to write or data readen (the readen data is ready when the lcd is not busy)

bits.name: type
bits.comment:
Acesss type selection
0: Command
1: Data

bits.name: start_write
bits.comment: Start a single write access. Autoreset

bits.name: start_read
bits.comment: Start a single read access (only when LCD output selected). Autoreset.

bits.name: Lock
bits.comment: Lock mode: when locked the FIFO only accept requests from the XCPU, other masters receive the Split response until the lock mode is disabled. (If blocked in debug, use host internal reg reset+xcpu hold).

bits.name: AHB_Cmd_Full_Shift
bits.comment:
In order to solve the possible AHBC arbitration bug, a delay is put to the AHB_Cmd_Full signal. By default, when a slot is freed in the FIFO a master can come and take this slot before the previously splitted masters are even unsplitted. There is a 5 clock delay between the freed spot and the HSLIT signal that this shifter will compentiate only when a slot is freed (falling edge of AHB_Cmd_Full) not when the FIFO is full (rising edge of AHB_Cmd_Full).
This option has to be set as well as the New arbitration feature in the AHBC module in order be effective.

bits.name: FIFO_A_Level
bits.comment: Number of requests pending in System fifo.

bits.name: FIFO_B_Level
bits.comment: Number of requests pending in Baseband FIFO

bits.name: Monitor_Sel
bits.comment: Monitor signal selection

option.name: Side_by_Side
option.comment: Select FIFO Data access used by each side

option.name: Data_vs_External
option.comment: Select FIFO Data used by both side against Cycle used on External interface

bits.name: Ctrl
bits.comment: Write 1 to start the CRC Computation on the Rom, Read to get the status

bits.name: CRC
bits.comment: The Computed CRC

bits.name: Ctrl
bits.comment: Write 1 to start the BIST on the selected SRam block, Read to get the status

bits.name: Block_Sel
bits.comment: The Bock of 32k on which to run the March C- algorithm

bits.name: Status
bits.comment: The Bist Status (valid when Done)

bits.name: block_addr
bits.comment: Base address of block in int_Rom patched (corresponding data are read from int_SRam)

bits.name: Enable
bits.comment:
Enable the ebc
1 = Enable
0 = Disable (will finish current transfer anyway)

bits.name: IdleDrive
bits.comment: This bit select wether (1) or not (0) the EBC drives the data bus lines during idle (ie: between tranfers)

bits.name: Enable
bits.comment: Enable status of the module (as reading EBC_Ctrl will return the written value)

bits.name: Update_CS
bits.comment: This bit shows that a CS update is in progress. It reads as 1 when a chip select register has been written but not yet updated in the actual configuration. This is to ensure the configuration does not change during an access.

reg.name: CS_Time_Write
reg.comment:
This register is used to program the CS_Time register of One CS_Config at the same time as the CS_Mode regiter is set (so the two registers are always synchronized with each other).
To update Chip Select n configuration, first write the timing value in this register, then write the CS_Mode configuration in the corresponding CS_Config[n].CS_Mode.

bits.name: RdLatHalfMode
bits.comment:
Read access Latency Half cycle Mode:
when 1 reduce the cycle latency by half a cycle between 2 consecutive half word access.
In burst mode, when 1 extend the cycle latency by half a cycle for all half word access.

bits.name: RdLat
bits.comment:
Read access Latency: Access time for read.
Access time in clock cycle is the value of this field +1.

bits.name: OEDlyHalfMode
bits.comment:
Chip select to Output enable Setup half mode:
1 add one half cycle to the time

bits.name: OEDly
bits.comment:
Chip select to Output enable Setup time:
The time in clock cycle is the value of this field.

bits.name: PageLat
bits.comment:
Page mode Latency value: Page mode access time (for read or write page mode)
Access time in clock cycle is the value of this field +1.
Note: if Half cycle mode is enabled it also applies to the page mode.

bits.name: WrLatHalfMode
bits.comment:
Write access Latency Half cycle Mode:
when 1 reduce the cycle latency by half a cycle between 2 consecutive half word access.

bits.name: WrLat
bits.comment:
Write access Latency: Access time for write.
Access time in clock cycle is the value of this field +1.

bits.name: WEDlyHalfMode
bits.comment:
Chip select to Write enable Setup half mode:
1 add one half cycle to the time

bits.name: WEDly
bits.comment:
Chip select to Write enable Setup time:
The time in clock cycle is the value of this field.

bits.name: Relax
bits.comment:
Relaxation delay between sequence of access (all read or all write) to the same chip select and any new sequence or idle state.
The delay in number of clock cycle is the value of this field.

bits.name: ForceRelax
bits.comment: Force Relaxation cycles to be inserted between any access. (same page or same burst consecutive access are considered a single access)

reg.name: CS_Mode
reg.comment: Writing this register will also copy the content of CS_Time_Write to the CS_Time register.

bits.name: CSEn
bits.comment: Enable the chip select.

bits.name: Polarity
bits.comment:
Chip Select polarity: 1 active High, '0' active Low.
CS0 and CS1 are always active low (0) so this bit is not writable for them.

bits.name: ADMuxMode
bits.comment: 1 use Address/Data Mux for 16 lower address bits.

bits.name: WriteAllow
bits.comment: 1 to allow write, else a write to the memory of this chip select will be dropped from the controller without notice.

bits.name: WBEMode
bits.comment: 1 to use BE as WE for each byte (to use two 8bits chips)

bits.name: BEDlyMode
bits.comment:
0: BE active after OEDly/WEDly
1: BE active during full access

bits.name: WaitMode
bits.comment:
1 to use the wait input to delay end of a read access.
(RdLat min 4)

bits.name: WriteWaitMode
bits.comment:
1 to use the wait input to delay end of a write access.
(WrLAt min 4)

bits.name: PageSize

option.name: 4HW
option.comment: 4 half words

option.name: 8HW
option.comment: 8 half words

option.name: 16HW
option.comment: 16 half words

option.name: 32HW
option.comment: 32 half words

option.name: 64HW
option.comment: 64 half words

option.name: 128HW
option.comment: 128 half words

option.name: 256HW
option.comment: 256 half words

option.name: FULL
option.comment: Full page (in burst mode, else reserved)

bits.comment: Page size for page or bursts access.

bits.name: PageMode
bits.comment:
1 enable page mode for read access:
only address changes, chip select keeps enabled while address keeps in a page (defined by PageSize).

bits.name: WritePageMode
bits.comment: 1 enable page mode for write access.

bits.name: BurstMode
bits.comment:
1 enable burst mode for read access.
Use PageSize.
Require the use of the M_ADV and M_CLK pins.

bits.name: WriteBurstMode
bits.comment: 1 enable burst mode for write access.

bits.name: ADVAsync
bits.comment: 1 the M_ADV pin is low only during the first cycle of an asynchronous access (for asynchronous modes on burst capable chips)

bits.name: ADVWEPulse
bits.comment: 1 the M_WE is valid only during the M_ADV pulse.

bits.name: ADMuxDly
bits.comment: Address/Data Mux timing

option.name: normal
option.comment: ADV signal as in burst mode

option.name: F1
option.comment: ADV signal fall a half cycle after CS for 1 cycle

option.name: F1_5
option.comment: ADV signal fall a half cycle after CS for 1.5 cycle

option.name: F2
option.comment: ADV signal fall a half cycle after CS for 2 cycle

bits.name: WriteSingle
bits.comment: 1 the Write Burst mode PageSize is replaced by 1 to do synchronous single write access. (while PageSize is still used for Read burst access)

bits.name: WriteHold
bits.comment: 1 the data remains driven during Relaxation time.

reg.name: CS_Time
reg.comment: This register cannot be written direclty. To update it, write to the CS_Time_write register, then to the CS_Mode register.

bits.name: RdLatHalfMode
bits.comment:
Read access Latency Half cycle Mode:
when 1 reduce the cycle latency by half a cycle between 2 consecutive half word access.
In burst mode, when 1 extend the cycle latency by half a cycle for all half word access.

bits.name: RdLat
bits.comment:
Read access Latency: Access time for read.
Access time in clock cycle is the value of this field +1.

bits.name: OEDlyHalfMode
bits.comment:
Chip select to Output enable Setup half mode:
1 add one half cycle to the time

bits.name: OEDly
bits.comment:
Chip select to Output enable Setup time:
The time in clock cycle is the value of this field.

bits.name: PageLat
bits.comment:
Page mode Latency value: Page mode access time (for read or write page mode)
Access time in clock cycle is the value of this field +1.
Note: if Half cycle mode is enabled it also applies to the page mode.

bits.name: WrLatHalfMode
bits.comment:
Write access Latency Half cycle Mode:
when 1 reduce the cycle latency by half a cycle between 2 consecutive half word access.

bits.name: WrLat
bits.comment:
Write access Latency: Access time for write.
Access time in clock cycle is the value of this field +1.

bits.name: WEDlyHalfMode
bits.comment:
Chip select to Write enable Setup half mode:
1 add one half cycle to the time

bits.name: WEDly
bits.comment:
Chip select to Write enable Setup time:
The time in clock cycle is the value of this field.

bits.name: Relax
bits.comment:
Relaxation delay between sequence of access (all read or all write) to the same chip select and any new sequence or idle state. (burst reaching end of page in non Full Page mode also insert a Relaxation delay)
The delay in number of clock cycle is the value of this field.

bits.name: ForceRelax
bits.comment: Force Relaxation cycles to be inserted between any access. (same page or same burst consecutive access are considered a single access)

bits.name: Enable
bits.comment:
Enable the AHB Master
1 = Enable
0 = Disable (will finish current transfer anyway)

bits.name: Enable
bits.comment: Enable status of the module (as reading AHBM_Ctrl will return the written value)

bits.name: Update_SB
bits.comment: This bits shows that a SpaceBase update is in progress. It reads as 1 when a SpaceBase register has been written but not yet updated in the actual configuration. This is to ensure the configuration does not change during an access.

bits.name: BaseAddr
bits.comment: Base address added to the lower bits of address from FIFO.

reg.name: Flush
reg.comment: Reading this register ensure the previous write command are all done (any read would do anyway) but this does not access external controller. When changing CS Config it will only work if the baseband is off (boot...) ! Poll CS_Update in reg CS Status instead.

bits.name: CRE
bits.comment:
Write here the desired state of the M_CRE pin.
As this register is placed in the FIFO with the memory commands, it ensure the sequence of memory access and change to this register will be kept in sequence.

bits.name: Block_Remap
bits.comment:
When the CS4 is accessed the adress is extended by the bits in this register and the MSB is set to 1.
As this register is placed in the FIFO with the memory commands, it ensure the sequence of memory access and change to this register will be kept in order.

bits.name: Side_Id
bits.comment: Read as 0 on System side, as 1 on BaseBand Side.

memory.name: ram_array
memory.comment:
EBC Chip select 0 memory space.
Space accessed by M_CS_0 line.
This chip select is dedicated to Flash access, the CPU will boot from here.

memory.name: ram_array
memory.comment:
EBC Chip select 1 memory space.
Space accessed by M_CS_1 line.
This chip select is dedicated to ram access.

memory.name: ram_array
memory.comment:
EBC Chip select 2 memory space.
Space accessed by M_CS_2 line

memory.name: ram_array
memory.comment:
EBC Chip select 3 memory space.
Space accessed by M_CS_3 line

memory.name: ram_array
memory.comment:
EBC Chip select 4 memory space.
Space accessed by M_CS_4 line

memory.name: rom_array
memory.comment:
Internal Rom Space
This rom is used for boot code.

entry.name: DBG_SEL_OSC
entry.comment: this clock is taken before clock root

entry.name: DBG_SEL_REF
entry.comment: this clock is taken before clock root

entry.name: DBG_SEL_SLOW
entry.comment: this clock is taken before clock root

entry.name: DBG_SEL_FAST_PLL
entry.comment: this clock is taken before clock root

entry.name: DBG_SEL_VOC_PLL
entry.comment: this clock is taken before clock root

entry.name: DBG_SEL_SYS_156M_PLL
entry.comment: this clock is taken before clock root

reg.name: Debug_Port_Mode
reg.comment: All this register is locked by the host_lock_reg signal

option.name: Mode_Pxts_Exl_Off
option.comment: when mode_Config="000" the module is switched off

option.name: Mode_Exl
option.comment: when mode_Config="001" the mode Exl is set

option.name: Mode_Pxts
option.comment: when mode_Config="010" the mode Pxts is set

option.name: Mode_Pxts_Exl
option.comment: when mode_Config="011" the mode Pxts_Exl is set

option.name: Mode_Signal_Spy
option.comment: when mode_Config="100" the mode Signal Spy is set

bits.name: Pxts_Exl_Clock_pol
bits.comment: Pxts Exl Clock polarity, when 1 this bit switch the clock polarity.

bits.name: Pxts_Fifo_Empty
bits.comment: Pxts bit Status, 1 when the fifo is empty

bits.name: Pxts_Fifo_Ovf
bits.comment: Pxts bit Status, 1 when the fifo is overflow, writing 1 will clear this bit.

bits.name: Exl_Fifo_Empty
bits.comment: Exl bit Status, 1 when the fifo is empty

bits.name: Exl_Fifo_Ovf
bits.comment: Exl bit Status, 1 when the fifo is overflow, writing 1 will clear this bit.

bits.name: oen_DBG_CLK
bits.comment:
Select Clk_Dbg between Clock from clock_ctrl or external chip input clock.
if oen_DBG_CLK = 1 then Clk_Dbg source comes from the PAD.
if oen_DBG_CLK = 0 then Clk_Dbg source comes from the clock_ctrl.

reg.name: Pxts_Exl_Cfg
reg.comment: All this register is locked by the host_lock_reg signal.

option.name: Record_jumANDbranch
option.comment: When "0000", Any jump inst, Any branch inst (taken or not)

option.name: Record_branch
option.comment: When "0001", Selected branch inst (taken or not)

option.name: Record_branchNotTaken
option.comment: When "0010", Selected branch inst, branch not taken)

option.name: EXL_Record_branchTaken
option.comment: When "0011", Selected branch inst, branch taken

option.name: EXL_Record_NojumNobranch
option.comment: When others, No jump/branch inst (useful for tracing interrupts only)

bits.name: Any_Branch
bits.comment: When 1, Record any kind of branch, otherwise use the field Branch_Type.

bits.name: Int_En
bits.comment: When 1, Record Interruptions.

option.name: BLTZ
option.comment: branch_sel_type := "00000"

option.name: BGEZ
option.comment: branch_sel_type := "00001"

option.name: BEQ
option.comment: branch_sel_type := "00010"

option.name: BNE
option.comment: branch_sel_type := "00011"

option.name: BLEZ
option.comment: branch_sel_type := "00100"

option.name: BGTZ
option.comment: branch_sel_type := "00101"

option.name: BC1F
option.comment: branch_sel_type := "00110"

option.name: BC1T
option.comment: branch_sel_type := "00111"

option.name: BC2F
option.comment: branch_sel_type := "01000"

option.name: BC2T
option.comment: branch_sel_type := "01001"

option.name: NO_BRANCH
option.comment: branch_sel_type := "01010", Jump only

option.name: BR
option.comment: branch_sel_type := "10000"

option.name: BEQZ
option.comment: branch_sel_type := "10001"

option.name: BNEZ
option.comment: branch_sel_type := "10010"

option.name: Basic_Storage
option.comment: When "00": Basic Exl fifo Storage (events are lost when fifo full)

option.name: Hw_Storage_Ctrl
option.comment: When "01": If the fifo is Overflow and this mode enabled. The events are stored onto the fifo only if empty else the events are lost.

option.name: Sw_Storage_Ctrl
option.comment: When "10": If the fifo is Overflow and this mode enabled. The events are stored onto the fifo only if the Exl_Fifo_Ovf is cleared and the fifo is empty else the events are lost.

bits.name: Enable_Pxts_Tag
bits.comment:
Enable the corresponding PXTS TAG when the bit is set.
Description of each Enable_Pxts_Tag:
Enable_Pxts_TagDescription
Enable_Pxts_Tag_0RESERVED_0
Enable_Pxts_Tag_1BOOT
Enable_Pxts_Tag_2HAL
Enable_Pxts_Tag_3SX
Enable_Pxts_Tag_4PAL
Enable_Pxts_Tag_5EDRV
Enable_Pxts_Tag_6SVC
Enable_Pxts_Tag_7STACK
Enable_Pxts_Tag_8CSW
Enable_Pxts_Tag_9RESERVED_9
Enable_Pxts_Tag_10RESERVED_10
Enable_Pxts_Tag_11RESERVED_11
Enable_Pxts_Tag_12BB_IRQ
Enable_Pxts_Tag_13SPAL
Enable_Pxts_Tag_14SPP
Enable_Pxts_Tag_15SPC

bits.name: WD_Address
bits.comment: Loaded during WatchDog reset with the XCPU current execution address.

bits.name: Dbg_Bus_Mode
bits.comment: This bit select the output on pins DBG_BUS_0 to DBG_BUS_7

option.name: DEBUG_MODE_SYS
option.comment: When "00", select DEBUG_MODE_SYS

option.name: DEBUG_MODE_IP_SPI
option.comment: When "01", Select DEBUG_MODE_IP_SPI

option.name: DEBUG_MODE_IP_SIG
option.comment: When "10", Select DEBUG_MODE_IP_SIG

option.name: DEBUG_MODE_RF
option.comment: When "11", Select DEBUG_MODE_RF

bits.name: Dbg_Bus_Sig_Sel0
bits.comment: This bit select the output on pin DBG_BUS_6

bits.name: Dbg_Bus_Sig_Sel1
bits.comment: This bit select the output on pin DBG_BUS_7

bits.name: Sel_Source
bits.comment: Selects the clock debug source

option.name: masked
option.comment: The DBG clock is masked

option.name: enabled
option.comment: The DBG clock is enabled

bits.name: Dbg_Watch_S_C
bits.comment:
Writing '1' to any of these bits sets the corresponding register, reading it returns the register value.
These bits can be selected by the Signal_Spy_Cfg register configuration. to monitor some peace of software.

bits.name: Dbg_Watch_S_C
bits.comment:
Writing '1' to any of these bits clears the corresponding register, reading it returns the register value.
These bits can be selected by the Signal_Spy_Cfg register configuration. to monitor some peace of software.

bits.name: tag_pxts
bits.comment: When Mode_Pxts and the corresponding Enable_Pxts_Tag are enabled, each write into tag_pxts register provide a 16 bits packet send to the romulator throught the DBG_BUS port

bits.name: oen_val
bits.comment:
Set the direction of the GPIO n.
0 = output
1 = input

bits.name: oen_set_out
bits.comment: 'Write '1' sets the corresponding GPIO pin as output.

bits.name: oen_set_in
bits.comment: 'Write '1' sets the corresponding GPIO pin as input.

bits.name: gpio_val
bits.comment: When write, update the output value. When read, get the input value.

bits.name: gpio_set
bits.comment: Write '1' will set GPIO output value. When read, get the GPIO output value.

bits.name: gpio_clr
bits.comment: 'Write '1' clears corresponding GPIO output value. When read, get the GPIO output value.

bits.name: gpint_r_set
bits.comment: Write '1' will set GPIO interrupt mask for rising edge and level high. When read, get the GPIO interrupt mask for rising edge and level high.

bits.name: gpint_f_set
bits.comment: Write '1' will set GPIO interrupt mask for falling edge and level low. When read, get the GPIO interrupt mask for falling edge and level low.

bits.name: dbn_en_set
bits.comment: Write '1' will enable debounce mechanism.

bits.name: gpint_mode_set
bits.comment: Write '1' will set interruption mode to level.

bits.name: gpint_r_clr
bits.comment: 'Write '1' will clear GPIO interrupt mask for rising edge and level high.

bits.name: gpint_f_clr
bits.comment: Write '1' will clear GPIO interrupt mask for falling edge and level low.

bits.name: dbn_en_clr
bits.comment: Write '1' will disable debounce mechanism.

bits.name: gpint_mode_clr
bits.comment: Write '1' will set interruption mode to edge triggered.

bits.name: gpint_clr
bits.comment: 'Write '1' will clear GPIO interrupt.

bits.name: gpint_status
bits.comment: Each bit represents if there is a GPIO interrupt pending.

bits.name: out_time
bits.comment:
time for which GPIO0 is set to output mode, after a start read DCON command is issued.
The output time = (OUT_TIME+1)*30.5us.

bits.name: wait_time
bits.comment:
time for which GPIO0 should wait before reading DC_ON, after
            a start read DCON command is issued.
The wait time = (WAIT_TIME+1)*30.5us.
            
NOTE: wait_time must be strictly greater than out_time;

bits.name: int_mode
bits.comment: interruption mode of GPIO0 in mode DC_ON detection.

option.name: L2H
option.comment: "00" = send IRQ if last read DCON is '0' and now is '1'.

option.name: H2L
option.comment: "01" = send IRQ if last read DCON is '1' and now is '0'.

option.name: RR
option.comment: "11" = send IRQ every time read is ready.

bits.name: dcon_mode_set
bits.comment: Write '1' to set GPIO0 to charger DCON detect mode.

bits.name: chg_mode_set
bits.comment: Write '1' to set GPO0 to charger watchdog mode.

bits.name: dcon_mode_clr
bits.comment: Write '1' to clear charger DCON detect mode of GPIO0.

bits.name: chg_mode_clr
bits.comment: Write '1' to clear the charger watchdog mode of GPO0.

bits.name: chg_down
bits.comment: Write '1' to generate a pulse of '0' on GPO0 for 16 CLK_OSC cycles.

bits.name: gpo_set
bits.comment: 'Write '1' will set GPO output value. When read, get the GPO output value.

bits.name: gpo_clr
bits.comment: 'Write '1' will clear GPO output value. When read, get the GPO output value.

bits.name: EN
bits.comment: I2C master enable, high active.

bits.name: IRQ_MASK
