bits.comment: I2C master interrupt enable, high active.

bits.name: Clock_Prescale
bits.comment:
This register is used to prescale the SCL clock line. Due to the structure of I2C interface, this module uses a 5*SCL clock frequency. Clock_Prescale must be programmed to this 5*SCL clock frequency (minus 1). Change the value of Clock_Prescale only when bit EN is cleared.
Example:
PCLK_MOD is 52 MHz, desired SCL is 100 KHz.
Prescale = 52MHz / (5 * 100KHz) -1 = 103.

bits.name: IRQ_Cause
bits.comment: IRQ Cause bit. This bit is set when one byte transfer has been completed or arbitration is lost, this bit is generated by bit IRQ_Status AND bit IRQ_MASK.

bits.name: IRQ_Status
bits.comment: IRQ status bit.

bits.name: TIP
bits.comment: TIP, Transfer in progress. '1' when transferring data. '0' when transfer complete.

bits.name: AL
bits.comment: AL,Arbitration lost. This bit is set when the I2C master lost arbitration.

bits.name: Busy
bits.comment: Busy,I2C bus busy. '1' after START signal detected. '0' after STOP signal detected.

bits.name: RxACK
bits.comment: RxACK, Received acknowledge from slave. '1'= "No ACK" received. '0'= ACK received.

bits.name: TX_DATA
bits.comment:
Byte to transmit via I2C.
for Bit 0, In case of a data transfer this bit represents the data's LSB. In case of a slave address transfer this bit represents the RW bit.
'1' = reading from slave.
'0' = writing to slave.

bits.name: RX_DATA
bits.comment: Last byte received via I2C.

bits.name: ACK
bits.comment: ACK,when master works as a receiver,sent ACK(ACK='0') or NACK(ACK='1').

bits.name: RD
bits.comment: RD,read from slave, this bit is auto cleared.

bits.name: STO
bits.comment: STO,generate stop condition, this bit is auto cleared.

bits.name: WR
bits.comment: WR,write to slave, this bit is auto cleared.

bits.name: STA
bits.comment: STA,generate (repeated) start condition, this bit is auto cleared.

bits.name: IRQ_Clr
bits.comment: When write '1', clears a pending I2C interrupt.

bits.name: nb_bits
bits.comment: Number of bits to be (De)Interleaved.

bits.name: burst_offset
bits.comment: This value gives the write offset (in number of bursts) to be added to a Burst Base address (ignored for Type 1b). For normal operation, this offset should be even (lsb will be ignored).

bits.name: itlv_type
bits.comment: Selects (de-)interleaving type.

option.name: TYPE_1A
option.comment: TCH/FS, TCH/EFS, FACCH/F, TCH/F2.4, TCH/AFS (speech, ratscch, sid_first)

option.name: TYPE_1B
option.comment: SACCH, TCH/AFS(sid_update), PDTCH(CS-1 to CS-4), BCCH, PCH, AGCH, PACCH, PBCCH, PAGCH, PPCH, PNCH, PTCCH/D

option.name: TYPE_1C
option.comment: FACCH/H

option.name: TYPE_2A
option.comment: TCH/HS and TCH/AHS

option.name: TYPE_2B
option.comment: TCH/HS and TCH/AHS

option.name: TYPE_3
option.comment: TCH/F14.4, TCH/F9.6, TCH/F4.8, TCH/H4.8, and TCH/H2.4

bits.name: int_mask
bits.comment: Sets the interrupt mask ('1': interruption enabled)

bits.name: ditlv_start
bits.comment: Starts the de-interleaving process.

bits.name: itlv_start
bits.comment: Starts the interleaving process.

bits.name: busy
bits.comment: This bit is high when a (de-)interleaving process is ongoing. It stays high if the module is stalled during operation.

bits.name: burst_base
bits.comment: This is the start address of the burst buffer in SRAM

bits.name: frame_base
bits.comment: This is the start address of the frame buffer in SRAM.

bits.name: it_status
bits.comment: This bit is the unmasked version of the IT_CAUSE bit.

bits.name: it_cause
bits.comment: This bit is set when the ITLV module finishes an ongoing operation. It can be masked by setting ITLV_CMD(IT_MASK) to '1'. Resetting this bit is done by writing in IT_CLEAR register. IT_CAUSE is the image of the ITLV_DONE_H interrupt line to the CPU.

bits.name: it_clear
bits.comment: Setting this bit to '1' resets the Interleaver's interrupt.

bits.name: enable_page
bits.comment: Writing '1' enable the page (n), writing '0' leave the page in it's current state. Reading returns '1' if the page is active (hit or not).

bits.name: status_page
bits.comment: Status of the page.

bits.name: disable_page
bits.comment: Writing '1' disable the page (n) and clears the hit status if any, writing '0' leave the page in it's current state. Reading returns '1' if the page is active (hit or not).

bits.name: start_address
bits.comment: Start address of page (n) (included).

bits.name: detect_read
bits.comment: If '1' any read within the range will trigger the page.

bits.name: detect_write
bits.comment: If '1' any read within the range will trigger the page.

bits.name: end_address
bits.comment: End address of page (n) (excluded).

bits.name: master
bits.comment: The master that wrote in the page (n).

bits.name: hit_addr
bits.comment: Address that triggered page (n).

bits.name: hit_read
bits.comment: If '1' a read has triggered the page.

bits.name: hit_write
bits.comment: If '1' a write has triggered the page.

bits.name: Rx/Tx data
bits.comment:
In read mode this register contains the sample received on the Rx chain. I component is located on bit[15:0] and Q component is located on bit[31:16].
This register accesses to the head of the receive FIFO. If the receive FIFO is full and this register is not read before the next data sample arrives, then the data already in the FIFO will be preserved but any incoming data will be lost. An overflow error will also occur.
The data written[29:0] into this register is the data transmitted. Any attempt to write data when the FIFO is full results in the write data being lost.

bits.name: Enable
bits.comment: Turn on/off the rf_if interface

bits.name: DigRF Enable

option.name: Disable
option.comment: Analog more selected

option.name: Enable
option.comment: DigRF mode selected

bits.comment: Turn on/off the DigRF mode

bits.name: Rx overflow Enable

option.name: Disable
option.comment: Disable (mask) Rx fifo overflow interrupt

option.name: Enable
option.comment: Enable Rx fifo overflow interrupt

bits.comment: Rx Fifo Overflow interrupt Enable

bits.name: Rx Cal Bypass
bits.comment: Calibration bypass

bits.name: Rx Swap I/Q

option.name: NO
option.comment: No Swap

option.name: YES
option.comment: Swap I/Q

bits.comment: Rx swap I/Q

bits.name: Rx Force ADC On

option.name: NO
option.comment: No forced, Rx_On output controlled by TCO_RX_ON signal from the TCU

option.name: YES
option.comment: Forced ADC on;Rx_On output always high

bits.comment: Force Rx On. This bit is used only with the analog option.

bits.name: Rx Force Dec On

option.name: NO
option.comment: No forced, decimator controlled by Rx_dec_on signal from the TCU

option.name: YES
option.comment: Forced; decimator always on

bits.comment: Force Decimator On

bits.name: Rx Force SOC
bits.comment:
Force start of calibation in receive mode
Writing a 1 to this bit launch the calibration phase. Write only bit, this bit doesn't need to be cleared.

bits.name: Rx Fifo Reset
bits.comment:
Writing a 1 to this bit resets and flush the receive Fifo.
Write only bit, this bit doesn't need to be cleared.

bits.name: Tx overflow Enable

option.name: Disable
option.comment: Disable (mask) Tx fifo overflow interrupt

option.name: Enable
option.comment: Enable Tx fifo overflow interrupt

bits.comment: Tx Fifo Overflow interrupt Enable

bits.name: Tx underflow Enable

option.name: Disable
option.comment: Disable (mask) Tx fifo undeflow interrupt

option.name: Enable
option.comment: Enable Tx fifo underflow interrupt

bits.comment: Tx Fifo Underflow interrupt Enable:

bits.name: Tx Force DAC On

option.name: NO
option.comment: No forced, Tx_On output controlled by TCO_TX_ON signal from the TCU

option.name: YES
option.comment: Forced DAC on; Tx_On output always high

bits.comment: Force DAC On. This bit is used only with the analog option.

bits.name: Tx Force DAC Off

option.name: NO
option.comment: No forced, Tx_On output controlled by TCO_TX_ON signal from the TCU

option.name: YES
option.comment: Forced DAC Off; Tx_On output always low

bits.comment: Force DAC Off. This bit is used only with the analog option.

bits.name: Tx Force oen

option.name: NO
option.comment: No forced, Tx_Oen controlled by TCO_TX_OEN signal from the TCU

option.name: YES
option.comment: Forced; Tx_Oen always high, Low pass output in HZ

bits.comment: Force Tx Oen. This bit is used only with the analog option.

bits.name: Tx Force GMSK On

option.name: NO
option.comment: No forced, transmit serial interface controlled by TCO_GMSK_ON signal from the TCU

option.name: YES
option.comment: Forced; serializer always enabled

bits.comment: Force GMSK On.

bits.name: Tx Swap I/Q

option.name: NO
option.comment: No Swap

option.name: YES
option.comment: Swap I/Q

bits.comment: Tx swap I/Q. This bit is used only with the analog option.

bits.name: Tx Fifo Reset
bits.comment:
Writing a 1 to this bit resets and flush the transmit Fifo.
Write only bit, this bit doesn.t need to be cleared.

bits.name: DigRF Rx Rate

option.name: ONE
option.comment: One sample per symbol

option.name: TWO
option.comment: Two samples per symbol

bits.comment: Rx rate for DigRF interface. This bit is used only when DigRF is enabled (DigRF Enabled)

bits.name: DigRF Rx Clk Pol
bits.comment:
Change the polarity of the DigRF Rx clock. This bit is used only when DigRF is enabled (DigRF Enabled)
0 = No inversion
1 = Invert clock polarity

bits.name: DigRF Tx mode
bits.comment: Tx mode for the DigRF interface. This bit is used only when DigRF is enabled (DigRF Enabled)

bits.name: DigRF Tx Clk Pol
bits.comment:
Change the polarity of the DigRF Rx clock. This bit is used only when DigRF is enabled (DigRF Enabled)
0 = No inversion
1 = Invert clock polarity

bits.name: DigRF Sample Size
bits.comment:
Shift input sample in DigRF mode only.
The Rx sample are on 16-bit, this field select a variable of bit among 16.
000 = 16-bit selected
001 = 15-bit selected
010 = 14-bit selected
011 = 13-bit selected
100 = 12-bit selected

bits.name: DigRF Alignement Select
bits.comment:
Select the sample alignement in DigRF mode only..
0 = MSB aligned sample
1 = LSB aligned sample

bits.name: Rx Fifo level
bits.comment: Those bits indicate the number of data available in the Rx Fifo.

bits.name: Tx Fifo level
bits.comment: Those bits indicate the number of data available in the Tx Fifo. Those data will be sent.

bits.name: Rx Overflow Cause
bits.comment:
Rx overflow cause register
This bit indicates that an interruption was generated when the Rx fifo is overflow.
This bit is cleared when the Rx_Overflow_Int field in the RF_IF_INTERRUPT_CLEAR register is written.

bits.name: Tx Overflow Cause
bits.comment:
Tx overflow cause register
This bit indicates that an interruption was generated when the Tx fifo is overflow.
This bit is cleared when the Tx_Overflow_Int field in the RF_IF_INTERRUPT_CLEAR register is written.

bits.name: Tx Underflow Cause
bits.comment:
Tx underflow cause register
This bit indicates that an interruption was generated when the Tx fifo is underflow.
This bit is cleared when the Tx_underflow_Int field in the RF_IF_INTERRUPT_CLEAR register is written.

bits.name: Rx Overflow Status
bits.comment:
This bit indicates that the receiver received a new sample when the FIFO was already full.
The new sample is discarded. This bit is cleared when the Rx_Overflow_Int field in the RF_IF_INTERRUPT_CLEAR register is written

bits.name: Tx Overflow Status
bits.comment:
This bit indicates that the user tried to write on the FIFO while it was already full.
This bit is cleared when the Tx_Overflow_Int field in the RF_IF_INTERRUPT_CLEAR register is written

bits.name: Tx Underflow Status
bits.comment:
This bit indicates that the modulator tried to read on the FIFO while it was empty.
This bit is cleared when the Tx_Underflow_Int field in the RF_IF_INTERRUPT_CLEAR register is written

bits.name: Rx Overflow
bits.comment: Clear Rx Interrupt Overflow interrupt.

bits.name: Tx Overflow
bits.comment: Clear Tx Interrupt Overflow interrupt.

bits.name: Tx Underflow
bits.comment: Clear Tx Interrupt Underflow interrupt.

bits.name: NB symbols
bits.comment: Number of symbol to transmit

bits.name: Modulation
bits.comment: 0 for GMSK, 1 for 8PSK

bits.name: End Burst
bits.comment: Indicate an end of the transmit for this current burst

bits.name: Rx_Offset_I
bits.comment: Rx offset measured after calibration for I channel

bits.name: Rx_Offset_Q
bits.comment: Rx offset measured after calibratio for Q channel

bits.name: Enable
bits.comment:
Enable the rf spi
1 = Enable
0 = Disable (will finish current command anyway)

bits.name: CS_Polarity
bits.comment:
Chip select polarity
1 = the chip select is active low
0 = the chip select is active high

bits.name: DigRF_Read
bits.comment:
DigRF Read style mode
1 = DigRF Read style mode (read after CS disabled)
0 = SPI Read mode (read during write)

bits.name: Clocked_Back2Back
bits.comment:
DigRF style clocked back to back mode
1 = clocked back to back transfers using turnarround timing only when more data are present in the FIFO.
0 = stop the clock between each access according to CS_End_Hold and CS_Pulse_Min timings

bits.name: Input_Mode
bits.comment:
Input mode
1 = Record input data to input FIFO
0 = No input data

bits.name: Clock_Polarity
bits.comment:
SPI Clock polarity
1 = the clock disabled level is high, and the first edge is a falling edge.
0 = the clock disabled level is low, and the first edge is a rising edge.

bits.name: Clock_Delay
bits.comment:
Transfer start to first edge delay
value from 0 to 2 is the number of spi clock half period between the Transfer start and the first clock edge.

bits.name: DO_Delay
bits.comment:
Transfer start to first data out delay
value from 0 to 2 is the number of spi clock half period between the Transfer start and the first data out.

bits.name: DI_Delay
bits.comment:
Transfer start to first data in sampled delay
value from 0 to 3 is the number of spi clock half period between the Transfer start and the first data sampled in.
The DI_Delay only specify the sampling time, for frame size, the counter is based on the DO_Delay even in DigRF read mode.

bits.name: CS_Delay
bits.comment:
Transfer start to CS activation delay
value from 0 to 3 is the number of spi clock half period between the Transfer start and the CS activation edge.

bits.name: CS_End_Hold
bits.comment:
Transfer end to chip select deactivation delay
value from 0 to 3 is the number of spi clock half period between the end of transfer (DO) and the CS deactivation edge.
Not used for Clocked_Back2Back mode

bits.name: Frame_Size
bits.comment:
Number of data in the frame, or number of out data in DigRF read mode.
The actual frame size is the value of this register + 1; valid value are 3 to 31 (frame size 4 to 32bits)
The frame size is given for the number of data, the actual number of clock pulses might be greater. First if Clock_Delay < DO_Delay an extra clock pulse is generated, second in case of DigRF read or back2back, some more clock pulses will be generated.

bits.name: CS_End_Pulse
bits.comment:
Chip select deactivation to new start of transfer minimum delay
value from 0 to 3 is the number of spi clock half period between the CS deactivation and a new transfer start (transfer will start only if more data are available in the transmit FIFO)
Not used for Clocked_Back2Back mode

bits.name: Input_Frame_Size
bits.comment:
Frame Size For Input in DigRF input mode
The actual frame size is the value of this register + 1; valid value are 3 to 31 (frame size 4 to 32bits)

bits.name: TurnAround_Time
bits.comment:
TurnAround time: end of write frame to start of read frame delay (in cycles)
value from 0 to 3 is the number of spi clock period between the end of the output frame (without the DO_Delay) and the Input Frame start.
Also used for Clocked_Back2Back mode, when Clocked_Back2Back=1 and there is more data available in the transmit FIFO:
value from 0 to 3 is the number of spi clock period between the end of the frame (without the DO_Delay) and the start of the new frame. (It can also be seen as the number of spi clock period between the end of the last data bit and the start of the new data bit.)

bits.name: Active_Status
bits.comment:
The SPI activity status
1 = A transfer is in progress
0 = The transfer is done

bits.name: Error_Cmd
bits.comment:
Error status
1 = a new command (or gain) has been requested while a command was in progress.
0 = No error
Write 1 to clear.

bits.name: Table_Ovf
bits.comment:
The Gain Table overflow status.
1 = Too many data has been written in the table
Writing a 1 clear the overflow status.

bits.name: Table_Udf
bits.comment:
The Gain Table underflow status.
1 = a next gain request has been received while the read pointer was already at the top of the table.
Writing a '1' clear the underflow status.

bits.name: Cmd_Level
bits.comment: Command FIFO level, number of command in the FIFO

bits.name: Cmd_Ovf
bits.comment:
The command FIFO overflow status.
1 = Too many data has been written in the FIFO
Writing a 1 clear the overflow status.

bits.name: Cmd_Udf
bits.comment:
The command FIFO underflow status.
1 = Data has been requested to read while the FIFO was empty
Writing a 1 clear the underflow status.

bits.name: Cmd_Data_Level
bits.comment: Command FIFO level, number of bytes in the FIFO

bits.name: Cmd_Data_Ovf
bits.comment:
The command data FIFO overflow status.
1 = Too many data has been written in the FIFO
Writing a 1 clear the overflow status.

bits.name: Cmd_Data_Udf
bits.comment:
The command data FIFO underflow status.
1 = Data has been requested to read while the FIFO was empty
Writing a 1 clear the underflow status.

bits.name: Rx_Level
bits.comment: Receive FIFO level, number of bytes in the FIFO

bits.name: Rx_Ovf
bits.comment:
The receive FIFO overflow status.
1 = Too many data has been written in the FIFO
Writing a 1 clear the overflow status.

bits.name: Rx_Udf
bits.comment:
The receive FIFO underflow status.
1 = Data has been requested to read while the FIFO was empty
Writing a 1 clear the underflow status.

bits.name: Rx_Data
bits.comment:
Read in the receive FIFO
Writing this register will write to Cmd_Data fifo (same as Cmd_Data register). This is because this address is used by the IFC channels to access the fifos.

bits.name: Send_Cmd
bits.comment: Writing 1 send the next command in the Cmd FIFO (This replace the TCU next cmd signal)

bits.name: Flush_Cmd_FIFO
bits.comment: Writing 1 flush both Cmd, and cmd_data FIFO, don't do it when SPI is active (transfer in progress)

bits.name: Flush_Rx_FIFO
bits.comment: Writing 1 flush the receive data FIFO, don't do it when SPI is active (transfer in progress)

bits.name: Restart_Gain
bits.comment: Writing 1 place the read pointer at the beginning of the gain table. don't do it when SPI is active (transfer in progress)

bits.name: Reload_Gain
bits.comment: Writing 1 place the write pointer at the beginning of the gain table allowing to fill the table.

bits.name: Drive_Zero
bits.comment: Writing 1 change all the ouputs of the SPI interface to drive a logical '0'. This mode stops when a new command is requested to be send (by TCU) or when writting 0 to this register. This mode is useful when powering off the tranciever chip connected to the RF_SPI.

bits.name: Cmd_Size
bits.comment: Write the size in bytes of the next command in the FIFO

bits.name: Cmd_Mark
bits.comment:
Write 1 to mark the command.
Marked commands are discarded if Enable_Rf_Spi_Marked_Cmd is low in the tcu register.

bits.name: Cmd_Data
bits.comment: Write in the Command data FIFO

bits.name: Gain_Size
bits.comment: Size of a Gain command in bytes.

bits.name: Gain_Data
bits.comment: Write in the Gain Table (the pointer auto increments)

bits.name: Cmd_Data_DMA_Done_Cause
bits.comment:
Cmd_Data_DMA_Done IRQ Cause bit
1 = the IRQ was triggered by the end of the DMA transfer to the cmd FIFO.
To clear it write 1 in this bit or Cmd_Data_DMA_Done_Status bit.

bits.name: Cmd_FIFO_empty_Cause
bits.comment:
Cmd_FIFO_empty IRQ Cause bit
1 = the IRQ was triggered because the Cmd_FIFO is empty.
To clear it, fill the FIFO.

bits.name: Cmd_Threshold_Cause
bits.comment:
Cmd_Threshold IRQ Cause bit
1 = the IRQ was triggered because the Cmd_FIFO level is below the Cmd_Threshold.
To clear it, fill the FIFO.

bits.name: Rx_FIFO_full_Cause
bits.comment:
Rx_FIFO_full IRQ Cause bit
1 = the IRQ was triggered because the Rx_Data_FIFO is full.
To clear it, read from the FIFO.

bits.name: Rx_Threshold_Cause
bits.comment:
Rx_Threshold IRQ Cause bit
1 = the IRQ was triggered because the Rx_Data_FIFO level is over the Rx_Threshold.
To clear it, read from the FIFO.

bits.name: Error_Cause
bits.comment:
Error IRQ Cause bit
1 = the IRQ was triggered because an error occured. Read the Status register to check the kind of error.
To clear it, clear it in the Status register.

bits.name: Cmd_Data_DMA_Done_Status
bits.comment:
Cmd_Data_DMA_Done IRQ Status bit
1 = the end of the DMA transfer to the cmd FIFO occured.
To clear it write 1 in this bit or Cmd_Data_DMA_Done_Cause bit.

bits.name: Cmd_FIFO_empty_Status
bits.comment:
Cmd_FIFO_empty IRQ Status bit
1 = the Cmd_FIFO is empty.

bits.name: Cmd_Threshold_Status
bits.comment:
Cmd_Threshold IRQ Status bit
1 = the Cmd_FIFO level is bellow the Cmd_Threshold.

bits.name: Rx_FIFO_full_Status
bits.comment:
Rx_FIFO_full IRQ Status bit
1 = the Rx_Data_FIFO is full.

bits.name: Rx_Threshold_Status
bits.comment:
Rx_Threshold IRQ Status bit
1 = the Rx_Data_FIFO level is over the Rx_Threshold.

bits.name: Error_Status
bits.comment:
Error IRQ Status bit
1 = an error occured. Read the Status register to check the kind of error.

bits.name: Cmd_Data_DMA_Done_Mask
bits.comment:
Cmd_Data_DMA_Done IRQ Mask bit
1 = the Cmd_Data_DMA_Done IRQ is enabled
0 = the Cmd_Data_DMA_Done IRQ is disabled

bits.name: Cmd_FIFO_empty_Mask
bits.comment:
Cmd_FIFO_empty IRQ Mask bit
1 = the Cmd_FIFO_empty IRQ is enabled
0 = the Cmd_FIFO_empty IRQ is disabled

bits.name: Cmd_Threshold_Mask
bits.comment:
Cmd_Threshold IRQ Mask bit
1 = the Cmd_Threshold IRQ is enabled
0 = the Cmd_Threshold IRQ is disabled

bits.name: Rx_FIFO_full_Mask
bits.comment:
Rx_FIFO_full IRQ Mask bit
1 = the Rx_FIFO_full IRQ is enabled
0 = the Rx_FIFO_full IRQ is disabled

bits.name: Rx_Threshold_Mask
bits.comment:
Rx_Threshold IRQ Mask bit
1 = the Rx_Threshold IRQ is enabled
0 = the Rx_Threshold IRQ is disabled

bits.name: Error_Mask
bits.comment:
Error IRQ Mask bit
1 = the Error IRQ is enabled
0 = the Error IRQ is disabled

bits.name: Cmd_Threshold
bits.comment: Command FIFO Threshold, number of command in the FIFO bellow which the Cmd_Threshold_IRQ is triggered.

bits.name: Rx_Threshold
bits.comment: Receive FIFO Threshold, number of bytes in the FIFO above which the Rx_Threshold_IRQ is triggered.

bits.name: Divider
bits.comment:
Clock Divider
The state machine clock is generated by dividing the system clock by the value of this register + 1. So the output clock is divided by (register + 1)*2

bits.name: Clock_Limiter
bits.comment:
When enabled the clock input to the divider is not the system clock, but a limited version of it: It cannot be above 52MHz, so the output clock will never be above 26MHz.
for system clock of 104Mhz the clock input to the divider is 52Mhz, for system clock of 78Mhz the clock input to the divider is 39Mhz, for lower system clock value, the input to the divider is the system clock.

bits.name: Enable
bits.comment: Enables the SIM Card IF module

bits.name: Parity
bits.comment: Selects the parity generation/detection

bits.name: PERF
bits.comment:
Parity Error Receive Feed-through
0 = Don't store bytes with detected parity errors
1 = Feed-through bytes with detected parity errors

bits.name: Filter_Disable
bits.comment:
Enable or disable NULL (0x60) character filtering when SIM card sends NULL to reset WWT timer.
0 = Enable NULL character filtering, NULL characters are not reported if not data.
1 = Disable NULL character filtering. NULL characters (0x60) are transferred to the SCI data buffer.

bits.name: ClockStop
bits.comment:
Manual SCI Clock Stop control. Manually starts and stops the SCI clock. This bit must be set to '1' when Autostop mode is enabled.
0 = Enable the SCI clock
1 = Disable SCI clock

bits.name: AutoStop_En_H
bits.comment:
Enables automatic clock shutdown when command is complete. Enabling this will generate the necessary startup and shutdown delays required by the SIM protocol.
0 = Auto clock control not enabled. SCI clock controlled by SCI_Clockstop bit
1 = Auto clock control enabled.

bits.name: MSBH_LSBL
bits.comment:
Sets the transmission and reception bit order:
0 = LSB is sent/recieved first (Direct convention)
1 = MSB is sent/received first (Inverse convention)

bits.name: LLI
bits.comment:
Logic Level Invert:
0 = Logic level 0 data is sent/received as '0' or 'A' which is the same as the start bit. (Direct convention)
1 = Logic level 0 data is sent/received as '1' or 'Z' which is the opposite of the start bit. (Inverse convention)

bits.name: PEGen_Len
bits.comment:
Parity Error signal length. This configuration bit can be used to extend the duration of the parity error signal generation from 1 ETU to 1.5 ETU
0 = Parity Error signal duration is 1 ETU starting at 10.5 ETU
1 = Parity Error signal duration is 1.5 ETU starting at 10.5 ETU

bits.name: Parity_En
bits.comment:
Enable or disable parity error checking on the receive data
0 = Disable parity error checking
1 = Enable parity error checking

bits.name: Stop_Level
bits.comment:
Logical value of the clock signal when SCI clock is stopped (either due to automatic shutdown or manual shutdown)
0 = Stop clock at low level
1 = Stop clock at high level

bits.name: ARG_H
bits.comment: Automatic Reset Generator. Write a '1' to this bit to initiate an automatic reset procedure on the SIM. Write '0' to switch back to SCI_Reset control (bit 20). An ARG interrupt will be generated if the ARG process succeeded or failed. The ARG status bit (ARG_Det) must be read to determine if a reset response from the card was detected. This bit needs to be cleared between ARG attempts.

bits.name: AFD_En_H
bits.comment:
Automatic format detection. This bit is generally set in conjunction with the ARG_H bit to enable automatic detection of the data convention.
1 = Enable TS detection and automatic convention settings programming
0 = disable automatic settings and use the register bits (MSBH_LSBL and LLI) to control the convention

bits.name: Tx_Resend_En_H
bits.comment:
1 = Enable automatic resend of characters when Tx parity error is detected
0 = Disable automatic resend

bits.name: Reset
bits.comment:
Direct connection to the SIM card reset pin. This is overridden when ARG_H is enabled
0 = SCI_Reset low voltage
1 = SCI Reset high voltage

bits.name: Dly_Sel
bits.comment:
This selects between two delay times for the automatic clock stop startup and shutdown:
0 = short delay
Startup/Shutdown : 744 SCI clocks / 1860 SCI clocks
1 = long delay
Startup/Shutdown : (2 x 744) SCI clocks / (2 x 1860) SCI clocks

bits.name: Par_Chk_Offset
bits.comment: Allows fine control of the parity check position during the parity error time period.

bits.name: Reserved
bits.comment:
These bits are reserved and must be written as '00' for the SCI module to work properly:
"11" = Ser In <- Ser Out loopback
"10" = Ser In <- Ser In (unmasked)
others = Ser In <- Ser In masked with Txing_H (normal mode)

bits.name: RxData_Rdy
bits.comment:
Returns the status of the Rx FIFO:
0 = Rx FIFO empty
1 = There is at least 1 character in the Rx FIFO

bits.name: Tx_FIFO_Rdy
bits.comment:
Returns the status of the Tx FIFO:
0 = Tx FIFO is full
1 = There is at least 1 free spot in the Tx FIFO

bits.name: Format_Det
bits.comment:
Returns the status of the automatic format detection after reset:
0 = TS character has not been detected in the ATR
1 = TS character has been detected and SCI module is using the automatic convention settings
This bit is cleared when the AFD_En bit is cleared

bits.name: ARG_Det
bits.comment:
Returns the status of the automatic reset procedure:
0 = ARG detection has failed
1 = ARG detection has detected that the SIM has responded to the reset
This bit is used in conjunction with the ARG interrupt. The ARG interrupt will be generated at the successful or unsuccessful termination of the ARG process. This bit can be used to determine the success or failure.

bits.name: Reset_Det
bits.comment: This is the status of the Reset pin when automatic reset generation is enabled. This bit can be used to discover whether the SIM card that has successfully responded to an ARG procedure has an active high or active low reset. (Det means 'Detection')

bits.name: Clk_Rdy_H
bits.comment:
Status of the control signal to the clock control module. This bit respects the startup and shutdown phases, so during these times, the clock may actually be on, but it is not considered to be 'ready'
0 = SCI clock may be on or off but is not ready for use
1 = SCI clock is on and ready for use

bits.name: Clk_Off
bits.comment:
Status bit of the Sci clock.
0 = Sci clock is ON
1 = Sci clock is OFF

bits.name: Rx_Err
bits.comment: A receive parity error was detected. Reading this register clears the bit.

bits.name: Tx_Err
bits.comment: A transmit parity error was detected. Reading this register clears the bit.

bits.name: RxOverflow
bits.comment: The internal receive FIFO has reached an overflow condition. Reading this register clears the bit.

bits.name: TxOverflow
bits.comment: The internal transmit FIFO has reached an overflow condition. Reading this register clears the bit.

bits.name: AutoStop_State
bits.comment: Returns the state of the clock management state machine when AutoStop mode is enabled. This value is '00' when manual mode is selected.

option.name: Startup_phase
option.comment: Clock is on, but not ready to be used.

option.name: Auto_on
option.comment: Clock is on and ready to be used

option.name: Shutdown_phase
option.comment: Clock is still on, but should not be used.

option.name: Clock_off
option.comment: Clock is off.

bits.name: Data_IN
bits.comment: Writing to this register will send the data to the SIM card. If automatic clock shutdown is enabled, the appropriate delay will be applied before the data is actually sent.

bits.name: Data_OUT
bits.comment: Reading this register will read from the receive data FIFO.

bits.name: ClkDiv
bits.comment: Clock divider for generating the baud clock from the SCI clock. This value must match the value used by the SIM card whose default value is 0x174.

bits.name: ClkDiv_16
bits.comment: Secondary clock divider for generating 16x baud clock.

bits.name: MainDiv
bits.comment:
Main clock divider to generate the SCI clock. This value should be calculated as follows:
MainDiv = Clk_Sys/(2xSCI_Clk) - 1
where SCI_Clk is in the range of 3-5 MHz as specified in the SIM specification.

bits.name: Clk_Inv
bits.comment:
Inverts the polarity of the SCI clock to the SIM card.
0 = No inversion
1 = Invert external SCI clock

bits.name: RxCnt
bits.comment: This value should be programmed with the number of expected characters to receive. It will be decremented each time a character is actually received and should be 0 when the transfer is complete. If a character is sent after the RxCnt reaches zero, the extra character flag will be set but this value will stay at zero.

bits.name: Clk_Persist
bits.comment:
When in automatic clock shutdown mode, this bit can prevent the clock from entering shutdown mode when the transfer is complete. This should be used for multi-transfer commands where the clock must not be shut down until the command is complete. This bit must be programmed for each transfer.
1 = Keep clock on
0 = Allow clock shutdown when transfer is complete

bits.name: ChGuard
bits.comment: This is the extra guard time that can be added to the 2 ETU minimum (and default) guard time between successive transmitted characters. This should be programmed depending on the SIM's ATR. The total ETU guard time will be ChGuard + 1.

bits.name: TurnaroundGuard
bits.comment:
Turnaround guard time configuration. This value can be used to adjust the delay between the leading edge of a received character and the leading edge of the next transmitted character. The minimum time specified in the SIM recommendation is 16 ETU. The number of ETUs can be calculated using the following formula:
Total Turnaround Time (in ETUs) = 11 + TurnaroundGuard

bits.name: WI
bits.comment:
Work Waiting Time factor. A timeout will be generated when the WWT is exceeded. The WWT is calculated by:
WWT = 960 x WI x (F/Fi)
where Fi is the main SCI clock frequency (3-5 MHz) and F is 372 before an enhanced PPS and 512 after an enhanced PPS.
The SCI_WI value must be calculated as follows:
SCI_WI = WI * D
Thus, by default (WI = 10) this value needs to be set to 10 before an EPPS, but needs to be scaled to WI*D=80 after the EPPS procedure.

bits.name: Tx_PERT
bits.comment: Number of times to try resending character when the SIM indicates a parity error.

bits.name: Ch_Filt
bits.comment: Value of the character to be filtered. 0x60 is the NULL character in the SIM protocol. If character filtering is enabled, the first 0x60 character that is received by the SIM during a transfer will not be recorded. The purpose of this character is to enable the SIM to reset the WWT counter when the SIM is not ready to send the data. This filter has no effect on characters within the datastream.

reg.name: dbg
reg.comment: UNDOCUMENTED FEATURE

reg.name: Int_Cause

bits.name: Rx_Done
bits.comment: Number of expected Rx characters, as programmed in the RxCnt register, has been received.

bits.name: Rx_Half
bits.comment: Receiver FIFO is half full.

bits.name: WWT_Timeout
bits.comment: No Tx character has been sent NOR any Rx character detected within the WWT timeout.

bits.name: Extra_Rx
bits.comment: An extra character has been received after the number of characters in RxCnt has been received.

bits.name: Resend_Ovfl
bits.comment: The automatic re-transmit of parity error characters has exceeded the threshold specified in the Tx_PERT field.

bits.name: ARG_End
bits.comment: End of the ARG sequence. The status register must be read to determine whether the ARG sequence was successful or not.

reg.comment: This register is a READ ONLY register that returns the logical and of the SCI_INT_STATUS register and the SCI_INT_MASK. If any of these bits is '1', the SCI module will generate an interrupt. Bits 21:16 return the status of the interrupt which is the interrupt state before the mask is applied. These bits should only be used for debugging.

reg.name: Int_Clr

bits.name: Rx_Done
bits.comment: Number of expected Rx characters, as programmed in the SCI_RxCnt register, has been received.

bits.name: Rx_Half
bits.comment: Receiver FIFO is half full.

bits.name: WWT_Timeout
bits.comment: No Tx character has been sent NOR any Rx character detected within the WWT timeout.

bits.name: Extra_Rx
bits.comment: An extra character has been received after the number of characters in SCI_RxCnt has been received.

bits.name: Resend_Ovfl
bits.comment: The automatic re-transmit of parity error characters has exceeded the threshold specified in the SCI_Tx_PERT field.

bits.name: ARG_End
bits.comment: End of the ARG sequence. The status register must be read to determine whether the ARG sequence was successful or not.

reg.comment: This is a WRITE ONLY register that is used to clear an SCI interrupt. Write a '1' to the interrupt that is to be cleared. Writing '0' has no effect.

reg.name: Int_Mask

bits.name: Rx_Done
bits.comment: Number of expected Rx characters, as programmed in the SCI_RxCnt register, has been received.

bits.name: Rx_Half
bits.comment: Receiver FIFO is half full.

bits.name: WWT_Timeout
bits.comment: No Tx character has been sent NOR any Rx character detected within the WWT timeout.

bits.name: Extra_Rx
bits.comment: An extra character has been received after the number of characters in SCI_RxCnt has been received.

bits.name: Resend_Ovfl
bits.comment: The automatic re-transmit of parity error characters has exceeded the threshold specified in the SCI_Tx_PERT field.

bits.name: ARG_End
bits.comment: End of the ARG sequence. The status register must be read to determine whether the ARG sequence was successful or not.

reg.comment: This register is READ/WRITE register that enables the desired interrupt. A '1' in a bit position indicates that the corresponding interrupt is enabled and if the interrupt occurs, the SCI will generate a hardware interrupt.

bits.name: Enable
bits.comment: Enable the module and activate the chip select selected by CS_sel field.

bits.name: CS_sel
bits.comment: Selects the active CS.

bits.name: Input_mode
bits.comment:
When set to 1 the inputs are activated, else only the output is driven and no data are stored in the receive FIFO.
Notes: The Input_mode bit status is also readable onto the bit rxtx_buffer[31].

bits.name: Clock_Polarity
bits.comment:
The spi clock polarity
when '0' the clock disabled level is low, and the first edge is a rising edge.
When '1' the clock disabled level is high, and the first edge is a falling edge.

bits.name: Clock_Delay
bits.comment: Transfer start to first edge delay value from 0 to 2 is the number of spi clock half period between the CS activation and the first clock edge.

bits.name: DO_Delay
bits.comment: Transfer start to first data out delay value from 0 to 2 is the number of spi clock half period between the CS activation and the first data out

bits.name: DI_Delay
bits.comment:
Transfer start to first data in sample delay value from 0 to 3 is the number of spi clock half period between the CS activation and the first data in sampled.
NOTE: DI_Delay must be less or equal to DO_Delay + CS_Delay + 2.
In other words DI_Delay can be 3 only if DO_Delay and CS_Delay are not both equal to 0.

bits.name: CS_Delay
bits.comment: Transfer end to chip select deactivation delay value from 0 to 3 is the number of spi clock half period between the end of transfer and CS deactivation

bits.name: CS_Pulse
bits.comment: Chip select deactivation to reactivation minimum delay value from 0 to 3 is the number of spi clock half period between the CS deactivation and a new CS activation (CS will activate only if more data are available in the transmit FIFO)

bits.name: Frame_Size
bits.comment:
Frame Size
The frame size is the binary value of this register + 1 valid value are 3 to 31 (frame size 4 to 32bits)

bits.name: OE_delay
bits.comment:
OE delay
When 0: regular mode, SPI_DO pin as output only.
Value from 1 to 31 is the number of data out to transfert before the SPI_DO pin switch to input.

bits.name: ctrl_data_mux_sel
bits.comment:
Selects the active CS and Input_reg either from the ctrl or rxtx_buffer register.
If SPI FIFO 8b or 32b, when set to "0": CS from CS_sel and INPUT from Input_mode in the register ctrl.
Only if SPI FIFO 32b, when set to "1": CS and INPUT from SPI DATA.(Do not work for FIFO8b)

bits.name: Input_sel
bits.comment:
Selects the input line to be used as SPI data in.(Not used for SPI3)
when "00" the SPI_DI_0 is used.
When "01" the SPI_DI_1 is used.
When "10" the SPI_DI_2 is used.
When "11" reserved.

bits.name: Active_Status
bits.comment: '1' when a transfer is in progress.

bits.name: Cause_Rx_Ovf_Irq
bits.comment:
The receive FIFO overflow irq cause.
Writing a '1' clear the receive overflow status and cause.

bits.name: Cause_Tx_Th_Irq
bits.comment: The transmit FIFO threshold irq cause.

bits.name: Cause_Tx_Dma_Irq
bits.comment:
The transmit Dma Done irq cause.
Writing a '1' clear the transmit Dma Done status and cause.

bits.name: Cause_Rx_Th_Irq
bits.comment: The receive FIFO threshold irq cause.

bits.name: Cause_Rx_Dma_Irq
bits.comment:
The receive Dma Done irq cause.
Writing a '1' clear the receive Dma Done status and cause.

bits.name: Tx_Ovf
bits.comment:
The transmit FIFO overflow status.
Writing a '1' clear the transmit overflow status and cause.

bits.name: Rx_Udf
bits.comment:
The receive FIFO underflow status.
Writing a '1' clear the receive underflow status and cause.

bits.name: Rx_Ovf
bits.comment:
The receive FIFO overflow status.
Writing a '1' clear the receive overflow status and cause.

bits.name: Tx_Th
bits.comment: The transmit FIFO threshold status.

bits.name: Tx_Dma_Done
bits.comment:
The transmit Dma Done status.
Writing a '1' clear the transmit Dma Done status and cause.

bits.name: Rx_Th
bits.comment: The receive FIFO threshold status.

bits.name: Rx_Dma_Done
bits.comment:
The receive Dma Done status.
Writing a '1' clear the receive Dma Done status and cause.

bits.name: Tx_Space
bits.comment:
Transmit FIFO Space
Number of empty spot in the FIFO

bits.name: Rx_Level
bits.comment:
Receive FIFO level
Number of DATA in the FIFO

bits.name: FIFO_Flush
bits.comment: Writing '1' flush both FIFO, don't do it when SPI is active (transfer in progress)

reg.name: rxtx_buffer
reg.comment:
Spi fifo size: Either 8bits, either 32bits.
32b FIFO
rxtx_bufferRange [31]Range [30:29]Range [Frame_Size-1:0]
DATA_INInput_dataCS_dataR/WADDRESSDATA
DATA_OUTInput_dataCS_dataDATA

bits.name: DATA_IN
bits.comment: Write to the transmit FIFO

bits.name: DATA_OUT
bits.comment: Read in the receive FIFO.

bits.name: CS
bits.comment: Chip Select on which write the data written in the Fifo.

bits.name: READ_ENA
bits.comment: Set this bit to one when the data received while sending this peculiar data are expected to be kept in the FIFO, otherwise no data is recorded in the FIFO.

bits.name: CS_Polarity
bits.comment: Chip select polarity

option.name: active high
option.comment: chip select is active high

option.name: active low
option.comment: chip select is active low

bits.name: Clock_Divider
bits.comment:
Clock Divider
The state machine clock is generated by dividing the system clock by the value of this register + 1.
So the output clock is divided by (register + 1)*2

bits.name: Clock_Limiter
bits.comment:
When enabled the clock input to the divider is not the system clock, but a limited version of it: It cannot be above 52MHz, so the output clock will never be above 26MHz.
for system clock of 104Mhz the clock input to the divider is 52Mhz, for system clock of 78Mhz the clock input to the divider is 39Mhz, for lower system clock value, the input to the divider is the system clock.

bits.name: Access_Count
bits.comment:
Access counter reader (full 24bits view, 8 lower bit are also readable in latency register).
For masters: count the number of access
For slaves: count the number of access by checking the falling edge of select signal.

bits.name: Use
bits.comment:
Bus usage counter reader.
For the bus: Count the cycles when the bus is used (by any master)
For masters: Count cycles when selected master is granted
For slaves: Count cycles when select signal is high.

bits.name: Latency
bits.comment:
Latency counter reader (0xffffff means overflow)
In Max mode, it's updated after each access, else it's adding the latency from all access in the time window
For slaves it counts the duration of each access (in mean mode, it will give the same value as Use)
For masters: count cycles between rise of request and first access.
For slaves: count the duration of access by counting the high cycles. In that case it is equivalent to the use counter except in max mode where it counts the max by access not by time window.

bits.name: Access_Cnt
bits.comment:
Number of access (0xff means overflow)
In max mode: 0 if no access, 1 if at least 1 access.
In mean mode: it counts the number of access during the time window.
For masters: count the number of access
For slaves: count the number of access by checking the falling edge of select signal.
It is the same as the Access_Count register except that the value is saturated on 8 bits. It's repeated here to garanty coherence with Latency to enable calculs of Mean Latency by doing the following operation:
Mean_Latency = Latency/Access_Cnt .

comment.strong: This register is used to Lock and Unlock the protected registers.

bits.name: Scratch
bits.comment: Scratch register: used for debug

bits.name: Write Unlock Status
bits.comment:
Is set to 1 when a write attempt has been done on a protected register
Can be reset by writing 0xa50000 or 0xa50001 to the debug register (With the LSB at 1 to unlock the protected registers, with the LSB at 0 to lock them)

bits.name: Write Unlock
bits.comment:
When this bit is set to 1, the protected registers are accessible
When this bit is set to 0, the protected registers can not be written
Write 0xa50000 to the debug register to set this bit to 0
Write 0xa50001 to the debug register to set this bit to 1

reg.name: Sys_Rst_Set
reg.comment: This register is protected.

bits.name: Set_Sys_Rst
bits.comment:
Writing a 1 to any of the reset bit will reset the corresponding module and leave it in reset state
Reading this register returns the reset state of all the corresponding modules
0 : in reset
1 : out of reset

bits.name: Set_Rst_Out
bits.comment:
Writing a 1 to this bit will output a 0 on the RST_OUT pin
Reading this bit will return the RST_OUT line state.

bits.name: Soft_Rst
bits.comment: Writing a 1 to this bit will reset the entire chip.

bits.name: Clr_Sys_Rst
bits.comment:
Writing a 1 to any of the reset bit will take the corresponding module out of reset state
Reading this register returns the reset state of all the corresponding modules
0 : in reset
1 : out of reset

bits.name: Clr_Rst_Out
bits.comment:
Writing a 1 to this bit will output a 1 on the RST_OUT pin
Reading this bit will return the RST_OUT line state.

reg.name: BB_Rst_Set
reg.comment: This register is protected.

bits.name: Set_BB_Rst
bits.comment:
Writing a 1 to any of the reset bit will reset the corresponding module and leave it in reset state
Reading this register returns the reset state of all the corresponding modules
0 : in reset
1 : out of reset

bits.name: Set_RST_BB_FULL
bits.comment:
Writing a 1 to this reset bit will reset the all modules on the baseband and leave them in reset state. (this resets more modules than all lower bits of this register)
Reading this register returns the reset state of the full baseband side.
0 : in reset
1 : out of reset

bits.name: Clr_BB_Rst
bits.comment:
Writing a 1 to any of the reset bit will take the corresponding module out of reset state
Reading this register returns the reset state of all the corresponding modules
0 : in reset
1 : out of reset

bits.name: Clr_RST_BB_FULL
bits.comment:
Writing a 1 to this reset bit will take all the modules on the baseband out of reset state. (modules can be kept in reset if the corresponding bit in lower bits of this register is still forcing it's reset)
Reading this register returns the reset state of the full baseband side.
0 : in reset
1 : out of reset

reg.comment: Register protected by Write_Unlocked_H.

bits.comment: Mode of the Pll. This register is set to enable by the LPS_start_ExtPll_pulse_H.

bits.name: Pll_Lock_Reset
bits.comment: Used to reset the PLL Lock Detector.

option.name: Pass
option.comment: In this mode the output of the PLL is its input clock divided by the proper dividers

option.name: Bypass
option.comment: In this mode the output of the PLL is its input clock

bits.name: Pll_Clk_Fast_Enable
bits.comment: Enables the Fast Clock from the ExtPll (Clock Gate Reg Resync).

reg.comment: This register is protected.

bits.name: Slow_sel_RF
bits.comment: PreSelects between RF clock and Oscillator clock for Clock Slow

bits.name: Sys_sel_Fast
bits.comment: Selects between the Slow clock and the Fast Clock (Pll clock) and Selects between the Slow clock and the Xcpu Clock

option.name: Ok
option.comment: When 1, the clock from the XCver is detected.

option.name: No
option.comment: When 0, the clock from the XCver is not detected.

bits.name: RF_Detect_Bypass
bits.comment:
If RF_Detect_Bypass = 0, RF clock is selected when she is detected.
If RF_Detect_Bypass = 1, RF clock is selected even she is not detected.

bits.name: RF_Detect_Reset
bits.comment:
When 1, The RF clock detection counter is force reseted.
When 0, The RF clock detection counter is enabled.

bits.name: RF_selected_L
bits.comment: 0 when RF clock is effectively selected for Slow Clock. RF clock selection is not done until the clock has been detected.

bits.name: PLL_bypass_Lock
bits.comment:
When set to 1, the system clock will switch to the fast clock even if the pll is not locked.
When set to 0, the system clock is only allowed to switch to the fast clock if the pll is locked

bits.name: Fast_Selected_L
bits.comment: 0 when Fast clock is effectively selected. Fast clock selection is not done until the PLL has locked.

bits.name: Freq
bits.comment: Bit force_div_update in this register is protected.

Note: for unvalid values the system will run at 26MHz
any writing to this register will trigger an update request. The update will be effective when the gsm clocks are in the proper phase to avoid schronization loss unless bit force_div_update is written '1'.

bits.name: force_div_update
bits.comment:
Allows to switch the system clock divider without taking care of the gsm clocks
1 : update is immediate
0 : update is dependent of the gsm clocks phase to avoid loosing synchronization

bits.name: req_div_update
bits.comment: Status to check if a request to update the pll divider is pending.

bits.name: Mem_Freq
bits.comment: Note: for unvalid values the memory interface will run at 13MHz

bits.name: Voc_Freq
bits.comment: Note: for unvalid values Voc will run at 13MHz

bits.name: Voc_Sel_PLL
bits.comment: Selects between the Slow clock and the Pll clock

reg.name: Cfg_Clk_Out
reg.comment: This register is protected.

bits.name: ClkOut_Divider
bits.comment: The generated clock frequency is equal to the 156MHz divided by this value + 2. The 156MHz clock comes from a PLL.

bits.name: ClkOut_Sel
bits.comment: Selects between the Slow clock and the Pll clock

bits.name: gpadc_clk_div
bits.comment: Clock divider for GPADC Clock. The clock is equal to 26 MHz divided by value + 2. Set divider to 13 to get 2MHz frequency.

bits.name: gpadc_clk_pol
bits.comment:
Clock Polarity for GPADC Clock
1 = Inverted

bits.name: gpadc_clk_en_mode
bits.comment:
Enable mode for GPADC Clock
0 = Auto
1 = Manual

bits.name: AudioBCK_Divider
bits.comment: The generated clock frequency is equal to the 156MHz divided by this value + 2. The 156MHz clock comes from a PLL.

bits.name: Aif_Tx_Stb_Div
bits.comment: This divider generates strobe which goes to AIF. The generated strobe frequency is equal to the 48MHz divided by this value + 2, please notice this frequency should be 2 x AU_TX_STB freq, which is sent to analog macro.

bits.name: Aif_Tx_Stb_En
bits.comment: Enable TX strobe which goes to AIF.

bits.name: Uart_Divider
bits.comment:
The generated clock frequency is equal to the selected source frequency divided by this value + 2 (see bit 12 clock select for source selection).
The generated clock must be 4 or 16 times the expected baud rate depending on the Uart settings (see Uart section for details).

option.name: Slow
option.comment: The Uart clock is generated from the Slow clock divided by the divider value + 2

option.name: PLL
option.comment: The Uart clock is generated from a 156MHz clock generated by the PLL.

bits.name: PWM_Divider
bits.comment: The Pwm reference clock frequency is the system clock divided by this register value + 1.

bits.name: AUXCLK_EN
bits.comment: AUXCLK out enable. (26MHz coming from Xcver)

bits.name: Clk_Dbg_Divider
bits.comment: The generated clock frequency is equal to the 156MHz divided by this value + 2. The 156MHz clock comes from a PLL.

bits.name: CLK_CAMERA_OUT_EN
bits.comment: Clk camera out enable.

bits.name: CLK_CAMERA_DIV_SRC_SEL
bits.comment: Selects from which clock the Clk camera is generated.

bits.name: CLK_CAMERA_OUT_DIV
bits.comment: Clock camera out divider. clock frequency = selected clock source frequency / (value + 2). See bit 4 CLK_CAMERA_OUT_SRC_SEL for source selection.

bits.name: CLK_CAMERA_OUT_SRC_SEL
bits.comment: Selection between the output of the divider, the 32K clock, or the 26M clock.

reg.name: Cfg_AHB
reg.comment: This register is protected.

option.name: Disable
option.comment: The master is never granted on the System AHB

bits.name: BB_New_Arbitration
bits.comment: The new arbitration scheme will give the priority to a unsplitted master over a new comer who was not splitted before.

option.name: Enable

option.name: Disable

option.name: Normal

option.name: Force
option.comment: The master is Unsplitted

option.name: R
option.comment: Breakpoint triggered when a data is read at XCpu_Dbg_Addr

option.name: W

option.name: RW

bits.name: Breakpoint address
bits.comment: Physical address of breakpoint

option.name: I

option.name: R
option.comment: Breakpoint triggered when a data is read at BCpu_Dbg_Addr

option.name: W

option.name: RW

bits.name: Stalled

bits.name: Breakpoint address
bits.comment: Physical address of breakpoint

bits.name: XCpu_Use_Mode
bits.comment: When 1 the XCPU deselects its cache rams automatically when not in use, when 0 this feature is disabled.

bits.name: XCpu_Clk_Off_Mode
bits.comment: When 1 the cache rams are automatically deselected when the XCPU clock is shutdown, when 0 this feature is disabled.

bits.name: BCpu_Clk_Off_Mode

bits.name: WatchDog_Reset

option.name: Happened
option.comment: A watchdog reset has happened

option.name: No
option.comment: No watchdog reset happened since the last HW reset or power on.

bits.comment: Writing a 1 to this bit will reset the bits watchdog_Reset cause, GlobalSoft_Reset cause and HostDebug_Reset cause to 0.

option.name: Happened
option.comment: A reset was initiated from Global soft reset register

option.name: No
option.comment: The reset was not from the soft reset register.

option.name: Happened
option.comment: A reset was initiated from the Host interface

option.name: No
option.comment: The reset was not from the debug interface.

option.name: Happened
option.comment: An Alarm occur from the calendar

option.name: No
