bits.name: Boot_Mode
bits.comment:
This contains the state of boot mode pins latched during Reset.
bit 16: BOOT_MODE_NO_AUTO_PU.
bit 17: BOOT_MODE_FORCE_MONITOR.
bit 18: BOOT_MODE_UART_MONITOR_ENABLE.
bit 19: BOOT_MODE_USB_MONITOR_DISABLE.
bit 20: reserved
bit 21: BOOT_MODE_FLASH_ADMUX.
see BootSequence for details.
This register is not reseted by a software or host reset.

bits.name: SW_Boot_Mode
bits.comment:
Software boot mode (Reseted at zero by external reset pin)
This register is not reseted by a software or host reset.

bits.name: Fonctional_Test_Mode
bits.comment: When 1 the chip has booted in fonctional test mode (for chip production tests).

reg.name: WakeUp
reg.comment: This register is protected.

bits.name: force_Wakeup
bits.comment: When 1, the wake up is set. When 0, the wake up is clear .

reg.name: Ignore_Charger
reg.comment: This register is protected.

bits.name: Ignore_Charger
bits.comment: When 1, the CHG_MASK line to PMU is set. When 0, it is cleared.

bits.name: ch_to_use
bits.comment:
This field indicates which standard channel to use.
Before using a channel, the CPU read this register to know which channel must be used. After reading this registers, the channel is to be regarded as busy.
After reading this register, if the CPU doesn't want to use the specified channel, the CPU must write a disable in the control register of the channel to release the channel.
0000 = use Channel0
0001 = use Channel1
0010 = use Channel2
...
0111 = use Channel7
1111 = all channels are busy

bits.name: ch_enable
bits.comment:
This register indicates which channel is enabled. It is a copy of the enable bit of the control register of each channel. One bit per channel, for example:
0000_0000 = All channels disabled
0000_0001 = Ch0 enabled
0000_0010 = Ch1 enabled
0000_0100 = Ch2 enabled
0000_0101 = Ch0 and Ch2 enabled
0000_0111 = Ch0, Ch1 and Ch2 enabled
1111_1111 = all channels enabled

bits.name: ch_busy
bits.comment: This register indicates which standard channel is busy (this field doesn't include the RF_SPI channel). A standard channel is mark as busy, when a channel is enabled or a previous reading of the GET_CH register, the field CH_TO_USE indicates this channel. One bit per channel

bits.name: dbg_status
bits.comment:
Debug Channel Status .
0= The debug channel is running (not idle)
1= The debug channel is in idle mode

bits.name: enable
bits.comment:
Channel Enable, write one in this bit enable the channel.
When the channel is enabled, for a peripheral to memory transfer the DMA wait request from peripheral to start transfer.

bits.name: disable
bits.comment:
Channel Disable, write one in this bit disable the channel.
When writing one in this bit, the current AHB transfer and current APB transfer (if one in progress) is completed and the channel is then disabled.

bits.name: autodisable
bits.comment:
Set Auto-disable mode
0 = when TC reach zero the channel is not automatically released.
1 = At the end of the transfer when TC reach zero the channel is automatically disabled. the current channel is released.

bits.name: Size
bits.comment:
Peripheral Size
0= 8-bit peripheral
1= 32-bit peripheral

bits.name: req_src
bits.comment: Select DMA Request source

bits.name: flush
bits.comment:
When one, flush the internal FIFO channel.
This bit must be used only in case of Rx transfer. Until this bit is 1, the APB request is masked. The flush doesn't release the channel.
Before writting back this bit to zero the internal fifo must empty.

bits.name: enable
bits.comment: Enable bit, when '1' the channel is running

bits.name: fifo_empty
bits.comment: The internal channel fifo is empty

bits.name: start_addr
bits.comment:
AHB Address. This field represent the start address of the transfer.
For a 32-bit peripheral, this address must be aligned 32-bit.

bits.name: tc
bits.comment:
Transfer Count, this field indicated the transfer size in bytes to perform.
During a transfer a write in this register add the new value to the current TC.
A read of this register return the current current transfer count.

bits.name: enable
bits.comment:
Channel Enable, write one in this bit enable the channel.
This channel works only in fifo mode.

bits.name: disable
bits.comment: Channel Disable, write one in this bit to disable the channel.

bits.name: enable
bits.comment: Enable bit, when '1' the channel is running

bits.name: fifo_empty
bits.comment: The internal channel fifo is empty

bits.name: fifo_level
bits.comment: Internal fifo level

bits.name: start_AHB_addr
bits.comment:
AHB Start Address.
This field represent the start address of the fifo. The start address must 32-bit aligned.

bits.name: end_AHB_addr
bits.comment:
AHB End Address.
This field represent the last address of the fifo (it is the first address not used in the fifo).
The end address must 32-bit aligned.

bits.name: tc
bits.comment:
Transfer Count, transfer size in bytes.
This bit indicated the transfer size in bytes to perform. Up to 16kbytes per transfer.
During a transfer a write in this register add the new value to the current TC. A read of this register return the current current transfer count.

reg.name: Cause
reg.comment:
If cause is not null and interrupt are enabled then the interrupt line 0 is driven on the system CPU.
The cause for the Irq sources, one bit for each module's irq source.
The cause is the actual Irq source masked by the mask register.

reg.name: Status
reg.comment:
The status for the level Irq sources, one bit for each module's irq source.
The status reflect the actual Irq source.

reg.name: Mask_Set
reg.comment:
Writing '1' sets the corresponding bit in the mask register to '1'.
Reading gives the value of the mask register.

reg.name: Mask_Clear
reg.comment:
Writing '1' clears the corresponding bit in the mask register to '0'.
Reading gives the value of the mask register.

bits.name: Main_IRQ
bits.comment:
This is the Main Irq source it drive the system CPU interrupt line 0.
This bit comes from the modules irq and is masked by the Mask and SC registers.

bits.name: Page_Spy_IRQ
bits.comment:
This is the Page Spy Irq source it drive the system CPU interrupt line 3.
This bit is controlled by the page spy module.

bits.name: Debug_IRQ
bits.comment: This is the debug Irq source, the value written here drives the system CPU interrupt line 4.

bits.name: Host_IRQ
bits.comment:
This is the Host Irq source it drive the system CPU interrupt line 5.
This bit is controlled by the host internal register.

bits.name: IntEnable_Status
bits.comment: Status of the Interrupt enable semaphore bit.

bits.name: IntEnable
bits.comment:
Interrupt enable semaphore, used for critical section.
Read returns its value and then clears it to '0' disabling interrupts.
Write the read value to restore the previous state, this will exit the critical section.

reg.name: WakeUp_Mask
reg.comment: Each bit to '1' in that registers allows the correcponding interrupt to wake up the System CPU (i.e.: Reenable it's clock, see CLOCK_SYS_ENABLE and CLOCK_SYS_DISABLE registers in sys_ctrl registers section)

bits.name: Sleep
bits.comment: Writing '1' to this bit will put the XCPU to sleep (i.e.: Disable it's clock, see CLOCK_SYS_ENABLE and CLOCK_SYS_DISABLE registers in sys_ctrl registers section)

reg.name: Pulse_Mask_Set
reg.comment:
Writing '1' sets the corresponding bit in the mask register to '1'.
Reading gives the value of the mask register.

reg.name: Pulse_Mask_Clr
reg.comment:
Writing '1' clears the corresponding bit in the mask register to '0'.
Reading gives the value of the mask register.

reg.name: Pulse_Clear
reg.comment:
Writing '1' clears the corresponding Pulse IRQ.
Pulse IRQ are set by the modules and cleared here.

reg.name: Pulse_Status
reg.comment:
The status for the Pulse Irq sources, one bit for each module's irq source.
The status reflect the actual Irq source.

entry.name: Clr_TCO_0
entry.comment:
Clear TCO 0 : set the TCO 0 to the inactive state
To clear TCO n, use event 2*n

entry.name: Set_TCO_0
entry.comment:
Set TCO 0 : set the TCO 0 to the active state
To set TCO n, use event 2*n+1

entry.name: Start_GMSK
entry.comment: starts modulation and output on IQ DAC

bits.name: Load_Val
bits.comment: Value loaded into the TCU counter when the Load bit is set to 1

bits.name: Load
bits.comment:
Writing a 1 to this bit will load the TCU with the TCU loadval value
Writing a 0 has no effect

option.name: Normal
option.comment: Normal Behavior, The programmation area is copied to the active area when the tcu wraps

option.name: Force_Only
option.comment: The programmation area is copied into the active area only when force latch is used

bits.name: Wrap_Val
bits.comment:
TCU counter wrap value.
The TCU counter returns to 0 when this value is reached

bits.name: Cur_Val
bits.comment: TCU counter current value

bits.name: ForceLatch
bits.comment: Writing 1 transfer the programmed events to the active area.

bits.name: Force_NoEvent
bits.comment: Writing 1 to this bit with one of the ForceLatch bit will force the corresponding Active Area to receive no events (i.e. clear it) instead of transfering the programmed area.

bits.name: ClearProgArea
bits.comment: Writing 1 clears the Program Area

bits.name: TCO_Polarity
bits.comment: Configure the TCO polarity

bits.name: Write_Error
bits.comment:
Error Status: become 1 when writing to Program Area while the TCU is coping the Program Area to the Active Area. In this case the write is ignored.
Write 1 to clear it.

bits.name: Debug_Active
bits.comment: This bit allows to access directly the active area for debug purposes

option.name: Debug
option.comment: the active area is directly mapped instead of the program area.

bits.name: Disable_TCO
bits.comment:
Writing 1 disable the events that affect corresponding TCO.
Reading return the actual enable state.

bits.name: Disable_Internal_TCO
bits.comment:
Writing 1 disable the events that affect corresponding TCO.
Reading return the actual enable state.

bits.name: Disable_Send_Spi_Cmd
bits.comment:
Writing 1 disable the events SEND_SPI_CMD.
Reading return the actual enable state.

bits.name: Disable_Next_Gain
bits.comment:
Writing 1 disable the events NEXT_GAIN.
Reading return the actual enable state.

bits.name: Disable_First_Gain
bits.comment:
Writing 1 disable the events FIRST_GAIN.
Reading return the actual enable state.

bits.name: Disable_Next_Fc
bits.comment:
Writing 1 disable the events NEXT_FC.
Reading return the actual enable state.

bits.name: Disable_Ramp
bits.comment:
Writing 1 disable the corresponding Ramp event.
Reading return the actual enable state.

bits.name: Disable_Rx_SOC
bits.comment:
Writing 1 disable the events RX_SOC.
Reading return the actual enable state.

bits.name: Disable_DigRF_Strobe
bits.comment:
Writing 1 disable the events DIGRF_STB.
Reading return the actual enable state.

bits.name: Disable_Bcpu_Irq
bits.comment:
Writing 1 disable the corresponding BCPU TCU irq event.
Reading return the actual enable state.

bits.name: Disable_Xcpu_Irq
bits.comment:
Writing 1 disable the corresponding XCPU TCU irq event.
Reading return the actual enable state.

bits.name: Disable_Rf_Spi_Marked_Cmd
bits.comment:
Writing 1 disable the marked rf spi commands (cf RF SPI).
Reading return the actual enable state.

bits.name: Enable_TCO
bits.comment:
Writing 1 enable the events that affect corresponding TCO.
Reading return the actual enable state.

bits.name: Enable_Internal_TCO
bits.comment:
Writing 1 enable the events that affect corresponding TCO.
Reading return the actual enable state.

bits.name: Enable_Send_Spi_Cmd
bits.comment:
Writing 1 enable the events SEND_SPI_CMD.
Reading return the actual enable state.

bits.name: Enable_Next_Gain
bits.comment:
Writing 1 enable the events NEXT_GAIN.
Reading return the actual enable state.

bits.name: Enable_First_Gain
bits.comment:
Writing 1 enable the events FIRST_GAIN.
Reading return the actual enable state.

bits.name: Enable_Next_Fc
bits.comment:
Writing 1 enable the events NEXT_FC.
Reading return the actual enable state.

bits.name: Enable_Ramp
bits.comment:
Writing 1 enable the corresponding Ramp event.
Reading return the actual enable state.

bits.name: Enable_Rx_SOC
bits.comment:
Writing 1 enable the events RX_SOC.
Reading return the actual enable state.

bits.name: Enable_DigRF_Strobe
bits.comment:
Writing 1 enable the events DIGRF_STB.
Reading return the actual enable state.

bits.name: Enable_Bcpu_Irq
bits.comment:
Writing 1 enable the corresponding BCPU TCU irq event.
Reading return the actual enable state.

bits.name: Enable_Xcpu_Irq
bits.comment:
Writing 1 enable the corresponding XCPU TCU irq event.
Reading return the actual enable state.

bits.name: Enable_Rf_Spi_Marked_Cmd
bits.comment:
Writing 1 enable the marked rf spi commands (cf RF SPI).
Reading return the actual enable state.

bits.name: Set_TCO
bits.comment:
Writing 1 set corresponding TCO to the active state (The actual line state also depends on TCO_Polarity).
Reading returns the actual state of all TCOs.

bits.name: Clr_TCO
bits.comment:
Writing 1 set corresponding TCO to the inactive state (The actual line state also depends on TCO_Polarity).
Reading returns the actual state of all TCOs.

bits.name: Enable_Qbit
bits.comment: Enable the Quarter bit generation (required for normal TCU operation)

bits.name: Enable_DAI_Simple_208K
bits.comment: Enable the 208kHz pulse generation for DAI Simple. (!) When enabling the clock field Enable_Qbit should also be enabled.

bits.name: LPS_SF_Enable
bits.comment:
Lps Skip Frame Enable.
When enabled the frame interrupt are masked until the programmed number of frames are elapsed.
This is done by masking the frame interrupt line from the regular TCU counter, and counting the frames. Also when activating the LowPower SkipFrame the frame counter is tranfered to the low power counter that will update it based on the 32kHz Clock.

bits.name: LPS_SF_LowPower
bits.comment: Controls the Lps Low Power Counters (counters at 32kHz) usage.

option.name: Stop
option.comment: Disable the Low Power Counters.

option.name: SkipFrame
option.comment: The Low Power Counters are started in Skip Frame Mode. In this mode the Low Power Counter are used to maintain the Time base, The Skip Frame Must be enabled as this is the Low Power extention of the Skip Frame feature.

option.name: Calib
option.comment: Start the calibration. The Low Power Counters are used to Calibrate the 32kHz clock against the System Clock, The Calibration is required to compensate from temperature variation. Note that the Skip Frame can also be enabled during calibration (but not with low power).

bits.name: LPS_SF_Ready
bits.comment:
Lps Skip Frame Ready, status of the state machines to keep valid state between system clock and 32Khz clock.
Must read as '1' before entering Low Power Skip Frame or Calibration mode.

bits.name: LPS_SF_SlowRunning
bits.comment:
'1' when Lps Skip Frame Low Power Counters are Running.
When entering Low Power Skip Frame, the counters are not immediately started, they wait for the nextFrame interrupt. Reading this status allow to know if the counters are running, and the System Clock can be safely disabled.

bits.name: LPS_SF_CalibrationDone
bits.comment: '1' when the Lps Skip Frame Calibration is Done.

bits.name: LPS_SF_PU_Reached
bits.comment: '1' when the Lps Skip Frame Power-up sequence frame is reached.

bits.name: LPS_SF_Frame
bits.comment:
Number of frames to Skip.
If the power up sequence is enabled, frames are skipped until both this number is reached and the powerup sequence has finished.
Note: The power up sequence must be Done before the the frame LPS_SF_Frame ends.

bits.name: LPS_SF_PU_Frame
bits.comment: Number of frames before activating the Power-up sequence.

bits.name: LPS_SF_Restart_Time
bits.comment:
For LowPower SkipFrame mode: Value to restart TCU (and frame interrupt generation) on the system clock counter after a low power phase.
For Calibration mode: number of 32k cycles for the calibration.

bits.name: LPS_SF_Frame_Period
bits.comment: Value of the frame period in system clock count.

reg.name: LPS_SF_Rate
reg.comment: The rate is the number of System Clocks per 32kHz Clocks.

bits.name: LPS_SF_Rate_Int
bits.comment: Integer part of the rate.

bits.name: LPS_SF_Rate_Frac
bits.comment: Fractional part of the rate.

bits.name: LPS_SF_Elapsed_Frames
bits.comment:
Current number of elapsed frames.
Valid when Skip Frame is Enabled.

bits.name: LPS_SF_Sys_Count
bits.comment:
Value of the system clock counter at the end of calibration (when CalibrationDone is '1' in LPS_SF_Status register).
The hardware behind it is reused during other operation, reading that register at any other time will return an undefined value.

bits.name: LPS_PU_Enable
bits.comment:
Enable the Power-Up Sequence.
This bit is automatically cleared when the sequence is Done.

bits.name: LPS_PU_ForceStart
bits.comment:
When '1' forces the Power-up sequence to start.
This bit is automatically cleared when the sequence is Done.

bits.name: LPS_PU_CO0_On
bits.comment: This force the Controlled Output 0 (LPSCO[0]) to be Active (See polarity for actual line state).

bits.name: LPS_PU_CO1_On
bits.comment: This force the Controlled Output 1 (LPSCO[1]) to be Active (See polarity for actual line state).

bits.name: LPS_PU_CLK_RF_On
bits.comment: This force the Clock RF control line (CLK_RF_26M_EN) to be on.

bits.name: LPS_PU_SPI_On
bits.comment: This force the SPI to be on.

bits.name: LPS_PU_CO0_Pol
bits.comment:
This sets the Controlled Output 0 (LPSCO[0]) polarity.
Set to '1' if the line is active low.

bits.name: LPS_PU_CO1_Pol
bits.comment:
This sets the Controlled Output 1 (LPSCO[1]) polarity.
Set to '1' if the line is active low.

bits.name: LPS_PU_CLK_RF_Pol
bits.comment:
This sets the Clock RF control line (CLK_RF_26M_EN) polarity.
Set to '1' if the line is active low.

bits.name: LPS_PU_SPI_Step
bits.comment: This selects the step where the SPI is switched on during the power up sequence.

option.name: CO_S1
option.comment: The SPI is switched on at state Controlled Output step 1.

option.name: RFClkReady
option.comment: The SPI is switched on at state RF Clock Ready.

option.name: Ready
option.comment: The Analog SPI is switched on at state Ready.

option.name: Done
option.comment: The Analog SPI is switched on at state Done.

bits.name: LPS_PU_Mask_CO0_S1
bits.comment: This selects the action to take on Controlled Output 0 (LPSCO[0]) during the state Controlled Output step 1.

option.name: Enable
option.comment: The Controlled Output 0 (LPSCO[0]) is switched on during the state Controlled Output step 1.

option.name: Ignore
option.comment: The Controlled Output 0 (LPSCO[0]) is not changed during the state Controlled Output step 1.

bits.name: LPS_PU_Mask_CO1_S1
bits.comment: This selects the action to take on Controlled Output 1 (LPSCO[1]) during the state Controlled Output step 1.

option.name: Enable
option.comment: The Controlled Output 1 (LPSCO[1]) is switched on during the state Controlled Output step 1.

option.name: Ignore
option.comment: The Controlled Output 1 (LPSCO[1]) is not changed during the state Controlled Output step 1.

bits.name: LPS_PU_Mask_CO0_S2
bits.comment: This selects the action to take on Controlled Output 0 (LPSCO[0]) during the state Controlled Output step 2.

option.name: Enable
option.comment: The Controlled Output 0 (LPSCO[0]) is switched on during the state Controlled Output step 2.

option.name: Ignore
option.comment: The Controlled Output 0 (LPSCO[0]) is not changed during the state Controlled Output step 2.

bits.name: LPS_PU_Mask_CO1_S2
bits.comment: This selects the action to take on Controlled Output 1 (LPSCO[1]) during the state Controlled Output step 2.

option.name: Enable
option.comment: The Controlled Output 1 (LPSCO[1]) is switched on during the state Controlled Output step 2.

option.name: Ignore
option.comment: The Controlled Output 1 (LPSCO[1]) is not changed during the state Controlled Output step 2.

bits.name: LPS_PU_Mask_CLK_RF
bits.comment: Mask Start Clock RF: When set to '1' the Clock RF is not started during the power up sequence.

option.name: Enable
option.comment: The Clock RF is started during the state RF Clock Enable.

option.name: Ignore
option.comment: The Clock RF is not started.

bits.name: LPS_PU_Mask_St_PLL
bits.comment: Mask Start Pll: When set to '1' the Pll is not started during the power up sequence.

option.name: Enable
option.comment: The Pll is started during the state RF Clock Ready.

option.name: Ignore
option.comment: The Pll is not started.

bits.name: LPS_PU_Mask_Sw_RF
bits.comment: Mask Switch to RF clock: When set to '1' the slow clock is not switched to the RF clock during the power up sequence.

option.name: Switch
option.comment: The System Clock is switched to Clock RF during the state RF Clock Ready.

option.name: Ignore
option.comment: The System Clock is not switched.

bits.name: LPS_PU_Mask_Sw_Fast
bits.comment: Mask Switch to Fast clock: When set to '1' the system clock is not switched to the Fast clock during the power up sequence.

option.name: Switch
option.comment: The System Clock is switched to Clock Pll during the state Pll Clock Ready.

option.name: Ignore
option.comment: The System Clock is not switched.

bits.name: LPS_PU_CPU_Done
bits.comment:
When set to '1' Ready step is done for the CPU.
When both the CPU and the TCU are done, the state Ready ends and the state machine goes to state Done.
This bit is automatically cleared when the sequence is Done.

bits.name: LPS_PU_Run_TCU_WakeUp
bits.comment:
Run the TCU in WakeUp mode:
In WakeUp mode, the TCU is started at time 0, process the TCU events until it reaches the Event WAKEUP_DONE.
The WakeUp mode is started during the state Ready, the state Ready ends when both the CPU and the TCU are done.
If the TCU is not started in WakeUp mode, it is considered Done for the Ready end.

bits.name: LPS_PU_Done
bits.comment: The Power-Up Sequence is done (or idle).

bits.name: LPS_PU_Ready
bits.comment: The Power-Up Sequence is in state Ready.

bits.name: LPS_PU_tCO_S2
bits.comment: Time in 32Khz clocks to wait between the states Controlled Output step 1 and Controlled Output step 2.

bits.name: LPS_PU_tCLK_RF_EN
bits.comment: Time in 32Khz clocks to wait between the states Controlled Output step 2 and RF Clock Enable.

bits.name: LPS_PU_tCLK_RF
bits.comment:
Time in 32Khz clocks to wait between the states RF Clock Enable and RF Clock Ready.
This is the time to wait after VCO enable before switching to RF and starting the PLL.

bits.name: LPS_PU_tCLK_PLL
bits.comment:
Time in 32Khz clocks to wait between the states RF Clock Ready and Pll Clock Ready.
This is the time to wait after starting the PLL before switching to the Fast clock or checking if the PLL is locked.

bits.name: LPS_PU_PLL_Lock
bits.comment: If set waits for the lock status of the PLL after the LPS_PU_PLL time is elapsed before switching to the Fast Clock (in Fast step), else switch immediately after the expiration of the time.

option.name: Bypass
option.comment: After expiration of the time LPS_PU_tClk_PLL go directly to the state Pll Clock Ready.

option.name: Check
option.comment: After expiration of the time LPS_PU_tClk_PLL, wait for the PLL to be locked before going to the state Pll Clock Ready.

bits.name: LPS_IRQ_Calibration_Done_Cause
bits.comment:
1 when the IRQ was triggered because the calibration is done.
Write 1 in cause or status bit to clear.

bits.name: LPS_IRQ_Slow_Running_Cause
bits.comment:
1 when the IRQ was triggered because the Slow Counter started.
Write 1 in cause or status bit to clear.

bits.name: LPS_IRQ_PU_Done_Cause
bits.comment:
1 when the IRQ was triggered because the Power-Up sequence is done.
Write 1 in cause or status bit to clear.

bits.name: LPS_IRQ_PU_Ready_Cause
bits.comment:
1 when the IRQ was triggered because the Power-Up sequence reached the state Ready.
Write 1 in cause or status bit to clear.

bits.name: LPS_IRQ_PU_Reached_Cause
bits.comment:
1 when the IRQ was triggered because the Power-Up frame was reached.
Write 1 in cause or status bit to clear.

bits.name: LPS_IRQ_Calibration_Done_Status
bits.comment:
1 when the calibration is done.
Write 1 in cause or status bit to clear.

bits.name: LPS_IRQ_Slow_Running_Status
bits.comment:
1 when the Slow Counter started.
Write 1 in cause or status bit to clear.

bits.name: LPS_IRQ_PU_Done_Status
bits.comment:
1 when the Power-Up sequence is done.
Write 1 in cause or status bit to clear.

bits.name: LPS_IRQ_PU_Ready_Status
bits.comment:
1 when the Power-Up sequence reached the state Ready.
Write 1 in cause or status bit to clear.

bits.name: LPS_IRQ_PU_Reached_Status
bits.comment:
1 when the Power-Up frame was reached.
Write 1 in cause or status bit to clear.

bits.name: LPS_IRQ_Calibration_Done_Mask
bits.comment: when 1 the LPS_IRQ_Calibration_Done is enabled.

bits.name: LPS_IRQ_Slow_Running_Mask
bits.comment: when 1 the LPS_IRQ_Slow_Running is enabled.

bits.name: LPS_IRQ_PU_Done_Mask
bits.comment: when 1 the LPS_IRQ_PU_Done is enabled.

bits.name: LPS_IRQ_PU_Ready_Mask
bits.comment: when 1 the LPS_IRQ_PU_Ready is enabled.

bits.name: LPS_IRQ_PU_Reached_Mask
bits.comment: when 1 the LPS_IRQ_PU_Reached is enabled.

bits.name: Event_Time
bits.comment: The event Id will be executed when the TCU counter reaches the value programmed in Event time field of this register.

bits.name: Event_Id
bits.comment: Event to be executed when the TCU counter reaches the programmed event time.

bits.name: LoadVal
bits.comment: Value loaded to OS timer.

bits.name: Enable
bits.comment:
Write '1' to this bit will enable OS timer.
When read, the value is what we have written to this bit, it changes immediately after been written.

bits.name: Enabled
bits.comment:
Read this bit will get the information if OS timer is really enabled or not. This bit will change only after the next front of 16 KHz system clock.
'1' indicates OS timer enabled.
'0' indicates OS timer not enabled.

bits.name: Cleared
bits.comment:
Read this bit will get the information if OS timer interruption clear operation is finished or not.
'1' indicates OS timer interruption clear operation is on going.
'0' indicates no OS timer interruption clear operation is on going.

bits.name: Repeat
bits.comment:
Write '1' to this bit will set OS timer to repeat mode.
When read, get the information if OS timer is in repeat mode.
'1' indicates OS timer in repeat mode.
'0' indicates OS timer not in repeat mode.

bits.name: Wrap
bits.comment:
Write '1' to this bit will set OS timer to wrap mode.
When read, get the information if OS timer is in wrap mode.
'1' indicates OS timer in wrap mode.
'0' indicates OS timer not in wrap mode.

bits.name: Load
bits.comment: Write '1' to this bit will load the initial value to OS timer.

bits.name: CurVal
bits.comment: Current value of OS timer. The value is 24 bits and the first 8 bits are sign extension of the most important bit. A negative value indicates that the timer has wraped.

bits.name: Start
bits.comment: Write '1' to this bit will enable watchdog timer and Load it with WDTimer_LoadVal.

bits.name: WDEnabled
bits.comment:
Read this bit will get the information if watchdog timer is really enabled or not. This bit will change only after the next front of 32 KHz system clock.
'1' indicates watchdog timer is enabled, if current watchdog timer value reaches 0, the system will be reseted.
'0' indicates watchdog timer is not enabled.

bits.name: Stop
bits.comment: Write '1' to this bit will stop watchdog timer.

bits.name: ReLoad
bits.comment:
Write '1' to this bit will load WDTimer_LoadVal value to watchdog timer.
Use this bit to implement the watchog keep alive.

bits.name: LoadVal
bits.comment: Load value of watchdog timer. Number of 32kHz Clock before Reset.

bits.name: Interval_En
bits.comment:
This bit enables interval IRQ mode.
'0': hw delay timer does not generate interval IRQ.
'1': hw delay timer generate an IRQ each interval.

bits.name: Interval
bits.comment:
interval of generating an HwTimer IRQ.
"00": interval of 1/8 second.
"01": interval of 1/4 second.
"10": interval of 1/2 second.
"11": interval of 1 second.

bits.name: CurVal
bits.comment: Current value of the hardware delay timer. The value is incremented every 61 us. This timer is running all the time and wrap at value 0xFFFFFFFF.

bits.name: OSTimer_Mask
bits.comment: Set mask for OS timer IRQ.

bits.name: HWTimer_Wrap_Mask
bits.comment: Set mask for hardwre delay timer wrap IRQ.

bits.name: HWTimer_Itv_Mask
bits.comment: Set mask for hardwre delay timer interval IRQ.

bits.name: OSTimer_Mask
bits.comment: Clear mask for OS timer IRQ.

bits.name: HWTimer_Wrap_Mask
bits.comment: Clear mask for hardwre delay timer wrap IRQ.

bits.name: HWTimer_Itv_Mask
bits.comment: Clear mask for hardwre delay timer interval IRQ.

bits.name: OSTimer_Clr
bits.comment: Clear OS timer IRQ.

bits.name: HWTimer_Wrap_Clr
bits.comment: Clear hardware delay timer wrap IRQ.

bits.name: HWTimer_Itv_Clr
bits.comment: Clear hardware delay timer interval IRQ.

bits.name: OSTimer_Cause
bits.comment: OS timer IRQ cause.

bits.name: HWTimer_Wrap_Cause
bits.comment: hardware delay timer wrap IRQ cause.

bits.name: HWTimer_Itv_Cause
bits.comment: hardware delay timer interval IRQ cause.

bits.name: OSTimer_Status
bits.comment: OS timer IRQ status.

bits.name: HWTimer_Wrap_Status
bits.comment: hardware delay timer wrap IRQ status.

bits.name: HWTimer_Itv_Status
bits.comment: hardware delay timer interval IRQ status.

bits.name: Enable
bits.comment:
Allows to turn off the UART:
0 = Disable
1 = Enable

bits.name: Data Bits
bits.comment:
Number of data bits per character (least significant bit first):
0 = 7 bits
1 = 8 bits

bits.name: Tx Stop Bits
bits.comment:
Stop bits controls the number of stop bits transmitted. Can receive with one stop bit (more inaccuracy can be compensated with two stop bits when divisor mode is set to 0).
0 = one stop bit is transmitted in the serial data.
1 = two stop bits are generated and transmitted in the serial data out.

bits.name: Parity Enable
bits.comment: Parity is enabled when this bit is set.

bits.name: Parity Select
bits.comment:
Controls the parity format when parity is enabled:
00 = an odd number of received 1 bits is checked, or transmitted (the parity bit is included).
01 = an even number of received 1 bits is checked or transmitted (the parity bit is included).
10 = a space is generated and received as parity bit.
11 = a mark is generated and received as parity bit.

bits.name: Divisor Mode
bits.comment:
Selects the divisor value used to generate the baud rate frequency (BCLK) from the SCLK (see UART Operation for details). If IrDA is enable, this bit is ignored and the divisor used will be 16.
0 = (BCLK = SCLK / 4)
1 = (BCLK = SCLK / 16)

bits.name: IrDA Enable
bits.comment: When set, the UART is in IrDA mode and the baud rate divisor used is 16 (see UART Operation for details).

bits.name: DMA Mode
bits.comment: Enables the DMA signaling for the Uart_Dma_Tx_Req_H and Uart_Dma_Rx_Req_H to the IFC.

bits.name: Auto Flow Control
bits.comment: Enables the auto flow control. Uart_RTS is controlled by the Rx RTS bit and the UART Auto Control Flow System. If Uart_CTS become inactive high, the Tx data flow is stopped.

bits.name: Loop Back Mode
bits.comment: When set, data on the Uart_Tx line is held high, while the serial output is looped back to the serial input line, internally. In this mode all the interrupts are fully functional. This feature is used for diagnostic purposes. Also, in loop back mode, the modem control input Uart_CTS is disconnected and the modem control output Uart_RTS are looped back to the inputs, internally. In IrDA mode, Uart_Tx signal is inverted (see IrDA SIR Mode Support).

bits.name: Rx Lock Err
bits.comment: Allow to stop the data receiving when an error is detected (framing, parity or break). The data in the fifo are kept.

bits.name: Rx Break Length
bits.comment: Length of a break, in number of bits.

bits.name: Rx Fifo Level
bits.comment: Those bits indicate the number of data available in the Rx Fifo. Those data can be read.

bits.name: Tx Fifo space
bits.comment: Those bits indicate the number of space available in the Tx Fifo.

bits.name: Tx Active
bits.comment: This bit indicates that the UART is sending data. If no data is in the fifo, the UART is currently sending the last one through the serial interface.

bits.name: Rx Active
bits.comment: This bit indicates that the UART is receiving a byte.

bits.name: Rx Overflow Err
bits.comment: This bit indicates that the receiver received a new character when the fifo was already full. The new character is discarded. This bit is cleared when the UART_STATUS register is written with any value.

bits.name: Tx Overflow Err
bits.comment: This bit indicates that the user tried to write a character when fifo was already full. The written data will not be kept. This bit is cleared when the UART_STATUS register is written with any value.

bits.name: Rx Parity Err
bits.comment: This bit is set if the parity is enabled and a parity error occurred in the received data. This bit is cleared when the UART_STATUS register is written with any value.

bits.name: Rx Framing Err
bits.comment: This bit is set whenever there is a framing error occured. A framing error occurs when the receiver does not detect a valid STOP bit in the received data. This bit is cleared when the UART_STATUS register is written with any value.

bits.name: Rx Break Int
bits.comment: This bit is set whenever the serial input is held in a logic 0 state for longer than the length of x bits, where x is the value programmed Rx Break Length. A null word will be written in the Rx Fifo. This bit is cleared when the UART_STATUS register is written with any value.

bits.name: DCTS
bits.comment: This bit is set when the Uart_CTS line changed since the last time this register has been written. This bit is cleared when the UART_STATUS register is written with any value.

bits.name: CTS
bits.comment:
current value of the Uart_CTS line.
'1' = Tx not allowed.
'0' = Tx allowed.

bits.name: DTR
bits.comment: Current value of the DTR line.

bits.name: Clk Enabled
bits.comment: This bit is set when Uart Clk has been enabled and received by UART after Need Uart Clock becomes active. It serves to avoid enabling RTS too early.

bits.name: Rx Data
bits.comment: The UART_RECEIVE_BUFFER register is a read-only register that contains the data byte received on the serial input port. This register accesses the head of the receive FIFO. If the receive FIFO is full and this register is not read before the next data character arrives, then the data already in the FIFO will be preserved but any incoming data will be lost. An overflow error will also occur.

bits.name: Tx Data
bits.comment: The UART_TRANSMIT_HOLDING register is a write-only register that contains data to be transmitted on the serial output port. 16 characters of data may be written to the UART_TRANSMIT_HOLDING register before the FIFO is full. Any attempt to write data when the FIFO is full results in the write data being lost.

bits.name: Tx Modem Status
bits.comment: Clear to send signal change detected.

bits.name: Rx Data Available
bits.comment: Rx Fifo at or upper threshold level (current level >= Rx Fifo trigger level).

bits.name: Tx Data Needed
bits.comment: Tx Fifo at or below threshold level (current level <= Tx Fifo trigger level).

bits.name: Rx Timeout
bits.comment: No characters in or out of the Rx Fifo during the last 4 character times and there is at least 1 character in it during this time.

bits.name: Rx Line Err
bits.comment: Tx Overflow, Rx Overflow, Parity Error, Framing Error or Break Interrupt.

bits.name: Tx Dma Done
bits.comment: Pulse detected on Uart_Dma_Tx_Done_H signal.

bits.name: Rx Dma Done
bits.comment: Pulse detected on Uart_Dma_Rx_Done_H signal.

bits.name: Rx Dma Timeout
bits.comment: In DMA mode, there is at least 1 character that has been read in or out the Rx Fifo. Then before received Rx DMA Done, No characters in or out of the Rx Fifo during the last 4 character times.

bits.name: DTR RISE
bits.comment: Rising edge detected on the UART_DTR signal.

bits.name: DTR FALL
bits.comment: Falling edge detected on the UART_DTR signal.

bits.name: Tx Modem Status
bits.comment: Clear to send signal detected. Reset control: This bit is cleared when the UART_STATUS register is written with any value.

bits.name: Rx Data Available
bits.comment: Rx Fifo at or upper threshold level (current level >= Rx Fifo trigger level). Reset control: Reading the UART_RECEIVE_BUFFER until the Fifo drops below the trigger level.

bits.name: Tx Data Needed
bits.comment: Tx Fifo at or below threshold level (current level <= Tx Fifo trigger level). Reset control: Writing into UART_TRANSMIT_HOLDING register above threshold level.

bits.name: Rx Timeout
bits.comment: No characters in or out of the Rx Fifo during the last 4 character times and there is at least 1 character in it during this time. Reset control: Reading from the UART_RECEIVE_BUFFER register.

bits.name: Rx Line Err
bits.comment: Tx Overflow, Rx Overflow, Parity Error, Framing Error or Break Interrupt. Reset control: This bit is cleared when the UART_STATUS register is written with any value.

bits.name: Tx Dma Done
bits.comment: This interrupt is generated when a pulse is detected on the Uart_Dma_Tx_Done_H signal. Reset control: Write one in this register.

bits.name: Rx Dma Done
bits.comment: This interrupt is generated when a pulse is detected on the Uart_Dma_Rx_Done_H signal. Reset control: Write one in this register.

bits.name: Rx Dma Timeout
bits.comment: In DMA mode, there is at least 1 character that has been read in or out the Rx Fifo. Then before received Rx DMA Done, No characters in or out of the Rx Fifo during the last 4 character times.

bits.name: DTR RISE
bits.comment: This interrupt is generated when a rising edge is detected on the UART_DTR signal. Reset control: Write one in this register.

bits.name: DTR FALL
bits.comment: This interrupt is generated when a falling edge is detected on the UART_DTR signal. Reset control: Write one in this register.

bits.name: Tx Modem Status U
bits.comment: Same as previous, not masked.

bits.name: Rx Data Available U
bits.comment: Same as previous, not masked.

bits.name: Tx Data Needed U
bits.comment: Same as previous, not masked.

bits.name: Rx Timeout U
bits.comment: Same as previous, not masked.

bits.name: Rx Line Err U
bits.comment: Same as previous, not masked.

bits.name: Tx Dma Done U
bits.comment: Same as previous, not masked.

bits.name: Rx Dma Done U
bits.comment: Same as previous, not masked.

bits.name: Rx Dma Timeout U
bits.comment: Same as previous, not masked.

bits.name: DTR RISE U
bits.comment: Same as previous, not masked.

bits.name: DTR FALL U
bits.comment: Same as previous, not masked.

bits.name: Rx Trigger
bits.comment:
Defines the empty threshold level at which the Data Available Interrupt will be generated.
The Data Available interrupt is generated when quantity of data in Rx Fifo > Rx Trigger.

bits.name: Tx Trigger
bits.comment:
Defines the empty threshold level at which the Data Needed Interrupt will be generated.
The Data Needed Interrupt is generated when quantity of data in Tx Fifo <= Tx Trigger.

bits.name: AFC Level
bits.comment:
Controls the Rx Fifo level at which the Uart_RTS Auto Flow Control will be set inactive high (see UART Operation for more details on AFC).
The Uart_RTS Auto Flow Control will be set inactive high when quantity of data in Rx Fifo > AFC Level.

bits.name: RI
bits.comment: Ring indicator. When write '1', set RI bit. When read, get RI bit value.

bits.name: DCD
bits.comment: Data carrier detect. When write '1', set DCD bit. When read, get DCD bit value.

bits.name: DSR
bits.comment: Data set ready. When write '1', set RI bit. When read, get RI bit value.

bits.name: Tx Break Control
bits.comment: Sends a break signal by holding the Uart_Tx line low until this bit is cleared.

bits.name: Tx Finish n Wait
bits.comment: When this bit is set the Tx engine terminates to send the current byte and then it stops to send data.

bits.name: RTS
bits.comment:
Controls the Uart_RTS output.
0 = the Uart_RTS will be inactive high (Rx not allowed).
1 = the Uart_RTS will be active low (Rx allowed).

bits.name: Rx Fifo Reset
bits.comment: Writing a 1 to this bit resets and flushes the Receive Fifo. This bit does not need to be cleared.

bits.name: Tx Fifo Reset
bits.comment: Writing a 1 to this bit resets and flushes the Transmit Fifo. This bit does not need to be cleared.

bits.name: RI
bits.comment: Ring indicator. When write '1', clear RI bit. When read, get RI bit value.

bits.name: DCD
bits.comment: Data carrier detect. When write '1', clear DCD bit. When read, get DCD bit value.

bits.name: DSR
bits.comment: Data set ready. When write '1', clear RI bit. When read, get RI bit value.

bits.name: Tx Break Control
bits.comment: Sends a break signal by holding the Uart_Tx line low until this bit is cleared.

bits.name: Tx Finish n Wait
bits.comment: When this bit is set the Tx engine terminates to send the current byte and then it stops to send data.

bits.name: RTS
bits.comment:
Controls the Uart_RTS output.
0 = the Uart_RTS will be inactive high.
1 = the Uart_RTS will be active low.

bits.name: start_equ
bits.comment: Writing a '1' in this register triggers a Viterbi Equalization process. Ignored if any Viterbi process is already ongoing. Auto-reset.

bits.name: start_dec
bits.comment: Writing a '1' in this register triggers a Viterbi Decoding process. Ignored if any Viterbi process is already ongoing. Auto-reset.

bits.name: start_tb
bits.comment: Writing a '1' in this register triggers the TraceBack process. Ignored if any Viterbi process is already ongoing. Auto-reset.

bits.name: int_mask
bits.comment: When this bit is set, it enables the generation of the VITAC_DONE_H interrupt.

bits.name: punctured
bits.comment: Indicates whether a puncturing scheme has to be used during decoding. If this bit is set to '0', the code is assumed unpunctured and no puncturing matrix is needed.

bits.name: nb_states
bits.comment:
This field sets the number of states of the Trellis:
"00": 16 states
"01": 32 states
"10": 64 states
"11": reserved

bits.name: bkwd_trellis
bits.comment: When this bit is set, the channel symbols are treated in the reverse order, i.e. CH_SYMB_ADDR represents the end of the buffer and the symbols are read out backward.

bits.name: code_rate
bits.comment:
This field sets the convolutional code rate for decoding:
"010": 1/2 rate
"011": 1/3 rate
"100": 1/4 rate
"101": 1/5 rate
"110": 1/6 rate
others: reserved

bits.name: bm_shift_lev
bits.comment:
This field sets the amount of shift right applied at the output of the equalizer BM calculation:
"0000": BM = OUT[30:19]
"0001": BM = OUT[29:18]
...
"1111": BM = OUT[15:4]

bits.name: sv_shift_lev
bits.comment:
This field sets the amount of shift right applied to the difference of the two metrics arriving at a node to create a Softvalue:
"0000": SoftVal = DELTA[15:9]
"0001": SoftVal = DELTA[14:8]
...
"1101": SoftVal = DELTA[2:0]&"0000"
others: reserved

bits.name: nb_symbols
bits.comment: Number of symbols to be Equalized / Decoded. Auto decrement.

bits.name: equ_pending
bits.comment: This bit is high when an equalization process is ongoing. It stays high when the module is stalled during operation.

bits.name: dec pending
bits.comment: This bit is high when an decoding process is ongoing. It stays high when the module is stalled during operation.

bits.name: tb_pending
bits.comment: This bit is high when an traceback process is ongoing. It stays high when the module is stalled during operation.

bits.name: nb_rescales
bits.comment:
After a Viterbi process, this field reports the number of rescaling operations that have been performed along the trellis.
This field is reset at every new Viterbi process.

bits.name: addr
bits.comment:
This is the start address of the channel symbols buffer in SRAM. For Equalization channel symbols are the sampled RF samples (2x12-bits packed complex values), and for Decoding channel symbols are a frame of softvalues (4x8-bits packed).
This address must be 4-bytes aligned, bits[1:0] will be ignored.

bits.name: addr
bits.comment:
For Equalization, this is the base address of the partial sum terms buffer in SRAM. (2x12-bits packed complex values)
For Decoding, this is the base address of the puncturing matrix.
This address must be 4-bytes aligned, bits[1:0] will be ignored.

bits.name: addr
bits.comment:
This is the base address in SRAM of the Path Metrics buffer. The VITAC will read and update PMs according to the scheme given in 1.2.1.2. (2x16-bits packed values).
This address must be 4-bytes aligned, bits[1:0] will be ignored.

bits.name: addr
bits.comment:
This is the start address of the output buffer in SRAM. When in Equalizer mode, the VITAC will output the calculated Softvalues according to the scheme given in 1.2.1.7. When in Decoder mode, the VITAC will output the trace words according to the scheme given in 1.2.2.4.
This address must be 4-bytes aligned, bits[1:0] will be ignored.

bits.name: H0_I_part
bits.comment: Real part of the h0 parameter of the estimated channel response.

bits.name: H0_Q_part
bits.comment: Imaginary part of the h0 parameter of the estimated channel response.

bits.name: HL_I_part
bits.comment: Real part of the hL parameter of the estimated channel response.

bits.name: HL_Q_part
bits.comment: Imaginary part of the hL parameter of the estimated channel response.

bits.name: threshold
bits.comment: This field indicates the threshold value to be reach by every PMs for triggering a rescale operation. The rescale operation consist in subtracting the threshold value to every PMs to avoid overflow during PM update.

reg.name: res_poly
reg.comment: This register bank stores the less significant bit of the output from the coder for a particular code (see 1.2.2.1). The kth butterfly uses the bit k of this register.

bits.name: res_poly
bits.comment: This register stores the less significant bit of the output from the coder for a particular code (see 1.2.2.1). The kth butterfly uses the bit k of this register.

bits.name: it_cause
bits.comment:
This bit is set when the VITAC module finishes an ongoing operation. It can be masked by setting VITAC_CMD(IT_MASK) to '1'.
Resetting this bit is done by writing in IT_CLEAR register.
IT_CAUSE is the image of the VITAC_DONE_H interrupt line to the CPU.

bits.name: it_status
bits.comment: This bit is the unmasked version of the IT_CAUSE bit.

bits.name: it_clear
bits.comment: Setting this bit to '1' resets the VITAC interrupt.

bits.name: biterr_en
bits.comment: Enables the Biterror calculation mode. Auto-reset.

bits.name: dco1p_en
bits.comment: Enables the DC Offset Correction (1st pass) mode. Auto-reset.

bits.name: dco2p_en
bits.comment: Enables the DC Offset Correction (2nd pass) mode. Auto-reset.

bits.name: dco3p_en
bits.comment: Enables the DC Offset Correction (3rd pass) mode. Auto-reset.

bits.name: tscxc_en
bits.comment: Enables the Training Sequence Cross-Correlation mode. Auto-reset.

bits.name: srec_en
bits.comment: Enables the Symbol Re-Construction mode. Auto-reset.

bits.name: bext_en
bits.comment: Enables the Bit Extraction mode. Auto-reset.

bits.name: sproc_en
bits.comment: Enables the Sum Of PROduCt mode. Auto-reset.

bits.name: chest_en
bits.comment: Enables the Channel Estimation mode. Auto-reset.

bits.name: fchxc_en
bits.comment: Enables the FCH Xcorrelation mode. Auto-reset.

bits.name: sldwin_en
bits.comment: Enables the Sliding window mode. Auto-reset.

bits.name: it_mask
bits.comment: Mask of the end of processing interrupt.

bits.name: pack_IQ
bits.comment: Data path setting. Pack I and Q on a single 32-bits word.

bits.name: derotation_en
bits.comment: Data path setting. Enables derotation for DCOC 3pass.

bits.name: nb_iloop
bits.comment: Control setting. Number of internal loop iteration.

bits.name: nb_symb
bits.comment: Control setting. Number of symbols to process.

bits.name: op_pending
bits.comment: This bit is high when an operation is ongoing.

bits.name: it_cause
bits.comment: Masked version of it_status that goes to Interrupt controller.

bits.name: it_status
bits.comment: This bit is set high when an operation is finished. It must be reset before lauching a new operation if Xcor interrupt is enabled.

reg.name: hv0
reg.comment:
Multipurpose Data Register.
Store Training Sequence in TSXC mode.
Store SUM in DCOC 3rd pass mode.
Store bit sequence in SREC mode.
Store SUM in SPROC mode.
Store I SUM in CHEST mode.
Store R(k-1) in FCHXC mode.

bits.name: hv0
bits.comment: Multipurpose.

reg.name: hv1
reg.comment:
Multipurpose Data Register.
Store Training Sequence in TSXC mode.
Store bit sequence in SREC mode.
Store Q SUM in CHEST mode.

bits.name: hv1
bits.comment: Multipurpose.

reg.name: data
reg.comment:
Multipurpose Data Registers.
D0 stores symbols/softvalues/channel taps depending on mode. Not readable.
D1 stores decoded bits/IQ threshols/IQ Offsets/A terms depending on mode. Not readable.
D2 (aka A1) serves as Rd address (decoded bits, A or B terms) / Wr address register (I or packed IQ results, Symbols) / event counter depending on mode.
D3 (aka A2) serves as Wr address (Q results) / event counter depending on mode.
D4 stores results from VITAC / extracted HardValues depending on mode. Not readable.
D5 (aka A3) serves as Wr address (CQ results) Not readable.

bits.name: data
bits.comment: Multipurpose.

bits.name: accuI
bits.comment: I part accumulator register.

bits.name: accuQ
bits.comment: I part accumulator register.

reg.name: addr0
reg.comment:
Address 0 Register.
Stores Rd address for symbols / SoftValues / A terms depending on mode.
Auto increment/decrement/reset.

bits.name: addr0
bits.comment: 32-bit word address (bits 0 and 1 disregarded).

archive.cjoker:
