#define r0 $0 #define r1 $1 #define r2 $2 #define r3 $3 #define r4 $4 #define r5 $5 #define r6 $6 #define r7 $7 #define r8 $8 #define r9 $9 #define r10 $10 #define r11 $11 #define r12 $12 #define r13 $13 #define r14 $14 #define r15 $15 #define r16 $16 #define r17 $17 #define r18 $18 #define r19 $19 #define r20 $20 #define r21 $21 #define r22 $22 #define r23 $23 #define r24 $24 #define r25 $25 #define r26 $26 #define r27 $27 #define r28 $28 #define r29 $29 #define r30 $30 #define r31 $31
#define fp0 $f0 #define fp1 $f1 #define fp2 $f2 #define fp3 $f3 #define fp4 $f4 #define fp5 $f5 #define fp6 $f6 #define fp7 $f7 #define fp8 $f8 #define fp9 $f9 #define fp10 $f10 #define fp11 $f11 #define fp12 $f12 #define fp13 $f13 #define fp14 $f14 #define fp15 $f15 #define fp16 $f16 #define fp17 $f17 #define fp18 $f18 #define fp19 $f19 #define fp20 $f20 #define fp21 $f21 #define fp22 $f22 #define fp23 $f23 #define fp24 $f24 #define fp25 $f25 #define fp26 $f26 #define fp27 $f27 #define fp28 $f28 #define fp29 $f29 #define fp30 $f30 #define fp31 $f31
#define fpucntl $31

reg.name: Data
reg.comment:
The XCpu cache is accessible only when it is disabled or the cpu is stalled.
The bits "3:0" of the address select the Data in the line.
The bits "13:4" of the address select the line.
If the Tag at the corresponding line is valid, the bits "25:14" of the tag are the corresponding address bits.

reg.name: Line
reg.comment:
The XCpu tags are accessible only when the corresponding cache is disabled or the cpu is stalled.
The bits "13:4" of the address select the line

bits.name: Tag
bits.comment: The Tag represents the bits "25:14" of the address present in the corresponding cache Line.

bits.name: Valid
bits.comment: When 1 the Tag is valid

bits.name: rf0_addr
bits.comment: program counter for the RF stage.

option.name: Int
option.comment: Interrupt

option.name: Mod
option.comment: TLB modification exception

option.name: TLBL
option.comment: TLB exception (load or instruction fetch)

option.name: TLBS
option.comment: TLB exception (store)

option.name: AdEL
option.comment: Address error exception (load or instruction fetch)

option.name: AdES
option.comment: Address error exception (store)

option.name: IBE
option.comment: Bus error exception (instruction fetch)

option.name: DBE
option.comment: Bus error exception (data reference: load or store)

option.name: Sys
option.comment: Syscall exception

option.name: Pb
option.comment: Breakpoint exception

option.name: Ri
option.comment: Reserved instruction exception

option.name: CpU
option.comment: Coprocessor Unusable exception

option.name: Ov
option.comment: Arithmetic Overflow exception

bits.name: cp0_Cause_IP_soft
bits.comment: Theses interrupt lines are software interrupts (the cpu can write in the CP0 bits to trigger and clear them).

bits.name: cp0_Cause_IP_ext
bits.comment: Theses interrupt lines maps to the hardware interrupt lines from the corresponding irq module.

bits.name: cp0_Cause_CE
bits.comment: The Coprocessor Error (CE) field indicate the coprocessor unit number referenced when a Coprocessor Unusable exception is taken.

bits.name: cp0_Cause_BD
bits.comment: The Branch Delay (BD) bit indicate whether the last exception was taken while executing in a branch delay slot.

bits.name: cp0_Status_IEc
bits.comment: Current Interrupt Enable

bits.name: cp0_Status_KUc
bits.comment: Current Kernel/User mode

bits.name: cp0_Status_IEp
bits.comment: Previous Interrupt Enable

bits.name: cp0_Status_KUp
bits.comment: Previous Kernel/User mode

bits.name: cp0_Status_IEo
bits.comment: Old Interrupt Enable

bits.name: cp0_Status_KUo
bits.comment: Old Kernel/User mode

bits.name: cp0_Status_IntMask
bits.comment: Interrupt Mask control the enabling of each of the external and software interrupts. (See Cause for more information on interruptions).

bits.name: cp0_Streaming_Disable
bits.comment: This bit control handling of non-cached instruction fetch requests. By default, the system block reads multiple words of data from the AMBA bus in burst transactions and saves them in the Streaming Buffer. Non cached instruction fetch requests get their data directly from the Streaming Buffer. When "1" the cpu does not use the streaming buffer and does not ask for burst requests on the AMBA bus for non-cache instruction fetch requests.

bits.name: cp0_Status_CM
bits.comment:
Cache Miss
Signals that the most recent access to the cachable space resulted in cache miss.

bits.name: cp0_Status_TS
bits.comment: Signals that 2 entries in the TLB matched the virtual address. This is an error condition but the processor takes no action other than signalling it via this bit in the Status Register.

bits.name: cp0_Status_BEV
bits.comment: Select the location of the exception vectors in ROM or in DRAM.

bits.name: cp0_Status_RE
bits.comment: Reverse Endian in User mode. (probably unused in xcpu)

bits.name: cp0_Status_CU_0
bits.comment: Control the Usability of the corresponding Coprocessor Unit. (CP0 is always usable when in Kernel mode, regardless of the setting of the CU_0 bit.

bits.name: cp0_Status_CU_123
bits.comment: Control the Usability of the corresponding Coprocessor Unit.

bits.name: cp0_EPC
bits.comment: Exception Program Counter. Saves the value of the program counter for the instruction that caused the exception.

bits.name: cp0_BadVAddr
bits.comment: Bad virtual address. Saves the address that caused the address exception.

bits.name: AT
bits.comment: assembler temporary register; their values are not preserved across procedure calls.

bits.name: V0
bits.comment:
Used for expression evaluations and for hold integer function results.
Also used to pass the statuc link when calling nested procedure.

bits.name: V1
bits.comment:
Used for expression evaluations and for hold integer function results.
Also used to pass the statuc link when calling nested procedure.

bits.name: A0
bits.comment: register A0 to A3 is used to pass the first 4 words of integer type actual arguments; their values are not preserved across procedure calls.

bits.name: A1
bits.comment: register A0 to A3 is used to pass the first 4 words of integer type actual arguments; their values are not preserved across procedure calls.

bits.name: A2
bits.comment: register A0 to A3 is used to pass the first 4 words of integer type actual arguments; their values are not preserved across procedure calls.

bits.name: A3
bits.comment: register A0 to A3 is used to pass the first 4 words of integer type actual arguments; their values are not preserved across procedure calls.

bits.name: T0
bits.comment: temporary register, used for expression evaluations; their values are not preserved across procedure calls.

bits.name: T1
bits.comment: temporary register, used for expression evaluations; their values are not preserved across procedure calls.

bits.name: T2
bits.comment: temporary register, used for expression evaluations; their values are not preserved across procedure calls.

bits.name: T3
bits.comment: temporary register, used for expression evaluations; their values are not preserved across procedure calls.

bits.name: T4
bits.comment: temporary register, used for expression evaluations; their values are not preserved across procedure calls.

bits.name: T5
bits.comment: temporary register, used for expression evaluations; their values are not preserved across procedure calls.

bits.name: T6
bits.comment: temporary register, used for expression evaluations; their values are not preserved across procedure calls.

bits.name: T7
bits.comment: temporary register, used for expression evaluations; their values are not preserved across procedure calls.

bits.name: S0
bits.comment: saved register; their values must preserved across procedure calls.

bits.name: S1
bits.comment: saved register; their values must preserved across procedure calls.

bits.name: S2
bits.comment: saved register; their values must preserved across procedure calls.

bits.name: S3
bits.comment: saved register; their values must preserved across procedure calls.

bits.name: S4
bits.comment: saved register; their values must preserved across procedure calls.

bits.name: S5
bits.comment: saved register; their values must preserved across procedure calls.

bits.name: S6
bits.comment: saved register; their values must preserved across procedure calls.

bits.name: S7
bits.comment: saved register; their values must preserved across procedure calls.

bits.name: T8
bits.comment: temporary register, used for expression evaluations; their values are not preserved across procedure calls.

bits.name: T9
bits.comment: temporary register, used for expression evaluations; their values are not preserved across procedure calls.

bits.name: K0
bits.comment: reserved for the operating system kernal.

bits.name: K1
bits.comment: reserved for the operating system kernal.

bits.name: GP
bits.comment: contains the global pointer.

bits.name: SP
bits.comment: contains the stack pointer.

bits.name: S8
bits.comment: a saved register (like s0-s7).

bits.name: RA
bits.comment: contains the return address; used for expression evaluation.

bits.name: Debug_Page_Address
bits.comment:
Debug Page Address Register Is a 4 bit register used for extending the address of the debug to enable full access to the cache RAMs.
bit 3 is used when accessing the TAGs to select between Instruction TAG (0) or Data TAG (1).

bits.name: Dcache_Inhibit
bits.comment: when "ON" all accesses for data are treated as non cache. Data is fetched directly from main memory. The content of the Data Cache is not altered.

bits.name: Icache_Inhibit
bits.comment: when "ON" all accesses for instructions are treated as non cache. Data is fetched directly from main memory. The content of the cache is not altered.

bits.name: Cache Hit Disable
bits.comment: when "ON" all accesses to either Instruction or data caches result in a cache miss and a cache refill. This is a quick way to initialize the caches.

var.name: KEY_NB
var.comment: Number of key in the keypad

var.name: LOW_KEY_NB
var.comment: Number of key in the low data register

var.name: HIGH_KEY_NB
var.comment: Number of key in the high data register

bits.name: KP_DATA_L
bits.comment:
For keys in column Idx_KeyOut(from 0 to 3) and in line Idx_KeyIn(from 0 to 7), the pressing status are stored in KP_DATA_L(Idx_KeyOut*8+Idx_KeyIn) :
0 = Released
1 = Pressed

bits.name: KP_DATA_H
bits.comment:
For keys in column Idx_KeyOut(from 4 to 7) and line Idx_KeyIn(from 0 to 7), the pressing status are stored in KP_DATA_H(Idx_KeyIn*8-32+Idx_KeyIn):
0 = Released
1 = Pressed

bits.name: KEYIN_STATUS
bits.comment:
For keys in lines status
0 = Released
1 = Pressed

bits.name: KP_ON
bits.comment:
Indicate Key ON pressing status :
0 = Release
1 = Pressed

bits.name: KP_En
bits.comment:
This bit enables key detection. If this bit is '0', the key detection function is disabled. Key ON is an exception, it can be still detected and generate key interrupt even if KP_En = '0', however in this case, the debouncing time configuration in key control register is ignored and the key ON state is considerred to be stable if it keeps same in consecutive 2 cycles of 16KHz clock.
0 = keypad disable
1 = keypad enable

bits.name: KP_DBN_Time
bits.comment: De-bounce time = (KP_DBN_TIME + 1) * SCAN_TIME, SCAN_TIME = 0.3125 ms * Number of Enabled KeyOut (determined by KP_OUT_MASK). For example, if KP_DBN_TIME = 7, KP_OUT_MASK = "111111", then De-bounce time = (7+1)*0.3125*6=15 ms. The maximum debounce time is 480 ms.

bits.name: KP_ITV_Time
bits.comment: Configure interval of generating an IRQ if one key or several keys are pressed long time. Interval of IRQ generation = (KP_ITV_Time + 1) * (KP_DBN_TIME + 1) * SCAN_TIME. SCAN_TIME = 0.3125 ms * Number of Enabled KeyOut (determined by KP_OUT_MASK). For example, if KP_ITV_TIME = 7, KP_DBN_TIME = 7, KP_OUT_MASK = "111111", then De-bounce time = (7+1)*(7+1)*0.3125*6=120 ms.

bits.name: KP_IN_MASK
bits.comment:
each bit masks one input lines.
'1' = enabled
'0' = disabled
The Key In pins 0 to 5 are muxed with the boot mode pins, latched during Reset.
Key_In 0: BOOT_MODE_NO_AUTO_PU.
Key_In 1: BOOT_MODE_FORCE_MONITOR.
Key_In 2: BOOT_MODE_UART_MONITOR_ENABLE.
Key_In 3: BOOT_MODE_USB_MONITOR_DISABLE.
Key_In 4: reserved

bits.name: KP_OUT_MASK
bits.comment:
each bit masks one output lines.
'1' = enabled
'0' = disabled

bits.name: KP_EVT0_IRQ_MASK
bits.comment:
This bit mask keypad irq generated by event0 (key press or key release event, not including all keys release event which is event1).
0 = keypad event irq disable
1 = keypad event irq enable

bits.name: KP_EVT1_IRQ_MASK
bits.comment:
This bit mask keypad irq generated by event1 (all keys release event).
0 = keypad event irq disable
1 = keypad event irq enable

bits.name: KP_ITV_IRQ_MASK
bits.comment:
This bit mask keypad irq generated by key pressed long time (generated each interval configured in KP_ITV_Time.
0 = keypad interval irq disable
1 = keypad interval irq enable

bits.name: KP_EVT0_IRQ_CAUSE
bits.comment: keypad event0(key press or key release event, not including all keys release which is event1) IRQ cause.

bits.name: KP_EVT1_IRQ_CAUSE
bits.comment: keypad event1(all keys release event) IRQ cause.

bits.name: KP_ITV_IRQ_CAUSE
bits.comment: keypad interval irq cause.

bits.name: KP_EVT0_IRQ_STATUS
bits.comment: keypad event0(key press or key release event, not including all keys release which is event1) irq status.

bits.name: KP_EVT1_IRQ_STATUS
bits.comment: keypad event1(all keys release event) irq status.

bits.name: KP_ITV_IRQ_STATUS
bits.comment: keypad interval irq status.

bits.name: KP_IRQ_CLR
bits.comment: Write '1' to this bit clears key IRQ.

bits.name: PWT_Enable
bits.comment:
Enables the Pulse Width Tone output
1 = Enable PWT output
0 = Disable PWT output

bits.name: PWT_Duty
bits.comment:
The PWT_Duty value can be used to set the approximate volume of the tone.
The PWT_Duty value must be less than or equal to half the PWT_Period value and must be at least a value of 8, otherwise no tone will be generated.

bits.name: PWT_Period
bits.comment:
PWT_Period is the divider value to produce a tone of a given frequency.
To calculate the PWT_Period value, Use the following formula:
PWT_Period = FBASE/FNOTE
where FBASE is the frequency of the PWM module clock (it is based on the system frequency, 26, 39, 52, 78 or 104 MHz divided by 5). FNOTE is the frequency of the desired tone.

bits.name: LPG_Reset_L
bits.comment: Setting this bit to '0' will reset the Light Pulse Generator internal counters.

bits.name: LPG_Test
bits.comment: Setting this bit to '1' will enter LPG test mode.

bits.name: LPG_OnTime
bits.comment: Configures the duty cycle for the Light Pulse Generator by setting the ontime for the LPG output. The actual on-time is calculated as: Tick Period * LPG_OnTime * 256 where the Tick Period is nominally 1/16kHz.

bits.name: LPG_Period
bits.comment:
Configures the main period of the light pulse generator. The period is calculated based on the following configurations:
with the Tick Period ~ 1/16kHz

option.name: 0_125s
option.comment: Tick Period * 2048

option.name: 0_25s
option.comment: Tick Period * 4096

option.name: 0_5s
option.comment: Tick Period * 8192

option.name: 0_75s
option.comment: Tick Period * 12288

option.name: 1s
option.comment: Tick Period * 16384

option.name: 1_25s
option.comment: Tick Period * 20480

option.name: 1_5s
option.comment: Tick Period * 24576

option.name: 1_75s
option.comment: Tick Period * 28672

bits.name: PWL_Min
bits.comment: Sets the lower boundary for PWL pulse. When pulse mode is not used, this is the threshold value for the PWL0. Reading this value will return the current value used for the threshold.

bits.name: PWL_Max
bits.comment: Sets the upper boundary for PWL pulse. When pulse mode is not used, this value is ignored. Reading this value will return the LFSR value used for generating the PWL outputs.

bits.name: PWL0_En_H
bits.comment: When this bit is written with '1', the PWL 0 is enabled and the output is a PRBS whose average on-time is proportional to PWL_Min. This bit is cleared when either of the Force bits are written. Reading this bit will return the current state of the PWL0 enable.

bits.name: PWL0_Force_L
bits.comment: Writing a '1' to this bit will force the PWL0 to output a low value. If the PWL0 was previously enabled, this will clear the bit.

bits.name: PWL0_Force_H
bits.comment: Writing a '1' to this bit will force the PWL0 to output a high value. If the PWL0 was previously enabled, this will clear the bit.

bits.name: PWL_Pulse_En
bits.comment: This will enable the PWL pulse mode. The threshold will dynamically sweep between PWL_Min and PWL_Max at a rate depending on PWL_Pulse_Per.

bits.name: PWL0_Set_OE
bits.comment: Writing '1' to this bit will set the output enable. Reading this bit will return the current status.

bits.name: PWL0_Clr_OE
bits.comment: Writing '1' to this bit will clear the output enable.

bits.name: PWL_Set_Mux
bits.comment: Writing a '1' to this bit will swap the PWL0 and PWL1 outputs. Reading this bit will return the current status.

bits.name: PWL_Clr_Mux
bits.comment: Writing a '1' to this bit will unswap the PWL0/PWL1 outputs.

bits.name: PWL_Pulse_Per
bits.comment: This value will adjust the pulse period when pulsing is enabled.

bits.name: PWL1_Threshold
bits.comment: Average duty cycle for the Pulse Width Light 1 output. The average duty cycle is calculated as PWL1_Threshold/256.

bits.name: LFSR_Reg
bits.comment: LFSR value for PWL.

bits.name: PWL1_En_H
bits.comment: When this bit is written with '1', the PWL 1 is enabled and the output is a PRBS whose average on-time is proportional to PWL1_Threshold. This bit is cleared when either of the Force bits are written. Reading this bit will return the current state of the PWL1 enable.

bits.name: PWL1_Force_L
bits.comment: Writing a '1' to this bit will force the PWL1 to output a low value. If the PWL1 was previously enabled, this will clear the bit.

bits.name: PWL1_Force_H
bits.comment: Writing a '1' to this bit will force the PWL1 to output a high value. If the PWL1 was previously enabled, this will clear the bit.

bits.name: PWL1_Set_OE
bits.comment: Writing '1' to this bit will set the output enable. Reading this bit will return the current status.

bits.name: PWL1_Clr_OE
bits.comment: Writing '1' to this bit will clear the output enable.

bits.name: Interval
bits.comment: These 2 bits configure the interval of generating an IRQ status.

bits.name: Calendar_Load
bits.comment:
When write, command to program calendar with a new value (sec, min, hour, day, month, year, day of week) previously written in registers Calendar_LoadVal_H and Calendar_LoadVal_L. This bit is auto cleared.
'1' = load calendar timer.
When read, Calendar timer load status.
'1' = Calendar load has not finished.
'0' = Calendar load has finished.

bits.name: Alarm_Load
bits.comment:
When write, command to program alarm with a new value (sec, min, hour, day, month, year, day of week) prviously written in registers AlarmVal_H and AlarmVal_L. This bit is auto cleared.
'1' = load alarm.
When read, alarm load status.
'1' = alarm load has not finished.
'0' = alarm load has finished.

bits.name: Alarm_Enable_Set
bits.comment:
command to enable alarm. When alarm is triggered, it will generate a wakup.
'1' = enable alarm.
When read, alarm enable status.
'1' = alarm enable operation is on going, not finished.
'0' = alarm is enabled.

bits.name: Alarm_Enable_Clr
bits.comment:
command to disable alarm.
'1' = disable alarm.
When read, alarm enable status.
'1' = alarm disable operation is on going, not finished.
'0' = alarm is disabled.

bits.name: Alarm_Clr
bits.comment:
writing '1', clear Alarm triggered signal (connect to wakeup) and alarm triggered IRQ.
When read, get alarm clear status.
'1' = alarm clear operation is on going, not finished.
'0' = alarm is cleared.

bits.name: Itv_Irq_Clr
bits.comment: writing '1', clear interval IRQ.

bits.name: Itv_Irq_Mask_Set
bits.comment:
When write '1', Set interval Irq Mask.
When read, get interval Irq mask.

bits.name: Itv_Irq_Mask_Clr
bits.comment:
When write '1', Clear interval Irq Mask.
When read, get inteval Irq mask.

bits.name: Calendar_Not_Valid
bits.comment:
When write '1', mark calendar value to be not valid.
When read, Indicate if the Calendar value is valid or not.
The calendar value is not valid in case of mismatch between the calendar counter and the APB register, which is the case of wakeup the phone after shut down. This mismatch disappear after one RTC cycle or after re-porgramming a new calendar value.
'1' = not valid.

bits.name: Itv_Irq_Cause
bits.comment: Interval Irq Cause.

bits.name: Alarm_Irq_Cause
bits.comment: Alarm Irq Cause.

bits.name: Force_Wakeup
bits.comment:
Force Wakeup status. After set "Force_Wakeup" to '1' in sys_ctrl, the real force_wakeup is not set immediatly, this bit indicates when the force wakeup is really set. This bits also indicates if the interface between Calendar domain and Core domain is enabled.
'1': force wakeup set.

bits.name: Chg_Mask
bits.comment:
Charger Mask status. After set "Chg_Mask" to '1' in sys_ctrl, the real Chg_Mask line is not set immediatly, this bit indicates when the Chg_Mask line is really set.
'1': Chg_Mask line set.

bits.name: Itv_Irq_Status
bits.comment: Interval Irq Status.

bits.name: Alarm_Enable
bits.comment:
Alarm Enable Status.
Note: When calendar is not programmed, Alarm can be enabled or not.
It is suggested to clear Alarm Enable when program RTC.

bits.name: Calendar_Not_Prog
bits.comment:
'1' = Calendar has not been programmed.
This bit keep value '0' after the calendar is programmed once.

bits.name: Sec
bits.comment: Second value loaded to calendar, ranged from 0 to 59.

bits.name: Min
bits.comment: Minute value loaded to calendar, ranged from 0 to 59.

bits.name: Hour
bits.comment: Hour value loaded to calendar, ranged from 0 to 23.

bits.name: Day
bits.comment: Day value loaded to calendar, ranged from 1 to 31.

bits.name: Mon
bits.comment: Month value loaded to calendar, ranged from 1 to 12.

bits.name: Year
bits.comment:
Year value loaded to calendar, ranged from 0 to 127.
Represent year 2000 to 2127.

bits.name: WeekDay
bits.comment:
Day of the week value loaded to calendar, ranged from 1 to 7.
Represent Monday, Tuesday etc.

bits.name: Sec
bits.comment: Current Second value of calendar, ranged from 0 to 59.

bits.name: Min
bits.comment: Current Minute value of calendar, ranged from 0 to 59.

bits.name: Hour
bits.comment: Current Hour value of calendar, ranged from 0 to 23.

bits.name: Day
bits.comment:
Current Day value of calendar, ranged from 1 to 31.
Maximum number of days in each month are stored in the module, and leap year is supported, so February can have 28 or 29 days.

bits.name: Mon
bits.comment: Current Month value of calendar, ranged from 1 to 12.

bits.name: Year
bits.comment:
Current Year value of calendar, ranged from 0 to 127.
Represent year 2000 to 2127.

bits.name: WeekDay
bits.comment:
Current Day of the week value of calendar, ranged from 1 to 7.
Represent Monday, Tuesday etc.

bits.name: Sec
bits.comment: Second value loaded to alarm, ranged from 0 to 59.

bits.name: Min
bits.comment: Minute value loaded to alarm, ranged from 0 to 59.

bits.name: Hour
bits.comment: Hour value loaded to alarm, ranged from 0 to 23.

bits.name: Day
bits.comment: Day value loaded to alarm, ranged from 1 to 31.

bits.name: Mon
bits.comment: Month value loaded to alarm, ranged from 1 to 12.

bits.name: Year
bits.comment:
Year value loaded to alarm, ranged from 0 to 127.
Represent year 2000 to 2127.

bits.name: data0
bits.comment: This reg contains data to be read or written by IFC. In mono mode, data0 is before data1. In stereo mode, data0 is in left channel.

bits.name: data1
bits.comment: This reg contains data to be read or written by IFC. In mono mode, data1 is after data0. In stereo mode, data1 is in right channel.

bits.name: Enable
bits.comment:
Audio Interface Enable.
0: if AIF_Tone[0] is also 0, AIF is disabled.
1 = AIF Enabled. If AIF_Tone[0] is also '1', Tx fifo continue to fetch and distribute data from IFC when tone is enable. However, these data are not used.

bits.name: Tx Off
bits.comment:
Disable AIF Tx functions. Important: if you want to do record only, you must set this bit otherwise AIF state machine will not start.
0 = Both Tx Rx enabled.
1 = Rx enabled only, Tx disabled.

bits.name: Parallel Out Set
bits.comment:
Selects parallel audio interface connected to analog front-end.
0 = serial output.
1 = parallel output.

bits.name: Parallel Out Clr
bits.comment:
Selects parallel audio interface connected to analog front-end.
0 = serial output.
1 = parallel output.

bits.name: Parallel In Set
bits.comment:
Selects parallel audio interface connected to analog front-end.
0 = serial input.
1 = parallel input.

bits.name: Parallel In Clr
bits.comment:
Selects parallel audio interface connected to analog front-end.
0 = serial input.
1 = parallel input.

bits.name: Tx Stb Mode
bits.comment:
In parallel mode, select AIF Tx Strobe mode. Reserved in serial mode.
0 = Tx STB edge is in middle of data.
1 = Tx STB edge is aligned to data edge.

bits.name: out underflow
bits.comment:
This bit indicates if the AIF had needed some data while the Out Fifo was empty. In case of data famine, the last available data will be sent again.
Write one to clear the out_underflow status bit. This bit is auto clear.

bits.name: in overflow
bits.comment:
This bit indicates if the AIF had received some data while the Input Fifo was full. If the Fifo In is full, the newly received data will be lost.
Write one to clear the in_overflow status bit. This bit is auto clear.

bits.name: Loop back
bits.comment: Sets the loop back mode. The feature is for debug only and can not work in DAI mode.

bits.name: SERIAL MODE
bits.comment:
Configure serial AIF mode. "11" is reserved.
When mode is set DAI, the bit Master Mode should be set to '1', bit Endian_L set to '0'. Data should be sent out on falling edge, which requires either Bclk_Pol = '0' and Half_Cycle_DLY = '1' or Bclk_Pol = '1' and Half_Cycle_DLY = '0'. Bits Tx_DLY and BCKOut_Gate must be configured to '0' and '1'.
The DAI mode must NOT be modified after AIF is enabled.

bits.name: I2S IN SEL
bits.comment: Select AIF I2S input.

bits.name: MASTER MODE
bits.comment: configure AIF works in master mode (LRCLK and BCK timing signals are generated internally) or slave mode (LRCLK and BCK timing signals are generated externally).

bits.name: LSB
bits.comment: When high, the output data format is with the least significant bit first.

bits.name: LRCK Pol
bits.comment:
configure LRCK polarity.
0 = high level on LRCK means left channel, low level on LRCK means right channel.
1 = high level on LRCK means right channel, low level on LRCK means left channel.
Note: this bit should be set to '0' (LEFT_H_RIGHT_L) in voice mode.

bits.name: Rx_DLY
bits.comment:
Indicates the delay between serial data in MSB and LRCK edge.
"00" = Digital audio in MSB is aligned with LRCLK edge.
"01" = Digital audio in MSB is 1 cycle delayed to LRCLK edge.
"10" = Digital audio in MSB is 2 cycle delayed to LRCLK edge.
"11" = Digital audio in MSB is 3 cycle delayed to LRCLK edge.

bits.name: Tx_DLY
bits.comment:
configure the delay between serial data out MSB and LRCK edge.
"0" = Digital audio out MSB is aligned with LRCLK edge.
"1" = Digital audio out MSB is 1 cycle delayed to LRCLK edge.

bits.name: Tx_DLY_s
bits.comment:
ONLY for slave mode: configure 1 cycle supplementary Tx delay.
"0" = No supplementary Tx delay.
"1" = One Cycle supplementary Tx delay.

bits.name: Tx_Mode
bits.comment:
Configure mono or stereo format for Audio data out. This field is used both in serial mode or in parallel EXT mode.
"00" = stereo input from IFC, stereo output to pin.
"01" = mono input from IFC, stereo output in left channel to pin. This value is reserved in parallel EXT mode.
"10" = mono input from IFC, stereo output duplicate in both channels to pin.
"11" = stereo input from IFC, mono output to left and right channel. This mode is only used for parallel stereo interface.
if AIF works in DAI or Voice mode, always select "00" mode STEREO_STEREO.

bits.name: Rx Mode
bits.comment:
Configure mono or stereo format for Audio data in.
0 = stereo input from pin, stereo output to IFC.
1 = stereo input from pin, mono input to IFC selected from left channel.
Users can change LRCK polarity to choose mono input from right channel.

bits.name: BCK LRCK
bits.comment:
configure the ratio of BCK and LRCK cycle from 16 to 31.
Voice_Mode: "XXXX": each sample takes 16 + "XXXX" BCLK cycle.
Audio_Mode: "XXXX": each sample takes 2*(16 + "XXXX) BCLK cycle. 2 times than Voice Mode because in audio mode each sample occupies two channels.

bits.name: Bck Pol
bits.comment: if Master Mode, invert BCLK out. if slave Mode, invert BCLK in.

bits.name: Output Half Cycle DLY
bits.comment: delayed Audio output data or LRCK by half cycle.

bits.name: Input Half Cycle DLY
bits.comment: delayed Audio input data by half cycle.

bits.name: BckOut Gate
bits.comment: Sets the BckOut gating. This bit decide if AIF continue to output BCK clock after 16-bit data has been sent.

bits.name: Enable H
bits.comment:
When this bit is set, the audio interface is enabled and a comfort tone or DTMF tone is output on the audio interface instead of the regular data, even if the AIF_CTRL[0] enable bit is 0.
0 = AIF is disabled if the AIF_CTRL[0] is also 0.
1 = AIF is enabled and generates a tone.

bits.name: Tone Select
bits.comment: Select whether a DTMF of a comfort tone is generated.

bits.name: DTMF Freq Col
bits.comment: Frequency of the first DTMF sine wave.

bits.name: DTMF Freq Row
bits.comment: Frequency of the second DTMF sine wave.

bits.name: Comfort Freq
bits.comment: Frequency of comfort tone.

bits.name: Tone Gain
bits.comment: Tone attenuation. The Comfort Tone or DTMF is attenuated according to this programmable gain.

bits.name: Side Tone Gain
bits.comment:
Side Tone attenuation. The side tone is attenuated according to this programmable gain.
0000 = mute.
0001 = -36 dB.
0010 = -33 dB.
0011 = -30 dB.
0100 = -27 dB.
0101 = -24 dB.
0110 = -21 dB.
0111 = -18 dB.
1000 = -15 dB.
1001 = -12 dB.
1010 = -9 dB.
1011 = -6 dB.
1100 = -3 dB.
1101 = 0 dB.
1110 = +3 dB.
1111 = +6 dB.

bits.name: ch0_en
bits.comment:
Enable Analog GPADC channel 0.
0 = disable
1 =enable

bits.name: ch1_en
bits.comment:
Enable Analog GPADC channel 1.
0 = disable
1 =enable

bits.name: ch2_en
bits.comment:
Enable Analog GPADC channel 2.
0 = disable
1 =enable

bits.name: ch3_en
bits.comment:
Enable Analog GPADC channel 3.
0 = disable
1 =enable

bits.name: ATP
bits.comment: GPADC active period. GPADC measures the enabled channels once during each period.

bits.name: pd_mode
bits.comment:
Decide whether GPADC power down is controlled by software configured register bit or by hardware state machine generated signal.
0 = software control
1 = hardware control

bits.name: manual_mode
bits.comment:
Config GPADC working in automatic mode or manual mode. Automatic mode is the default working mode in which GPADC will periodicly poll all the enabled channels. Manual mode is a backup mode, in which user may lance a measurement of a certain channel. In manual mode there is no advanced features such as automatic clock gating nor automatic power down, so they should be configured as software control.
0 = automatic mode
1 = manual mode

bits.name: thrshd0_irq
bits.comment: gpadc ch1 thrshd 1 IRQ status.

bits.name: thrshd1_irq
bits.comment: gpadc ch1 thrshd 2 IRQ status.

bits.name: eoc
bits.comment:
GPADC End of Conversion IRQ status.
0 = GPADC not ready
1 = GPADC conversion finish.
in functional mode, this bit goes high when the first conversion of all enabled channels are done.
in manual mode, this bit goes high when the channel selected by bits "manual_ch" is done.
Note: Wait until eoc='1' to write to GPADC ctrl register if one of the GPADC channels is on-going.

bits.name: busy
bits.comment:
GPADC ctrl busy status.
1 = not ready for a new write to GPADC ctrl register
0 = ready for a new write to GPADC ctrl register.
This bit should be used to check if GPADC is well closed.

bits.name: data
bits.comment: Data of GPADC directly from Acco Analog Macro.

bits.name: thrshd0_irq

bits.name: thrshd1_irq
bits.comment: gpadc ch1 threshold 1 IRQ mask.

bits.name: thrshd1_irq

bits.name: eoc
bits.comment: clear gpadc End of Conversion IRQ.

bits.comment: gpadc ch1 threshold 0. when ch1 data cross this limit either from high or low side, an IRQ will be sent.

bits.name: thrshd1
bits.comment: gpadc ch1 threshold 1. when ch1 data cross this limit either from high or low side, an IRQ will be sent.

bits.name: gpadc_pd
bits.comment:
GPADC Power down.

bits.name: gpadc_reset
bits.comment:
GPADC Reset.

1 = Reset GPADC.

bits.name: SynopsysID
bits.comment: Enable the template module

bits.name: InEpInt
bits.comment: Enable the template module

bits.name: OutEpInt
bits.comment: Enable the template module

bits.name: InEpMsk
bits.comment: Enable the template module

bits.name: OutEpMsk
bits.comment: Enable the template module

bits.name: L_Endian
bits.comment:
Controls the big endian or little endian of the FIFO data.
Take 32 bit data 0X0A0B0C0D for Example,bit[31:24]=Byte3,bit[23:16]=Byte2,bit[15:8]=Byte1,bit[7:0]=Byte0.
"00": the order is not changed.
Byte3="0A",Byte2="0B",Byte1="0C",Byte0="0D".
"01": reversed on byte.
Byte3="0D",Byte2="0C,Byte1="0B",Byte0="0A".
"10": reversed on half word.
Byte3="0C",Byte2="0D,Byte1="0A",Byte0="0B".
"10": reversed on bit.
Byte3="B0",Byte2="30,Byte1="D0",Byte0="50".

bits.name: Soft_rst_L
bits.comment:
For the software to clear FIFO in case there is an error in communication with SD controller and some data are left behind.
Active Low.

bits.name: DATA_IN
bits.comment: Write to the transmit FIFO

bits.name: DATA_OUT
bits.comment: Read in the receive FIFO

bits.name: SDMMC_SENDCMD
bits.comment:
SD/MMC operation begin register, active high.
When '1', the controller finishes the last command and goes into suspend status. At suspend status, the controller will not execute the next command until the bit is set '0'.

bits.name: SDMMC_SUSPEND
bits.comment: SD/MMC operation suspend register, active high.

bits.name: RSP_EN
bits.comment: '1'indicates having a response,'0'indicates no response.

bits.name: RSP_SEL
bits.comment: Response select register,"10" means R2 response, "01" means R3 response, "00" means others response, "11" is reserved.

bits.name: RD_WT_EN
bits.comment: '1' indicates data operation, which includes read and write.

bits.name: RD_WT_SEL
bits.comment: '1' means write operation,'0' means read operation.

bits.name: S_M_SEL
bits.comment: '1'means multiple block data operation.

bits.name: Not_SDMMC_OVER
bits.comment: '1' means the SD/MMC operation is not over.

bits.name: BUSY
bits.comment: '1' means SD/MMC is busy.

bits.name: DL_BUSY
bits.comment: '1' means the data line is busy.

bits.name: SUSPEND
bits.comment: '1' means the controller will not perform the new command when SDMMC_SENDCMD= '1'.

bits.name: RSP_ERROR
bits.comment: Response CRC checks error register '1' means response CRC check error.

bits.name: NO_RSP_ERROR
bits.comment: '1' means the card has no response to command.

bits.name: CRC_STATUS
bits.comment:
CRC check for SD/MMC write operation
"101" transmission error
"010" transmission right
"111" flash programming error

bits.name: DATA_ERROR
bits.comment: 8 bits data CRC check, "00000000" means no data error, "00000001" means DATA0 CRC check error, "10000000" means DATA7 CRC check error, each bit match one data line.

bits.name: DAT3_VAL
bits.comment: SDMMC DATA 3 value.

bits.name: COMMAND
bits.comment: SD/MMC command register.

bits.name: ARGUMENT
bits.comment: SD/MMC command argument register, write data to the SD/MMC card.

bits.name: RESPONSE
bits.comment: SD/MMC response index register.

bits.name: ARGUMENT3
bits.comment: Response argument of R1, R3 and R6, or 127 to 96 bit response argument of R2.

bits.name: ARGUMENT2
bits.comment: 95 to 64 bit response argument of R2.

bits.name: ARGUMENT1
bits.comment: 63 to 32 bit response argument of R2.

bits.name: ARGUMENT0
bits.comment: 31 to 0 bit response argument of R2.

bits.name: SDMMC_DATA_WIDTH
bits.comment:
SD/MMC data width:
0x1: 1 data line
0x2: 2 reserved
0x4: 4 data lines
0x8: 8 data lines

bits.name: SDMMC_BLOCK_SIZE
bits.comment:
SD/MMC size of one block:
0-1:reserved
2: 1 word
3: 2 words
4: 4 words
5: 8 words
6: 16 words
11: 512 words
12-15 reserved

bits.name: SDMMC_BLOCK_CNT
bits.comment: Block number that wants to transfer.

bits.name: NO_RSP_INT
bits.comment: '1' means no response.

bits.name: RSP_ERR_INT
bits.comment: '1' means CRC error of response.

bits.name: RD_ERR_INT
bits.comment: '1' means CRC error of reading data.

bits.name: WR_ERR_INT
bits.comment: '1' means CRC error of writing data.

bits.name: DAT_OVER_INT
bits.comment: '1' means data transmission is over.

bits.name: TXDMA_DONE_INT
bits.comment: '1' means tx dma done.

bits.name: RXDMA_DONE_INT
bits.comment: '1' means rx dma done.

bits.name: NO_RSP_SC
bits.comment: '1' means no response is the source of interrupt.

bits.name: RSP_ERR_SC
bits.comment: '1' means CRC error of response is the source of interrupt.

bits.name: RD_ERR_SC
bits.comment: '1' means CRC error of reading data is the source of interrupt.

bits.name: WR_ERR_SC
bits.comment: '1' means CRC error of writing data is the source of interrupt.

bits.name: DAT_OVER_SC
bits.comment: '1' means the end of data transmission is the source of interrupt.

bits.name: TXDMA_DONE_SC
bits.comment: '1' means tx dma done is the source of interrupt.

bits.name: RXDMA_DONE_SC
bits.comment: '1' means rx dma done is the source of interrupt.

bits.name: NO_RSP_MK
bits.comment: When no response, '1' means INT is disable.

bits.name: RSP_ERR_MK
bits.comment: When CRC error of response, '1' means INT is disable.

bits.name: RD_ERR_MK
bits.comment: When CRC error of reading data, '1' means INT is disable.

bits.name: WR_ERR_MK
bits.comment: When CRC error of writing data, '1' means INT is disable.

bits.name: DAT_OVER_MK
bits.comment: When data transmission is over, '1' means INT is disable.

bits.name: TXDMA_DONE_MK
bits.comment: when tx dma done, '1' means INT is disabled.

bits.name: RXDMA_DONE_MK
bits.comment: '1' means rx dma done, '1' means INT is disabled.

bits.name: NO_RSP_CL
bits.comment: Write a '1' to this bit to clear the source of interrupt in NO_RSP_SC.

bits.name: RSP_ERR_CL
bits.comment: Write a '1' to this bit to clear the source of interrupt in RSP_ERR_SC.

bits.name: RD_ERR_CL
bits.comment: Write a '1' to this bit to clear the source of interrupt in RD_ERR_SC.

bits.name: WR_ERR_CL
bits.comment: Write a '1' to this bit to clear the source of interrupt in WR_ERR_SC.

bits.name: DAT_OVER_CL
bits.comment: Write a '1' to this bit to clear the source of interrupt in DAT_OVER_SC.

bits.name: TXDMA_DONE_CL
bits.comment: Write a '1' to this bit to clear the source of interrupt in TXDMA_DONE_SC.

bits.name: RXDMA_DONE_CL
bits.comment: Write a '1' to this bit to clear the source of interrupt in RXDMA_DONE_SC.

bits.name: SDMMC_TRANS_SPEED
bits.comment: Mclk = Pclk/(2*(SDMMC_TRANS_SPEED +1)).

bits.name: SDMMC_MCLK_ADJUST
bits.comment: This register may delay the mclk output. When MCLK_ADJUSTER = n, Mclk is outputted with n Pclk.

bits.name: CLK_INV
bits.comment: Invert Mclk.

bits.name: Enable
bits.comment: Enable camera controller,high active.

bits.name: DataFormat
bits.comment:
"00" = RGB565.
"01" = YUV422.
"10" = Compressed Data.
"11" = Reserved.

bits.name: RESET_Pol
bits.comment:
'0' = keep output camera reset polarity.
'1' = invert output camera reset polarity.

bits.name: PWDN_Pol
bits.comment:
'0' = keep output camera power down polarity.
'1' = invert output camera power down polarity.

bits.name: VSYNC_Pol
bits.comment:
'0' = keep input VSYNC polarity.
'1' = invert input VSYNC polarity.

bits.name: HREF_Pol
bits.comment:
'0' = keep input HREF polarity so data is sampled when HREF high.
'1' = invert input HREF polarity so data is sampled when HREF low.

bits.name: PIXCLK_Pol
bits.comment:
'0' = keep pix clk polarity.
'1' = invert pix clk polarity.

bits.name: VSYNC_Drop
bits.comment:
'0' = VSYNC irq always exists when Frame decimation is enabled.
'1' = VSYNC irq will drop when Frame data are dropped in decipation.

bits.name: DecimFrm
bits.comment:
"00"= All frame data will be sent.
"01"= only one frame out of two (1/2) will be sent.
"10"= only one frame out of three (1/3) will be sent.
"11"= only one frame out of four (1/4) will be sent.

bits.name: DecimCol
bits.comment:
"00"= Pixel Decimation Disabled.
"01"= Pixel Decimation 1/2.
"10"= Pixel Decimation 1/3.
"11"= Pixel Decimation 1/4.

bits.name: DecimRow
bits.comment:
"00"= line Decimation Disabled.
"01"= line Decimation 1/2.
"10"= line Decimation 1/3.
"11"= line Decimation 1/4.

bits.name: Reorder
bits.comment:
Controls the Re-ordering of the FIFO data.
In following table, for input data, right comes before left. So YUYV means V comes first.
for output data, right data is the LSB. So YUYV means V is stored in low 8-bit (byte0) of 32-bit word.
If Bit 26 is '1', byte2 and byte0 is Y.
If Bit 25 is '1', both byte2/byte3 and byte1/byte0 interchange.
If Bit 24 is '1', byte U and V should interchange. (UV bytes can be decided using bit 26).
input YUYV, output YUYV: "000"
input YVYU, output YUYV: "001"
input UYVY, output YUYV: "110"
input VYUY, output YUYV: "111"
input YUYV, output UYVY: "010"
input YVYU, output UYVY: "011"
input UYVY, output UYVY: "100"
input VYUY, output UYVY: "101"
input YUYV, output YVYU: "001"
input YVYU, output YVYU: "000"
input UYVY, output YVYU: "111"
input VYUY, output YVYU: "110"
input YUYV, output VYUY: "011"
input YVYU, output VYUY: "010"
input UYVY, output VYUY: "101"
input VYUY, output VYUY: "100"
Decimation will reorder data flow also. Input UYVY becomes YUVY after decimation. This reorder is corrected using Bit 26 infomation.

bits.name: CropEn
bits.comment:
"0"= Cropping Disabled.
"1"= Cropping Enabled.
Note: this bit should set to '0' when bit field "DataFormat" is "10" (compressed data)

bits.name: au_rcv_gain
bits.comment: Select receiver gain.

bits.name: au_head_gain
bits.comment: Select headphone gain.

bits.name: XCpu_Voc_Irq_Cause
bits.comment: 1 when Voc triggered an Irq to the XCpu.

bits.name: XCpu_Dma_Irq_Cause
bits.comment: 1 when the DMA triggered an Irq to the XCpu.

bits.name: XCpu_DmaVoc_Irq_Cause
bits.comment: 1 when the DMA programmed from Voc triggered an Irq to the XCpu.

bits.name: XCpu_Debug_Irq_Cause
bits.comment: 1 when a VoC stall state is reached during debugging.

bits.name: BCpu_Voc_Irq_Cause
bits.comment: 1 when Voc triggered an Irq to the BCpu.

bits.name: BCpu_Dma_Irq_Cause
bits.comment: 1 when the DMA triggered an Irq to the BCpu.

bits.name: BCpu_DmaVoc_Irq_Cause
bits.comment: 1 when the DMA programmed from Voc triggered an Irq to the BCpu.

bits.name: BCpu_Debug_Irq_Cause
bits.comment: 1 when a VoC stall state is reached during debugging.

bits.name: XCpu_Voc_Irq_Status
bits.comment: 1 when Voc triggered an Irq to the XCpu. (not masked, status only)

bits.name: XCpu_Dma_Irq_Status
bits.comment: 1 when the DMA triggered an Irq to the XCpu. (not masked, status only)

bits.name: XCpu_DmaVoc_Irq_Status
bits.comment: 1 when the DMA programmed from Voc triggered an Irq to the XCpu. (not masked, status only)

bits.name: XCpu_Debug_Irq_Status
bits.comment: 1 when a VoC stall state is reached during debugging. (not masked, status only)

bits.name: BCpu_Voc_Irq_Status
bits.comment: 1 when Voc triggered an Irq to the BCpu (not masked, status only).

bits.name: BCpu_Dma_Irq_Status
bits.comment: 1 when the DMA triggered an Irq to the BCpu. (not masked, status only)

bits.name: BCpu_DmaVoc_Irq_Status
bits.comment: 1 when the DMA programmed from Voc triggered an Irq to the BCpu. (not masked, status only)

bits.name: BCpu_Debug_Irq_Status
bits.comment: 1 when a VoC stall state is reached during debugging. (not masked, status only)

bits.name: XCpu_Voc_Irq_Mask
bits.comment: Write 1 to set the mask for Voc Irq to the XCpu.

bits.name: XCpu_Dma_Irq_Mask
bits.comment: Write 1 to set the mask for DMA Irq to the XCpu.

bits.name: XCpu_DmaVoc_Irq_Mask
bits.comment: Write 1 to set the mask for DMA Irq to the XCpu when the DMA is programmed from Voc.

bits.name: XCpu_Debug_Irq_Mask
bits.comment: Write 1 to set the mask for Debug Irq to the XCpu.

bits.name: BCpu_Voc_Irq_Mask
bits.comment: Write 1 to set the mask for Voc Irq to the BCpu.

bits.name: BCpu_Dma_Irq_Mask
bits.comment: Write 1 to set the mask for DMA Irq to the BCpu.

bits.name: BCpu_DmaVoc_Irq_Mask
bits.comment: Write 1 to set the mask for DMA Irq to the BCpu when the DMA is programmed from Voc.

bits.name: BCpu_Debug_Irq_Mask
bits.comment: Write 1 to set the mask for Debug Irq to the BCpu.

bits.name: XCpu_Voc_Irq_Mask
bits.comment: Write 1 to clear the mask for Voc Irq to the XCpu.

bits.name: XCpu_Dma_Irq_Mask
bits.comment: Write 1 to clear the mask for DMA Irq to the XCpu.

bits.name: XCpu_DmaVoc_Irq_Mask
bits.comment: Write 1 to clear the mask for DMA Irq to the XCpu when the DMA is programmed from Voc.

bits.name: XCpu_Debug_Irq_Mask
bits.comment: Write 1 to clear the mask for Debug Irq to the XCpu.

bits.name: BCpu_Voc_Irq_Mask
bits.comment: Write 1 to clear the mask for Voc Irq to the BCpu.

bits.name: BCpu_Dma_Irq_Mask
bits.comment: Write 1 to clear the mask for DMA Irq to the BCpu.

bits.name: BCpu_DmaVoc_Irq_Mask
bits.comment: Write 1 to clear the mask for DMA Irq to the BCpu when the DMA is programmed from Voc.

bits.name: BCpu_Debug_Irq_Mask
bits.comment: Write 1 to clear the mask for Debug Irq to the BCpu.

bits.name: DMA_SizeLow
bits.comment: Ignored on write, read as 0, so DMA_Size can be programmed in 15:0 as a byte size as long as the size in a multiple of 4.

bits.name: DMA_WSize
bits.comment: Number of 32bits Words to transfer.

bits.name: DMA_Run
bits.comment: Start the DMA transfer

bits.name: DMA_Dir
bits.comment: Set the DMA transfer direction

option.name: Read
option.comment: Read from main memory to Voc Memory

option.name: Write
option.comment: Write to main memory from Voc Memory

bits.name: DMA_B2S_En
bits.comment: Enable the byte to short mode (b2s). For read access : every byte read from the external memory is cast to short and written to the internal memory (twice as much data written than received). For write access : every short read from the internal memory is trunkated to byte and written to the external memory (twice less data written than read). In both cases the size corresponds to the number of words transfered on the AHB.

bits.name: DMA_B2S_Sign
bits.comment: For read access only (byte to short cast): define if the cast is signed or unsigned.

bits.name: DMA_Wrap
bits.comment: Set the DMA wrap mode, refer to Voc documentation for a description of Wrap transfers.

bits.name: DMA_LAddr
bits.comment: DMA Local Address: Address in the Voc memory space.

bits.name: DMA_EAddr
bits.comment: DMA External Address: Address in the main memory space.

bits.name: DMA_Single_B2S_En
bits.comment: Same as DMA_B2S_En, but valid only when the DMA_Single bit is enabled.

bits.name: DMA_Single_B2S_Sign
bits.comment: For read access only (byte to short cast): define if the cast is signed or unsigned.

bits.name: DMA_Write
bits.comment: Set the DMA transfer direction, valid only when the DMA_Single bit is enabled.

option.name: Read
option.comment: Read from main memory to Voc Memory

option.name: Write
option.comment: Write to main memory from Voc Memory

bits.name: DMA_Single
bits.comment:
When 1 start a DMA transfer in Single mode, the data is tranfered to/from the DMA_Data_Single register.
When 0 start a regular DMA transfer using LAddr and Size.

bits.name: DMA_On
bits.comment: 1 when DMA is running.

bits.name: DMA_Sema_Status
bits.comment: Read the value of the DMA Semaphore without affecting it.

bits.name: DMA_Sema
bits.comment:
Read the value of the DMA Semaphore:
If 1 is returned the DMA was available and is know taken.
If 0 is returned the DMA is not available, you need to try again to get it. The software can wait on any DMA Irq before retrying if Sema is never free manually.
Write 1 to free manually (got the semaphore and want to discard it without prgrammin a transfer.)
The end of the DMA will also free the Semaphone.

bits.name: DMA_StrideLow
bits.comment: Ignored on write, read as 0, so DMA_Stride can be programmed as a byte size as long as the size in a multiple of 4.

bits.name: DMA_WStride
bits.comment: Stride in Words (without the 2 lsb). The stride of the 2D transfer corresponds to the step from one line to another excluding the burst size (in bytes). Example : If the size is 12 bytes (3 words) and the stride is 20 bytes (5 words), starting from word position N, the DMA will transfer words at positions N, N+1, N+2, N+8, N+9, N+10, N+16, N+17, N+18, etc... If the number of lines is L this example will access a block with dimensions 3xL inside a block of size 8xL.

bits.name: DMA_Lines
bits.comment: Number of lines of the 2D transfer. Example : this corresponds to the number L in the previous example.

bits.name: DMA_Stop
bits.comment: Write 1 to this register to cleanly stop the DMA. Note : a last burst may be on going when you requested the clean stop, and no more bursts will be executed after this last burst. Because of this potential last on going burst you need to poll the DMA_On field of the DMA_Status register to verify the completion of the DMA.

option.name: Pause
option.comment: Pause VoC (no pipe flush). When paused, all events that wake up VoC (start, soft wake up, or wake up on extern event) will resume the execution from where it was paused.

option.name: SoftWakeUp0
option.comment: CPU generated event with id=0 that can wake VoC if the coresponding bit in the Wakeup_Mask register is set to '1'.

option.name: SoftWakeUp1
option.comment: CPU generated event with id=1 that can wake VoC if the coresponding bit in the Wakeup_Mask register is set to '1'

option.name: Stop
option.comment: Stop VoC and flush pipe. Used when the current task is finished (because the next task will have a different PC start). The PC start change should mandatorily be preceeded by a Stop. This ensures that no previously executed code that is still in the pipe will modify the registry during the first two instructions of the new task execution.

option.name: Start
option.comment: Wake up VoC regardless of the Wakeup_Mask setting (force wake up)

bits.name: BCPU_irq
bits.comment: Writing '1' will generate an internal pulse recorded in the Irq_Status register of the voc_ahb interface (see voc_ahb registers). If the corresponding bit of the Irq_Mask vector is set to '1', a level interrupt will be generated to the BCPU. Should be configured by VoC_core only (not by a CPU)!

bits.name: XCPU_irq
bits.comment: Writing '1' will generate an internal pulse recorded in the Irq_Status register of the voc_ahb interface (see voc_ahb registers). If the corresponding bit of the Irq_Mask vector is set to '1', a level interrupt will be generated to the XCPU. Should be configured by VoC_core only (not by a CPU)!

option.name: Yes
option.comment: VoC is running

option.name: No
option.comment: VoC is paused or stopped

bits.name: Sema_Status
bits.comment: Status of the VoC semaphore (reading this bit will not modify the semaphore).

reg16.name: DMA_Wrap
reg16.comment: Should be configured by VoC_core only (not by a CPU)! If VoC DMA is used by the CPU the equivalent voc_ahb registers should be configured.

bits.name: DMA_Wrap
bits.comment: Wrap register. 0 : no wrap, wrap_val (other than 0): the wrap_val LSB bits of the Word wrap address are at '0'.

reg16.name: DMA_Size
reg16.comment: Should be configured by VoC_core only (not by a CPU)! If VoC DMA is used by the CPU the equivalent voc_ahb registers should be configured.

bits.name: DMA_Size
bits.comment: Word Size of the DMA Transfer (number of INT32 to transfer)

reg16.name: DMA_Laddr
reg16.comment: Should be configured by VoC_core only (not by a CPU)! If VoC DMA is used by the CPU the equivalent voc_ahb registers should be configured.

bits.name: DMA_LAddr
bits.comment: DMA Local Word Address: Address in the Voc memory space.

reg.name: DMA_EAddr
reg.comment: Should be configured by VoC_core only (not by a CPU)! If VoC DMA is used by the CPU the equivalent voc_ahb registers should be configured.

bits.name: DMA_EAddr
bits.comment: DMA External Byte Address (aligned to Word address, the 2 lsb are always '0'): Address in the main memory space.

bits.name: DMA_B2S_En
bits.comment: Enable the byte to short mode (b2s). For read access : every byte read from the external memory is cast to short and written to the internal memory (twice as much data written than received). For write access : every short read from the internal memory is trunkated to byte and written to the external memory (twice less data written than read). In both cases the size corresponds to the number of words transfered on the AHB.

bits.name: DMA_B2S_Sign
bits.comment: For read access only (byte to short cast): define if the cast is signed or unsigned.

bits.name: DMA_Write
bits.comment: Set the DMA transfer direction

option.name: Read
option.comment: Read from main memory to Voc Memory

option.name: Write
option.comment: Write to main memory from Voc Memory

bits.name: DMA_Single
bits.comment:
When 1 start a DMA transfer in Single mode, the data is tranfered to/from the DMA_Data_Single register.
When 0 start a regular DMA transfer using LAddr and Size.

bits.name: DMA_Data_Single
bits.comment: DMA Data for Single Access (source or destination depending on direction)

bits.name: DMA_Stride
bits.comment: Stride in bytes of the 2D transfer, corresponding to the step from one line to another excluding the burst size (in bytes). Example : If the size is 12 bytes (3 words) and the stride is 20 bytes (5 words), starting from word position N, the DMA will transfer words at positions N, N+1, N+2, N+8, N+9, N+10, N+16, N+17, N+18, etc... If the number of lines is L this example will access a block with dimensions 3xL inside a block of size 8xL.

bits.name: DMA_Lines
bits.comment: Number of lines of the 2D transfer. Example : this corresponds to the number L in the previous example.

bits.name: DAI_Data_In
bits.comment: Data from DAI Simple interface.

bits.name: DAI_Data_Ready
bits.comment: Data ready.

bits.name: DAI_Data_Out
bits.comment: Data for DAI Simple.

bits.name: ROM_Page
bits.comment: Number of the ROM page when a ROM bigger than 1 page is defined in voc_cfg_pkg.vhd. Otherwise this register does not exist.

bits.name: stall_on_bkp
bits.comment: Enable or disable stall on hardware breakpoint.

bits.name: stall_on_branch_taken
bits.comment: Enable or disable stall when a branch is taken in the program.

bits.name: step
bits.comment: Enable or disable step mode (execute 1 instruction and stall).

bits.name: BIST_Run
bits.comment: '1' : start.

bits.name: BIST_Running
bits.comment: '0' : done.

bits.name: BIST_Status
bits.comment: '1' : fail. '0' : succeed. Valid when BIST_Running is at '0'.

bits.name: BIST_CRC
bits.comment: 16-bit CRC result of the ROM. Valid when BIST_Running is at '0'.

bits.name: IFC0_Event_Mask
bits.comment: Mask enabling the IFC0 half or whole buffer event.

bits.name: IFC1_Event_Mask
bits.comment: Mask enabling the IFC1 half or whole buffer event.

bits.name: DMAE_Event_Mask
bits.comment: Mask enabling the DMAE event (DMA configured by extern master done).

bits.name: DMAI_Event_Mask
bits.comment: Mask enabling the DMAI event (DMA configured by VoC core done).

bits.name: SOF0_Event_Mask
bits.comment: Mask enabling the SOF0 event (Soft Wake Up with Id=0 generated by writing the corresponding value in the control register).

bits.name: SOF1_Event_Mask
bits.comment: Mask enabling the SOF1 event (Soft Wake Up with Id=1 generated by writing the corresponding value in the control register).

bits.name: IFC0_Event_Status
bits.comment: '1': Triggered IFC0 event. Write '1' to clear.

bits.name: IFC1_Event_Status
bits.comment: '1': Triggered IFC1 event. Write '1' to clear.

bits.name: DMAE_Event_Status
bits.comment: '1': Triggered DMAE event. Write '1' to clear.

bits.name: DMAI_Event_Status
bits.comment: '1': Triggered DMAI event. Write '1' to clear.

bits.name: SOF0_Event_Status
bits.comment: '1': Triggered SOF0 event. Write '1' to clear.

bits.name: SOF1_Event_Status
bits.comment: '1': Triggered SOF1 event. Write '1' to clear.

reg16.name: Wakeup_Cause
reg16.comment: Logical AND of Wakeup_Status and Wakeup_Mask (show only the enabled events).

bits.name: Sema
bits.comment: VoC semaphore. If the register is read when the field = '1', the field = '0' on the next VoC clock cycle. Can write '0' or '1' in this field.

bits.name: REG0
bits.comment: Voc General Register REG0

bits.name: REG1
bits.comment: Voc General Register REG1

bits.name: REG2
bits.comment: Voc General Register REG2

bits.name: REG3
bits.comment: Voc General Register REG3

bits.name: REG4
bits.comment: Voc General Register REG4

bits.name: REG5
bits.comment: Voc General Register REG5

bits.name: REG6
bits.comment: Voc General Register REG6

bits.name: REG7
bits.comment: Voc General Register REG7

bits.name: ACC0_LO
bits.comment: Voc Accumulator Register ACC0 (lo)

bits.name: ACC0_HI
bits.comment: Voc Accumulator Register ACC0 (hi)

bits.name: ACC1_LO
bits.comment: Voc Accumulator Register ACC1 (lo)

bits.name: ACC1_HI
bits.comment: Voc Accumulator Register ACC1 (hi)

bits.name: RL6_LO
bits.comment: Voc General Register RL6 (lo)

bits.name: RL6_HI
bits.comment: Voc General Register RL6 (hi)

bits.name: RL7_LO
bits.comment: Voc General Register RL7 (lo)

bits.name: RL7_HI
bits.comment: Voc General Register RL7 (hi)

bits.name: PC
bits.comment: Voc Program Counter Register PC

bits.name: RA
bits.comment: Voc Return Address Register RA

bits.name: SP16
bits.comment: Voc Stack Register SP16

bits.name: SP32
bits.comment: Voc Stack Register SP32

bits.name: BKP
bits.comment: Voc Program Breakpoint Register. Valid when the Dbg_On mode in the Ctrl register is set to '1'

bits.name: PC_PREV
bits.comment: Previous PC value. Used to track the source PC of a branch when the stall_on_branch_taken bit in the Debug register is enabled

bits.name: LOOP0
bits.comment: Loop 0 counter value

bits.name: LOOP1
bits.comment: Loop 1 counter value

module.name: tester_chip
module.comment: This module is not inside the gallite chip. It's connected to a Chip select of EBC and placed in the testbench for simulation. It is also partially included in the FPGA.

bits.name: Stop Cause
bits.comment: Stopper regs, any write to this register will stop the simulation.

bits.name: Watch
bits.comment:
Watch regs, any write to this register trigger a display on simulation.
On FPGA the 8 lower bits are connected to the LED on the xilinx board.

bits.name: W0
bits.comment: Watch0 regs, any write to this register trigger a display on simulation.

bits.name: W1
bits.comment: Watch1 regs, any write to this register trigger a display on simulation.

reg.name: Test_Mode
reg.comment: Test Mode reg, the bits of this register control some test component or test muxing in the testbench. (some of them are also used on the FPGA).

bits.name: CLK_SYSTEM_SEL
bits.comment:
select CLK_SYSTEM used in testbench for several simulators.
'0': CLK_26M.
'1': CLK_OUT

bits.name: CLK_HST_DISABLE
bits.comment:
Disable Clk Host in testbench.
'0': Clk host on
'1': Clk host off

bits.name: RFSPI_AREO1
bits.comment:
rfspi loopback in testbench for areo1 test.
'0': normal
'1': loopback

bits.name: RFSPI_AREO2
bits.comment:
rfspi loopback in testbench with delay for areo2 test.
'0': normal
'1': loopback

bits.name: SPI_LOOP0_EN
bits.comment:
spi loopback in testbech.
'0': normal
'1': loopback

bits.name: SPI_SIMULATOR_SEL
bits.comment:
gallite chip connect to spi simulator in testbench.
'0': normal
'1': spi simulator connected

bits.name: DAI_MODE
bits.comment:
gallite chip connect to dai simulator in testbench.
'0': normal
'1': spi simulator connected

bits.name: KEYON_VALUE
bits.comment:
simulate key ON in testbench.
'0': key ON released
'1': key ON pressed

bits.name: UART_DIVIDER
bits.comment:
clock divider for uart in test_chip module.
UART FREQ = CLK_SYSTEM / (UART_DIVIDER + 2)

bits.name: AUDIO_CLK_DIV2_DIS
bits.comment:
select output audio master clock freqency (FPGA Only).
'0': 13MHz AUDIO MCLK.
'1': 26MHz AUDIO MCLK.

bits.name: UART_SEL
bits.comment:
select connection between debug_uart,uart and tester_uart in testbench.
"00": no connection.
"01": debug_uart connect to uart.
"10": debug_uart connect to tester_uart.
"11": uart connect to tester_uart.

bits.name: GPIO_SEL
bits.comment:
tester chip input reg connect to GPIO in testbench.
'0': normal
'1': tester chip input reg connected to GPIOs.

bits.name: GPO_SEL
bits.comment:
tester chip input reg connect to GPOs and TCOs in testbench.
'0': normal
'1': tester chip input reg connected to GPOs and TCOs.

bits.name: I2C_SEL
bits.comment:
gallite chip connect to I2C slave simulator in testbench by I2C_SDA and I2C_SCL.
'0': normal
'1': I2C slave simulator connected

bits.name: DAI_I2S_MODE
bits.comment:
gallite chip connect to I2S dai simulator in testbench.
'0': normal
'1': I2S dai simulator connected

bits.name: I2S_SIMULATOR_SEL
bits.comment:
gallite chip connect to I2S simulator in testbench.
'0': normal
'1': I2S simulator connected

bits.name: ANALOG_TEST_SEL
bits.comment:
analog test mode selected in testbench.
'0': normal
'1': test mode selected

bits.name: BOOT_MODE_TEST_SEL
bits.comment:
W0 reg connected as BOOT MODE pins in testbench.
'0': normal
'1': W0 reg connected as BOOT MODE pins

bits.name: DEBUG_PORT_SIMULATOR_SEL
bits.comment:
gallite chip connect to DEBUG PORT simulator in testbench.
'0': normal
'1': DEBUG PORT simulator connected

bits.name: DEBUG_CLOCK_CHECKER_SEL
bits.comment:
Clock Debug is checked with a model that count high time and low time, the counter are readable with tester chip input reg
'0': DEBUG CLOCK Checker off (and reseted)
'1': DEBUG CLOCK Checker enabled

bits.name: USB_EXTPHY_SEL
bits.comment:
0 = disable.
1 = usb external phy selected.

bits.name: ADMUX_MEMORIES
bits.comment:
0 = regular memories.
1 = all memories are now ADMUX.

bits.name: Input
bits.comment:
Input reg, connected to some lines in the testbench (currently all '1').
On the fpga board the 7 lower bits receive the DIP switches of the UI board.

reg.name: Test_Mode1
reg.comment: Control bits to enable or disable some test components of the testbench.

bits.name: Ext_M_CS_0_Destination
bits.comment: Just after the reset this bit will be set at the value of the FPGA board red switch 2.

bits.name: DEBUG_PORT_SPY_SIMULATOR_SEL
bits.comment:
gallite chip connect to DEBUG PORT SPY simulator in testbench.
'0': normal
'1': DEBUG PORT SPY simulator connected

bits.name: I2C2_SEL
bits.comment:
gallite chip connect to I2C2 slave simulator in testbench by I2C2_SCL and I2C2_SDA.
'0': normal
'1': I2C2 slave simulator connected

bits.name: I2C3_SEL
bits.comment:
gallite chip connect to I2C3 slave simulator in testbench by SPI1_DI and SPI1_CS_1.
'0': normal
'1': I2C3 slave simulator connected

bits.name: SDAT3_SEL
bits.comment:
SDAT_3 is set by SDAT3_VAL in TB.
'0': normal
'1': test mode.

bits.name: SDAT3_VAL
bits.comment: SDAT3_VAL in TB to set SDAT_3.

bits.name: RF_CLK_26M
bits.comment:
gallite chip gets an external RF 26M clock using the SDAT(1) pin in input mode
'0': Driving nothing
'1': Drive 26M RF clock to the chip

bits.name: keypad
bits.comment:
enable test for keyin 6 and keyin 7.
'0': gpio_0 and spi1_cs_0 not connected to keyin.
'1': gpio_0 and spi1_cs_0 connected to keyin.

bits.name: W2_set
bits.comment: Watch2 regs, any write to this register trigger a display on simulation.

bits.name: W2_clr
bits.comment: Watch2 regs, any write to this register trigger a display on simulation.

bits.name: Key0
bits.comment: Test reg used to simulate key press in tb.

bits.name: Key1
bits.comment: Test reg used to simulate key press in tb.

bits.name: char
bits.comment:
For simulation only: write string, char by char to this register to display it.
write 0 to trigger the ouput of buffered string.

reg16.name: TestPrint
reg16.comment:
For simulation only.
Write test number and state to display it as a string, the tester chip use a file to associate a string to the numbers.

bits.name: Test_Number
bits.comment: Write test number

bits.name: State
bits.comment: write test state

reg.name: Led_Ctrl
reg.comment: This register is not in the FPGA but on the Romulator connected to it

bits.name: Led_Ctrl
bits.comment:
Led_Ctrl regs, any write to this register trigger a display on simulation.
On FPGA the 8 lower bits are connected to the LED on the Romulator board.

reg.name: EXL_Ctrl
reg.comment: This register is not in the FPGA but on the Romulator connected to it

bits.name: EXL_Ctrl
bits.comment: '1' to enable exl on the Romulator board.

reg.name: EXL_Trigger_Set
reg.comment: This register is not in the FPGA but on the Romulator connected to it

bits.name: EXL_Trigger_Set
bits.comment: Set the EXL trigger.

reg.name: EXL_Trigger_Clr
reg.comment: This register is not in the FPGA but on the Romulator connected to it

bits.name: EXL_Trigger_Clr
bits.comment: Clear the EXL trigger.

reg.name: LA_set
reg.comment:
This register is not in the FPGA but on the Romulator connected to it
Logic Analyser register
the 16 lower bits of register LA(0) and LA(1) are common.

bits.name: LA_set
bits.comment:
LA regs, any write to this register trigger a display on simulation.
The content of this register is available on the Logic Analyser connector on the romulator board. Select the wanted register with the 2 DIP switch.

reg.name: LA_clr
reg.comment:
This register is not in the FPGA but on the Romulator connected to it
Logic Analizer register
the 16 lower bits of register LA(0) and LA(1) are common.

bits.name: LA_clr
bits.comment:
LA regs, any write to this register trigger a display on simulation.
The content of this register is available on the Logic Analyser connector on the romulator board. Select the wanted register with the 2 DIP switch.

reg.name: PXTS
reg.comment: This register is not in the FPGA but on the Romulator connected to it

bits.name: PXTS
bits.comment: When writing to this register the value is recorded by the PXTS mechanism on the Romulator. (used by SA profile or Coolprofile tools).

reg16.name: Burst Config
reg16.comment:
This register is accessible only when CRE is set to 1.
When read and write are not both in same mode, a cycle with CS high must be insterted between read and write access.

bits.name: Write_Mode
bits.comment: For write burst mode, WE must be asserted with CS in order to detect writes.

bits.name: Burst_Lat
bits.comment: Initial burst latency

bits.name: Page_Size

option.name: 4HW
option.comment: 4 half words

option.name: 8HW
option.comment: 8 half words
